The City of Wilmington is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Position Description

Serving as a member of the Parks and Recreation Department senior staff, reporting to the Director, the purpose of this position is to provide support to the department and its director by performing planning and research activities to strategically support department operations. This includes preparing and conducting research and analysis for forecasting current and future department operational and capital demands. This is accomplished by analyzing department expenditures and revenues, including the implementation, monitoring and evaluation of a service cost recovery program, managing data collection, and analyzing department functions. The analyst interacts and coordinates with department divisions; reviewing and analyzing their budget requests; providing information and recommendations to staff; preparing financial forecasts and compiling data for staff. Other duties include managing and updating the department’s business plan, managing and developing the department’s budget process, recommending policies, maintaining benchmarks and performance measures, and serving as the department’s technology advisor and software manager.

Typical Tasks

Analyze and monitor budget, including expenditures and revenue targets.
Ongoing implementation of the department’s fee schedule and cost recovery program.
Assist divisions with budgetary questions, review change requests, identify budget issues and recommend corrective measures.
Takes a lead role in completion of the department’s annual budget submittal and department business plan: compiles and reviews requests, analyzes information for trends and compliance, meets with divisions and managers on requests, reviews revenues, fees and trends, recommends funding levels.
Takes a lead role in developing performance measures: compiles performance data, supplying justifications, coordinating information with division heads/managers.
Works with Division heads and managers to research grant opportunities; assists in grant application development and submittal.
Analyzes business needs, workflows, and business processes to determine areas and opportunities for improvement. Provides recommendations based on the data and assists staff in understanding data sets and their context.
Provides consultative support to the department on technology issues; serves as the primary department liaison to RecTrac technology support, other software support teams.
Serves as a department liaison in committees and meetings.
Serves as a backup manager for the department’s webpage.
Additional duties as assigned by department director.

Qualifications

Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Public Administration, Finance, Policy Analysis or related field of study; and three years of relevant experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Other Requirements:



Knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, budget principles, leadership technique, production methods, and coordination of people and resources.
Ability to motivate and persuade individuals and groups into action.
Ability to collect, compile, interpret data with strong quantitative analysis capability.
Ability to effectively collaborate with departmental staff, build consensus, and deliver ambitious budget planning and strategy milestones.
Ability to Identify complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.
Ability to foster a culture of trust and respect.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
Excellent facilitation skills and presentation skills.

Supplemental Information

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
Exerting up to 10 lbs. occasionally or negligible weights frequently; sitting most of the time.

WORKING CONDITIONS:
This position generally requires work indoors/office setting.




Our Core Values:

INCLUSION | COLLABORATION | CREATIVITY | ACCOUNTABILITY




Our Mission Statement: Through forward-thinking policies and responsible stewardship, we are creating a better city every day with excellent core services and quality of life for all.




What we offer:

The City of Wilmington believes that employees are one of our most important resources. We offer an excellent salary and competitive benefits package to serve the needs of our employees and their families. Our benefits package includes:

Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance + many other insurance options
Excellent retirement benefits, including a city provided 4.5% contribution each pay period into a 401(k) or 457 account and automatic enrollment into the North Carolina Local Government Employees’ Retirement System
Employer-paid health & wellness clinic
Paid sick and vacation leave + 13 paid holidays per year
6-weeks paid parental leave
Paid volunteer & blood donation leave to give back to our community
Flex schedule and telework availability, depending on your position
Professional development trainings & leadership initiatives
Tuition assistance benefits

Job Title: DHTS Business Analyst (BA) / Business Intelligence Developer (BID)

Department: DHTS/ACE/Clinical Customer Solutions (CCS)

Primary Role:

The DHTS Business Analyst/Business Intelligence Developer functions as a data and reporting expert for the CCS Team that they support and is responsible in working to understand data requirements and information needs and to provide expert consultation on available tools, design options, and relevant data elements.

Key responsibilities of the BA / BID include:

Understand EHR data, information, and analytic needs to support customer stakeholders
Gather detailed business requirements and create technical documentation.
Understand operational workflows, the data generated, the fields in which they are housed, the relationship of the data to and across modules, and the relevance of the data to core entities (patient, provider, location) is crucial to the ability to produce informed data deliverables.
Develop and implement an appropriate quality acceptance testing and validation strategy to ensure completeness and accuracy of data prior to customer UAT and migration of solution into the production environment. Includes analyzing data in source systems to assess data quality.
Use all tools as relevant to develop the right solution to meet customer data needs. Available tools include but are not limited to: Epic’s SlicerDicer, Reporting Workbench reports, Radar Dashboards, Registries, Tableau, and RW SQL. This requires an understanding of the strengths and limitations of each toolset.
Understand and follow all established guidelines with respect to development, migration of data through environments to Production, and maintenance. Ensure that all data deliverables conform to established departmental standards; specifically change management processes, reporting naming conventions, and maintenance of enterprise reporting library.
Maintain impeccable communication and necessary documentation with internal and external stakeholders regarding the development status of work requests.

Level-Specific Expectations:

Level I (BA/BID):

Individual contributor representing the most common entry point for this career ladder; works under the direct supervision of Sr. BID, Team Lead, or higher.
Demonstrates knowledge specific to respective data domain(s) and module(s) and able to apply knowledge in the design and build of reporting information, and analytic solutions (albeit in consultation with others).
Foundational understanding of Epic Hyperspace functionality and underpinnings; working understanding of Epic Cogito Reporting tools – i.e. Workbench Reports, Radar Dashboards, SlicerDicer data models.
Understands one or more Epic data models and modules.
Able to work in a matrixed environment, both as a member of an “organizational home” team with shared functional skills and as a member of time-delimited multidisciplinary project teams spinning up as needed and dissolving upon project completion.
Experience: 2+ years of related business intelligence development experience is required for the Level I BA/BID role. SQL Coding experience a plus.


Level II (BA / BID):

Individual contributor representing the most common career progression path for this career ladder
Demonstrates knowledge-specific data domain(s) and module(s) but across the broader spectrum of Epic models
Demonstrates proven ability to accurately and independently apply knowledge in the design and build of reporting, information, and analytic solutions.
Proven SQL coding experience at an advanced coder level.
Collaborates as a member of a self-organizing team, in which bundles of work are scheduled, designed, built and delivered on a defined schedule.
Ability to be effective in a fast-paced environment; able to communicate with teammates clearly and at the right times; ready to give and receive help to ensure the team’s overall success.
Effective at identifying an approach to data delivery that will prove successful, and skilled at selling that approach to project team members and customers.
Engaged team player with fully aligned attitudes and behaviors and committed to achieving our enterprise mission
Experience: 5+ years for the Level II BA/BID

Required Qualifications at this Level:

Education/Training: Bachelor's degree in a related field, or four years of equivalent technical experience required if no degree.
Degree in Information Sciences, Mathematics, Statistics, or Engineering (Health Information Management) preferred.

Licensure(s) / Certification(s)

If not achieved prior to employment, certification in indicated Epic data model(s) and module(s) is required within 6 months of employment except where otherwise negotiated; certification in an indicated Epic model is a condition of employment. Relevant data model and modules will be communicated at time of employment.
Certification is required on the Epic version current at DUHS.

Skills:

Working knowledge of analytical tools and business intelligence tools (Reporting Workbench, SlicerDicer, Tableau, Power BI). Knowledge of statistical packages a plus.
Exceptional written, interpersonal, and oral communication skills. Impeccable presentation skills and the proven ability to tailor messages appropriately dependent on the specific audience.
Able to produce data flow diagrams that can easily show data lineage.
Competent in the skill to plan and facilitate meetings with diverse participants and requirements gathering and data analysis while documenting and analyzing workflows and clinical processes.
Prior healthcare experience is strongly preferred.
Experience and knowledge developing SQL scripts
Proven ability to translate business questions and requirements into data and information deliverables using relevant business intelligence tools.


The intent of this job description is to provide a representative and level of the types of duties and responsibilities that will be required of positions given this title and shall not be construed as a declaration of the total of the specific duties and responsibilities of any particular position. Employees may be directed to perform job-related tasks other than those specifically presented in this description.

Business Systems Analyst Compensation:

Base Annual Salary Range: $100,000-$110,000, commensurate with skills and experience

Annual Bonus Potential: maximum 10% of annual base salary, prorated from date of hire and subject to terms and conditions

Business Systems Analyst Position Summary:

As a Business Systems Analyst, you will review, analyze and evaluate business operations and processes to isolate problem areas, develop solutions, and identify business needs and opportunities. Additionally, the Business Systems Analyst will create system process specifications to be used to modify business systems and prepare documentation and manuals. The Business Systems Analyst will interact with clients, developers, business stakeholders, system architects and various subject matter experts.

Business Systems Analyst Responsibilities

Partner with key stakeholders to understand, elicit and document the business processes and needs through brainstorming sessions and user elicitation sessions developing both written and visual depictions of process flows.
Function as a liaison between users, business units and IT to groom requirements and facilitate User Acceptance Testing during the development cycle.
Write requirements, conduct follow-up sessions with users to refine, finalize and obtain approval of requirements from identified key stakeholders.
Design new business functionality by analyzing requirements, constructing workflow charts and diagrams, studying system capabilities and writing specifications.
Maintain system protocols by writing and updating procedures.
Provide references for users by writing and maintaining user documentation and training materials.
Serve as the ultimate facilitator between business and IT in truly understanding the business needs and plays a key role in the overall management and success of the effort through the project lifecycle.
Effectively communicate and work with team members and other departments, and business leadership.
Define project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases, and elements.
Identify areas where technology can lead to increased efficiency and productivity.
Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing professional publications, establishing personal networks, benchmarking state-of-the-art practices and participating in professional societies.
Perform other duties as may be assigned.

Business Systems Analyst Perks & Benefits:

Remote and/or hybrid work opportunities*-see below for additional information
Bonus potential
Paid Time Off-up to 18 days per year for the first 4 years, plus up to 5 sick days per year, plus up to 3 Floating Holidays per year (actual days for first year of employment is based upon date of hire)
Paid holidays
Medical, dental, vision, short and long-term disability, life insurance benefits on day 1 of employment
401k plan with immediately 100% vested employer matching contributions
Professional growth and Career Advancement opportunities
The Business Systems Analyst will be required to work onsite for the first few days of employment for equipment assignment and training. After initial training is completed, the Business Systems Analyst will be required to work two (2) days per week in the office and will be permitted to work from home the remainder of the time. The Business Systems Analyst may be required periodically to work onsite to attend work-related meetings or training in addition to the required two (2) days per week.

Job Title: IMI CIB - Business Analyst Financial Sponsors Group - New York Branch
Job Description:
Intesa Sanpaolo is the banking group leader in Italy. Assisting more than 14,6 milion of retail customers through a network of 5360 branches, it significantly supports the development of Companies and gives an important sustain to the country's growth. The Group has a selected retail banking presence in Central and Eastern Europe, the Middle East and North Africa, with approximately 1,000 branches and 7.2 million customers in 12 countries. Intesa Sanpaolo is also present in 25 countries in support of its corporate customers’ cross-border business. It is looking for new qualified profiles who want to face demanding and challenging career path with the following requirements:

Scope and Purpose

In support of the Global Relationship Manager (GRM) Financial Sponsors International, the Business Analyst will:

Support the GRM in all tasks related to developing new and expanding existing relationships with Private Equity clients
Perform due diligence on PE clients, fund structures, acquisition targets, industries, and other relevant information as required
Prepare PE and company profiles and pitches
Support in the identification of business opportunities and cross-selling of Intesa Sanpaolo’s financial products and services
Accompany and support the GRM in meeting with clients, in negotiating and structuring transactions
Manage multiple transactions/projects and communicate effectively with deal team members on status and prioritization
Coordinate between and establish strong working partnerships and routines with key internal partners including Leveraged Finance, Fund Finance, Syndication, Debt Capital Markets, Credit, Risk, Industry Verticals, KYC and Legal
Support the preparation of credit applications for LBO and fund finance deals, portfolio summaries and reviews
Perform specific administrative and operative activities related to customer onboarding and management
Demonstrate knowledge of relevant credit policies and procedures and accurately identify policy exceptions
Ensure the Branch’s KYC (Know Your Customers) and CDD (Customers Due Diligence) procedures and directives are adhered to.

The salary range for this job offer would be $ 85,000 - $ 110,000

Required Experience

Ideally 2- 3 years of work experience in a Leveraged Finance, Sponsor Coverage or Capital Markets role
Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word and PowerPoint)
Experience with Bloomberg, SEC filings, rating agency reports, and equity research reports is a plus.

Competencies Required

Good understanding of Leveraged Buyout (“LBO”) transactions and Private Equity (“PE”) fund structures
Knowledge of the Syndicated Loan Market
Strong quantitative and analytical skills, with the ability to understand and analyze syndicated deal structures and loan documentation
Familiarity with commercial, corporate and investment banking products
Resourceful self-starter, with willingness to learn, superior attention to detail, professional demeanour, and ability to work effectively on multiple projects
Teamwork attitude, with ability to interact and build healthy working relations in a culturally diverse environment
Excellent communication skills
Fluency in English

Required Qualifications, Skills and Knowledge

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or Business Administration, with an emphasis on Corporate Finance, Financial Accounting or Economics

Working Title: Population Health Management Business Analyst

Position Number: 19994

FLSA Status: Exempt

Posting Salary Range: $58,710 - $77,340

Office Location: Remote in NC


POSTING DETAILS:

Make an Impact

Trillium Health Resources is a local governmental agency (LME/MCO) in North Carolina that manages serious mental health, substance use, and intellectual/developmental disability services. Serving in 28 counties, we help individuals and their families strengthen well-being and build foundations for a healthy life.

Join our team as we empower others to live their best lives by providing access to quality healthcare. We offer a challenging, engaging work environment where staff take home more than a paycheck. Every day, we see the results of our dedication – in the smiles of children on our accessible playgrounds and in the pride on the face of an adult cooking a meal for the first time. Working at Trillium Health Resources is more than just a job; it is an opportunity to make a direct impact on the communities we serve.

At Trillium, we know that empowering others begins with supporting and developing our team. That’s why we offer competitive benefits and work-from-home flexibility so that our employees thrive outside of the office. We’re also committed to building a diverse, inclusive culture where all employees have the potential to grow professionally and personally.

What We’re Looking For

The story of health data is the lived experiences of Trillium’s members and recipients. Every data point has the ability to direct the organization in ensuring those we serve live healthy, fulfilled lives. The Population Health Management Business Analyst’s leadership and exploration of this data is central to this effort. The analyst will utilize data sets to guide leadership on population health needs, health disparities, and program effectiveness to improve performance. A deep understanding of structured query language (SQL) and Microsoft SQL Server Reporting is critical to fulfilling the position’s responsibilities. Join the Trillium team as we work to better meet the full health needs of our neighbors across 28 counties.

On a typical day, you might:

Collaborate with Trillium’s IT Informatics department to develop reporting specifications that meet business requirements and organizational needs.

Job Title: Senior IT Business Analyst - Legal Department
Job Description:
More than a career - a chance to make a difference in people's lives.
Build an exciting, rewarding career with us – help us make a difference for millions of people every day. Consider joining the Duke Energy team, where you'll find a friendly work environment, opportunities for growth and development, recognition for your work, and competitive pay and benefits.
Position Summary
The Senior IT Business Analyst - Legal Department is responsible for providing support and training for the Legal Department’s IT applications. This work includes supporting the existing processes and technologies while identifying additional opportunities for transformation. This role will be responsible for understanding the work processes of the assigned business groups and will serve as the main interface with external IT application vendors. This position requires a level of employee that is a proven problem-solver, detail-oriented and able to effectively communicate technical IT matters with individuals who are not IT experts. This person should be able to work both independently and as part of a team and communicate with Managers, Directors, VPs, and the CLO as required.

Provide business technology support for Legal Department applications across all geographic regions of the Legal Department
Complete routine maintenance, troubleshooting and training for Legal-specific applications including Wolters Kluwer Passport, Altien Legal Document Management (LDM), FileTrail and Workshare
Lead various projects and initiatives including system implementations, upgrades, enhancements, and related user testing
Act as the Single Point of Contact and liaison with multiple external IT vendors
Assist with financial reporting and data request activities
Manage the Legal Department portal page and team site as needed
Assist with vendor set up, including Third Party Risk Management process when necessary
Evaluate new IT developments and evolving business requirements and recommend appropriate system alternatives and/or enhancements to current systems
Interface with Enterprise IT on support issues outside of business use support
Serve as a customer advocate, representing needs and directions of the business unit to IT organization

Six (6) years experience in workstation desktop and mobile technology support and troubleshooting

Demonstrated IT technical skills and IT experience
Project Management and organizational experience and skills
Experience with system implementation work and system integration/migrations
Experience with resolving functional and process problems with a variety of unique business products and applications
Understanding of the business processes and functionality of a wide range of computer applications
Ability to relate technology solutions to business problems and communicate these solutions effectively to non-technical people
Experience in a utility, energy company or corporate law department
Experience with various Corporate related systems, including FileNet, CAPS, Remedy, Hyperion and PeopleSoft
Experience with Cognos reporting
Experience with financial reporting, analysis and data requests
Excellent time management skills
Ability to reason logically, analyze and evaluate data and information, and draw appropriate conclusions
Ability to forge and maintain constructive relationships and manage conflict
Strong and demonstrated focus on client service
Excellent communication skills

Job Description




This position is being re-advertised. Candidates who have previously submitted an application and were referred to the hiring manager are still being considered and do not need to reapply.

Raleigh Police Department (RPD) is currently seeking a creative, problem-solving junior-level Technology Analyst with an advanced vision and attention to detail to join our growing team of IT professionals. This position is responsible for developing, monitoring, and maintaining/supporting dashboards, analytics, BI models, and data solutions that enable RPD to make informed and timely decisions. The incumbent will participate in all phases of the software development life cycle and ensure the delivery of quality data products and BI solutions according to system specifications, quality requirements, and standards.

As a Technology Analyst at RPD, you will constantly explore, learn, and use new technologies and products. You will contribute to the adoption of future work and technologies used to support law enforcement and public safety initiatives while improving the efficiency and effectiveness of police services. To succeed in this position, you should have strong analytical skills and the ability to combine data from different sources. As a Technology Analyst, you should possess skills that include familiarity with SQL and several programming languages and knowledge of learning machine methods. Furthermore, you must be a team player with a genuine desire to contribute to a positive and collaborative work environment. Our ideal candidate will demonstrate a high degree of initiative and the ability to work well under pressure, especially when faced with tight deadlines. The position will require an after-hours response for critical incidents. This position reports to the lead Technology Analyst.

The Raleigh Police Department (RPD) is a dynamic and forward-thinking law enforcement agency committed to leveraging technology to create a safer community. With the goal of making Raleigh one of the safest cities in America, RPD is dedicated to preserving and enhancing the quality of life for all residents and workers in the city.

The mission of the Police IT unit is to provide exceptional customer service and implement technology-driven innovations that simplify processes, reduce complexity, and enhance the working environments of our staff.

The Police IT unit is a people-focused business that provides IT support and fosters positive relationships by meeting the needs of our internal stakeholders. We strive to create a seamless integration of technology within the department, ultimately contributing to the safety and well-being of the community. We embrace a culture of continuous improvement, constantly seeking innovative solutions to optimize our operations and enhance the effectiveness of our law enforcement efforts.

Through a combination of excellent customer service, business-driven technological advancements, and a people-centric approach, the Police IT unit is committed to supporting the RPD's mission and making a positive impact on the lives of the citizens we serve.

Duties and Responsibilities

Identifying, gathering, and combining structured and unstructured data from multiple data sources using ETL processes
Transforming data for ease of use in visualization and dashboarding tools
Provides custom scripting application enhancements and software development by performing technical analysis, design, development, configuration, testing, and maintenance activities
Maintains user and system security for data integrity
Collaborate with RPD staff, project teams, vendors, and IT staff as needed to fulfill the responsibilities described above
All other job-related duties as it relates to the job function or as delegated by the management team

Bachelor's degree in computer science or directly related field and two years of experience related to assignment

OR

An equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential duties of the job such as those listed above, unless otherwise subject to any other requirements set forth in law or regulation.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:



Data transformation process and ETL tools
Familiarity with data security best practices and regulatory compliance standards (Example: CJIS, HIPPA)
Broad knowledge of business intelligence, analytics, dashboards, and reporting tools used to process structured and unstructured data
Use data for effective visualizations (i.e., maps, dashboards, charts, etc.) and for application development; and supporting APIs
Ability to translate business needs into technical specifications to design, build, and deploy business analysis reports
Experience in ETL development
Experience in SQL programming and query optimization
Understanding of basic programming language concepts
Application software development and maintenance practices and methods
Developing and maintaining application code based on technical specifications
Prioritizing and managing technological processes and project activities
Active listening and critical thinking
Strong eye for detail and ability to spot inaccuracies or problems before they turn into anything serious
Ability to communicate and work with business subject matters experts and organizational leadership
Ability to communicate technical information well, both written and oral, and make effective public presentations
Provide excellent customer service principles

Business Overview

ELEMENT SOLUTIONS INC

Element Solutions Inc. (NYSE: ESI) is a leading specialty chemicals company whose operating businesses (see below) formulate a broad range of solutions that enhance the performance of products people use every day. Developed in multi-step technological processes, our innovative solutions enable our customers' manufacturing processes in several key segments, including electronic circuitry, communication infrastructure, automotive systems, industrial surface finishing, consumer packaging, and offshore energy.

Customers of ESI’s businesses use our innovation as a competitive advantage, relying on ESI to help them navigate in fast-paced, high-growth markets. The breadth of ESI’s offerings provides strong strategic value to the end markets they serve. With over 5,500 people in operating facilities across more than 50 countries, ESI has established a growing legacy of creating technological advances for customers around the globe. Our people and technical sales teams are located close to our key markets, allowing us to maintain strong customer relationships and accelerate our product innovation process.

You will be responsible for working across the HR team to ensure data accuracy, generating insightful reports, providing technical support, and driving process improvements. Your expertise will contribute to the optimization of HR operations and enable data-driven decision-making across the organization. With a focus on data integrity and process & system optimization, this role will develop strategies to provide information to HR, employees, and managers, through the development of system functionality, end-user support, and special projects.

Meet with business leaders, decision-makers, and end users to understand problem statements and gather requirements. Facilitate these discussions at both detail and summary levels.
Provide support to understand, collect and document requirements for technology solutions, including business process mapping and redesign, testing coordination, training and system post go live stabilization.
Be a thought partner to the Business, HR and IT in designing highly scalable solutions.
Lead HR system related projects, enhancements, and process redesigns, identifying both upstream and downstream processes and system changes and impacts.
Facilitate configuration evaluation and work to ensure consistent, efficient use of each module.

Use data to analyze issues, categorize defects and prioritize enhancement efforts
Maintain strong relationships based on trust and transparency with business stakeholders and cross functional teams.

Stay current with HR technology advancements, trends, and best practices to recommend system improvements. Participates in system enhancement projects by evaluating new functionalities and conducting testing.
Provides training to HR staff and end-users on HR systems functionality, best practices, and data entry protocols.

Team player with strong communication and interpersonal skills
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
The capacity to build and maintain effective relationships at various levels within the business.
Ability to build understanding and develop processes and data governance.

High level of knowledge of human resources processes as well as knowledge of end-to-end development processes.
5 years experience in the use and administration of the SAP SuccessFactors modules and functionality is required.

Req Id: 4930

How you'll contribute:
As a Business Management Senior Analyst, you'll be responsible for business operations across the Variable Annuities (VA) Asset Liability Management (ALM) team and key stakeholders across departments. This includes owning and managing risk & control policies and procedures, as well as various project work.

In this role, you'll get to:

Lead work across business partners to analyze, design, and implement solutions that drive standardization, efficiency and quality of processes, including workflows and controls.
Lead process walkthroughs with team leaders across impacted business areas, along with risk and audit.
Develop and maintain documentation of policies and procedures for VA ALM, including model risk, controls, and business continuity.
Support system and process enhancements along with key projects and initiatives.

Who We Are


Cisco IT is a transformation engine enabling people to do the best work of their lives. Our vision is to be admired as the world’s best IT organization! We lead with user experience, embrace agile ways of working, drive engineering effectiveness, and deliver with Cloud first, shift left, AI powered technology.


In Finance IT, we deliver the technologies that power Cisco’s Finance and Commercial Processes through scalable and sustainable architectures to drive profitable growth & operational efficiency. The Finance IT organization is a team of fun-loving and motivated individuals working on managing IT architecture, platforms, and engineering services for Cisco core financials area.


What You'll Do


As a Business Systems Analyst, you will play a key role in bridging the gap between business needs and technology solutions within the organization. You will analyze internal processes, data, and problems, and identify benefits from enabling new capabilities by using new & emerging digital and cloud technologies.




You Will:
Collaborate with business team to collect and document detailed business requirements.
Implement new features in a highly collaborative environment with product managers, UI/UX specialists, and software engineers.
Work closely with Scrum Master, Product owner, and global delivery teams to be a key contributor to Project releases and sprint payloads.
Collaborate multi-functionally with other IT teams to implement a coordinated digital experience.
Participate in the end-to-end software development lifecycle, adhering to the defined processes, and implementing solutions that support business needs.
Conduct solution reviews, user demos and walkthroughs with the business partners and engineering teams.
Deliver training and support to business users.
Lead and own discussions with business stakeholders, solve for key business/design decisions during the course of the program.
Facilitate cross functional IT stakeholders to arrive at solution architecture impacting cross functions and get the buy in
Document outside of functional requirements, all the non-functional requirements needed for the systems, platforms, various business scenarios outside of the given requirements.

Who You'll Work With


When you work with us, you will be part of a highly empowered collaborative “FUTURE IT” team who is passionate about the use of technology to deliver unprecedented business outcomes! You will work with business partners, internal and external partners, Cisco’s outsourced partners, and multi-functional teams.




Who You Are


You are a team member who should be able to think creatively to find the optimal solution to problems and always be ready to learn modern technology, tools, and processes.

Minimum qualifications:
7+ years of IT or relevant experience with a BS degree.
You have a strong functional knowledge and associated application knowledge in the Finance area (with a focus on Invoice to Cash, Tax and Revenue) and a grasp of the end-to-end process which feed and have dependencies with Invoice to Cash processes.
Familiar with requirements tracking, backlog grooming, requirements prioritization processes across IT/Business partners.
Process and systems background with knowledge and experience in agile project methodologies
Wear the hat of a Product owner as required.
Self-starter, who can work independently with outstanding analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Communicate effectively with both IT and Business team members.
You would be the key SME in this space who would be the face of the function to the business stakeholders.
Establish a close engagement with business stakeholders, operations, production support stakeholders with a proactive communication mind set.
Visualize any blockers during solution development and bring upfront the blockers and own and resolve the blockers.

Why Cisco


#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.


We embrace digital, and help our customers implement changes in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!


But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)


Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.


So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!


Message to applicants applying to work in the U.S. and/or Canada:


When available, the salary range posted for this position reflects the projected hiring range for new hire, full-time salaries in U.S. and/or Canada locations, not including equity or benefits. For non-sales roles the hiring ranges reflect base salary only; employees are also eligible to receive annual bonuses. Hiring ranges for sales positions include base and incentive compensation target. Individual pay is determined by the candidate's hiring location and additional factors, including but not limited to skillset, experience, and relevant education, certifications, or training. Applicants may not be eligible for the full salary range based on their U.S. or Canada hiring location. The recruiter can share more details about compensation for the role in your location during the hiring process.
U.S. employees have access to quality medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with a Cisco matching contribution, short and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance and numerous wellbeing offerings. Employees receive up to twelve paid holidays per calendar year, which includes one floating holiday, plus a day off for their birthday. Employees accrue up to 20 days of Paid Time Off (PTO) each year and have access to paid time away to deal with critical or emergency issues without tapping into their PTO. We offer additional paid time to volunteer and give back to the community. Employees are also able to purchase company stock through our Employee Stock Purchase Program.
Employees on sales plans earn performance-based incentive pay on top of their base salary, which is split between quota and non-quota components. For quota-based incentive pay, Cisco pays at the standard rate of 1% of incentive target for each 1% revenue attainment against the quota up to 100%. Once performance exceeds 100% quota attainment, incentive rates may increase up to five times the standard rate with no cap on incentive compensation. For non-quota-based sales performance elements such as strategic sales objectives, Cisco may pay up to 125% of target. Cisco sales plans do not have a minimum threshold of performance for sales incentive compensation to be paid.

You could be the one who changes everything for our 28 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, national organization, you’ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility.


Position Purpose: Help design and lead an effective vendor management program with integrated business continuity strategies. Develop strong relationships and regularly assess risks to enhance the resilience of the Centene business in the face of potential disruptions.

Ensure vendor contingency plans are in place and identify potential risks that could impact our business if the vendor couldn’t meet the SLA’s. Ensure the vendor has established contingency plans for their critical suppliers.


Conduct vendor audits to ensure compliance with the agreed-upon business continuity requirements. This may involve reviewing their plans, testing their response capabilities, and verifying their backup and recovery systems. Develop and execute corrective action and remediation plans for identified issues, risks, or vulnerabilities. Document audit results and provide recommendations to management accordingly.


Review current vendor process and identifying gaps and shortcomings, and mitigate issues. Define and manage metrics to hold vendors accountable for their BC Program.


Foster a collaborative relationship with vendors by sharing relevant business continuity information and best practices.


Ensure business continuity requirements are included in contracts.


Refine, re-implement, and manage the new vendor qualification and onboarding process. Support business partners when onboarding new vendors and help manage the vendor due diligence process around their Business Continuity program.


Participate in business reviews to discuss best practices and issues and to ultimately improve vendor performance and strengthen business partnerships. Review and revise current vendor management processes to improve efficiency and adoption where appropriate.
Performs other duties as assigned


Complies with all policies and standards
Education/Experience: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Management Information Systems, or related field preferred. 5+ years of experience required in business continuity or vendor management functions.

Under the minimal direction of a Manager, the Business Analyst (BA) is a key member of the PFM account team. The BA works directly with the client to manage the client’s third-party prescription receivables in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP). The Business Analyst performs account analysis, general ledger transactions and collection duties. Duties also include managing day-to-day client relationships, interacting with numerous internal and external parties, assisting with on-boarding of new clients, cross-training with other team members, developing and improving operating processes, monitoring system processes, recommending product enhancements and system testing.

This is a hybrid position located out of our Winston Salem, North Carolina office.
Primary Accountabilities:
Analytical:
Analyzing unapplied cash categories to identify exceptions or unusual items
Making general ledger adjustments to properly classify transactions
Identifying transactions for rebilling
Identifying transaction fees/contractual adjustments
Researching adjustments made by third parties
Resolving transaction posting discrepancies and file transmission issues
Developing processes and procedures to maintain and monitor unapplied cash balances at acceptable levels
Making recommendations for process improvements and product/service enhancements
Preparing and analyzing weekly and monthly client reports in accordance with GAAP
Administrative:
Developing and testing rules for client data (pre-process functions)
Establishing and maintaining client master file data, accounting calendars, payment association rules, payment application rules
Assisting with the development, documentation, testing and analysis of new services
Balancing to client lockbox(s), general ledger, and POS systems
Maintaining tracking log for client requests/outstanding deliverables
Assisting with preparation of client business review materials
Drafting correspondence and procedural guidelines to instruct clients regarding Inmar’s processes, policies, and procedures.
Maintaining HIPAA (Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act) compliance in all client communication.
Entering Salesforce cases for client inquires
Informing team members and management on client cases, successes, and current inquiries
Assisting client auditors in understanding Inmar’s reconciliation system and reports
Influence:
Serving as the primary point of contact for client inquiries regarding cash and claims posting
Training clients on Inmar’s reconciliation system
Discussing operational issues with clients and making recommendations for products and services to meet Client needs
Assisting clients with interpreting information
Recommending and implementing best practices for transaction processing such as business rules, tolerance settings, transaction tagging
Perform special projects and other duties as assigned by management
Required Qualifications:
At least four years of relevant experience involving customer service, computer usage, data entry and data analysis and a Bachelors’ degree in Business Administration, Accounting, or a related field; OR an equivalent combination of training and experience required to complete the essential functions/job responsibilities of the position
Knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles
Knowledge of accounting procedures on automated systems
Intermediate-level proficiency using MS Excel and MS Word
Knowledge of computer systems and report generation (AS/400 knowledge preferred)
Knowledge of servicing business accounts
Individual Competencies:
Adaptable: Responds to change with a willingness to learn new ways to accomplish work.
Teamwork: Builds relationships and works cooperatively with others, inside and outside the organization, to accomplish objectives to build and maintain mutually beneficial partnerships, leverage information and achieve results.
Analytical and Critical Thinking: Ability to tackle a problem by using a logical, systematic, sequential approach.
Communication: Giving and receiving messages and information in written, oral, and visual formats in a clear and concise way for a complete understanding of meaning and intent.
Curious: A desire to inquire and learn, to seek new knowledge and wisdom, and to listen to the contributions of others with a genuine interest to better self, the team, and the organization.
Problem Solving: Gathers and analyzes information to generate and evaluate solutions to problems, issues and challenges while weighing the accuracy and relevance of the facts, data and information.
Collaboration: Works collaboratively with others to achieve group goals and objectives.

Put a LIFT in Your Career! Hyster-Yale Group, Inc. (HYG), a world-class manufacturer of industrial lift trucks, has an outstanding opportunity for an exceptional and talented Business Analyst at our facility located in Greenville, NC. The Business Analyst will develop and sustain effective partnerships with the business in order to provide technology solutions which deliver value-added business benefits. Understand HYG & Regulatory Compliance in order to recommend and deliver leading edge solutions that are in strict alignment with all HYG and Government regulatory requirements.
Enhance performance as related to defining system requirements. Team is effectively groomed to service business community.

Varo is an entirely new kind of bank. All digital, mission-driven, FDIC insured and designed for the way our customers live their lives. A bank for all of us.

The Analytics team is lean, high functioning and impact-focused. If you can see different angles for business/product opportunities, synthesize large amounts of data, connect the dots amidst ambiguity, and want to deliver clear and measurable impact from day one, Varo welcomes you!
What you'll be doing
Develop a deep understanding of the existing business and share insights around the key metrics that drive the company
Conduct data analysis, using different analytical and statistical approaches, to make business recommendations
Analysis areas might include (but not limited to): commercial analytics, product feature analysis, portfolio credit exposure, delinquency propensity models, forecasting)
Create & automate reports, iteratively build & prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for business priorities
Work with Product, Engineering and cross functional teams to provide analytical support for ongoing needs and large initiatives
Deliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to multiple levels of stakeholders, creating visual displays of quantitative information.
You bring the following required skills and experiences
4+ years of experience in an analytical role providing business analysis, developing dashboards, and presenting results to leadership
4+ years of experience in SQL queries, Tableau (and other BI tools), and day-to-day use of R/Python is a plus
Experience articulating business questions, scripting with SQL/Python to pull data from datasets, and adapting quantitative techniques to solve complex problems
Experience with experimentation, risk assessment, measuring ROI of initiatives, and automating dashboards and reports to track business performance
Track record of successfully communicating data-driven insights
Solid understanding of statistical analysis
Distinctive problem-solving skills and impeccable business judgment
We recognize not everyone will have all of these requirements. If you meet most of the criteria above and you’re excited about the opportunity and willing to learn, we’d love to hear from you!

About Varo
Varo launched in 2017 with the vision to bring the best of fintech into the regulated banking system. We’re a new kind of bank – all-digital, mission-driven, FDIC-insured, and designed around the modern American consumer.

As the first consumer fintech to be granted a national bank charter in 2020, we make financial inclusion and opportunity for all a reality by empowering everyone with the products, insights, and support they need to get ahead. Through our core product offerings and suite of customer-first features, we aim to address a broad range of consumer needs while profitably serving underserved communities that have been historically excluded from the traditional financial system.

We are growing quickly in our hub locations of San Francisco, Salt Lake City, and Charlotte along with colleagues located across the country. We have been recognized among Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies, Forbes’ Fintech 50, and earned the No. 7 spot on Inc. 5000’s list of fastest-growing companies across the country.

Varo. A bank for all of us.

Our Core Values
Customers First

Make it Better

OpsVeda is an advanced operations management platform that leverages emerging technologies to deliver digital transformation initiatives with measurable KPIs, benefits and returns.

Our mission is to make customer operations immensely agile and profitable by empowering our customers with self-serve advanced operational intelligence, AI and ML-infused decision automation, and RPA capabilities.

We are looking for an experienced Senior Business/Systems Analysts for our Customer Success team who is focused on making technology “easy” and “frictionless” for our customers, their partners and employees.

The objective of each OpsVeda customer success team member is to:
Closely partner with customers to identify, prioritize and solve their biggest business challenges.
Improve decision-making and operation management capability for customers by leveraging real-time intelligence from all internal and external partners, systems and processes.
Maximize value of their OpsVeda investment by expanding usage across all business operations and stakeholders.

This role presents an excellent opportunity to be at the forefront of the customer experience transformation at an industry-leading software company. A successful applicant has a background executing projects implementing customer-facing technology, ideally as a senior business/systems/data analyst with a consulting company or in a business relationship management role within CPG, F&B, Fashion, Hi-Tech or Manufacturing industries.


YOUR ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

As a business analyst, you will be
A trusted advisor for customers assigned to you
Tuned-in to customer’s business happenings and results
The best partner and change agent for each business stakeholder, striving to convert them into either an OpsVeda sponsor, OpsVeda champion/super-user, or an OpsVeda user
Focused on monitoring, analyzing and expanding OpsVeda usage (measured as number of users, deployment across business functions or process areas, geographies, ingesting data from a variety of internal and external sources to deliver improved decision-making ability)
Maintaining a handy list of projects by stakeholders that were either delivered, in progress, or planned in the past/upcoming 4 quarters.
Always ready to articulate key accomplishments and potential value, risks, opportunities, challenges and timelines/commitments.
Actively converting challenging customer engagements to published customer case studies and testimonials.
Partnering with customer sponsor, project champions and OpsVeda account management team to build, execute and periodically update Customer’s OpsVeda Roadmap that is aligned with their business strategy and incorporated into their overall digital roadmaps.
Use the roadmap to define and prioritize digital initiatives/projects, seek sponsorship and mobilize resources.
Working closely together with assigned OpsVeda Systems Analysts/Developers to prioritize, design and deliver new operations management solutions, in the form of storyboards, exceptions, alerts, JUNIs and Opportunity Apps
Leveraging OpsVeda platform capability with RPA or use native integration into customer’s transaction systems (ERP, SCM, WM, 3PLs and others) to deliver autonomous supply chain and operations capability.
Always innovating and striving to grow into senior leadership roles.
WHO YOU ARE?


You possess demonstrated skills in uncovering business needs, assessing the impact of those needs, capturing, analyzing, and documenting business requirements (including paint points and opportunities for improvement)
You are able to articulate, communicate and drive implementation of the recommended business optimization and process automation solutions.
You are passionate about supply chain analytics and operational intelligence, data visualization & analysis, and use of AI, ML and RPA tools.
You are result-oriented and can work independently in a fast-paced environment.
You possess knowledge of business fundamentals and an appetite for hands-on learning OpsVeda systems and implementing predictive analytics and prescriptive actions to improve customer business outcomes.
You will design, configure and develop OpsVeda storyboards with actionable insights and collaborative workflow capability, predictive exceptions, alerts, KPIs, business metrics and trends.
Use data sets to create valuable and actionable visualizations for leadership and analysts
Excellent team working and communication (verbal & written) skills, “can do” attitude, and a great teammate in a global environment
Have strong collaboration skills with internal/external customers and multi-functional teams
Utilize underlying data sources to advise leaders on improvements to their day-to-day processes
Present findings to key decision-makers, with the ability to translate complex analysis into actionable recommendations.
YOUR QUALIFICATIONS


Must have BS or MS in Supply Chain, Business Management, Technology or related fields
Must have 3-5 years of relevant experience
Must have good knowledge in the Supply chain management domain
Proficiency in writing SQL queries for data manipulation and data analysis is preferred.
Experience conducting a deep analysis of real-world data.
Self-motivated, independent, organized, and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple business units and product teams.
Analytical mindset with the understanding to providing growth and success through use of emerging technologies.
Excellent written, oral communication, project management, and presentation skills, and the ability to present complex data and outcomes in a concise and straightforward way.
You can take business requirements, convert them into technical requirements, work with the technology team and deliver the outcome to business teams.
You have the curiosity and ability to get up the learning curve quickly to build and extend the personalization infrastructure.

The position offers a competitive base salary with generous bonus linked to performance.

If the above describes you, send your CV to jobs@opsveda.com.

The Crete United network provides our partners the resources and geographical reach of a larger organization, while preserving each partner’s local leadership and presence within their community. We are seeking a Senior Operations Business Analyst with a background in accounting or finance to join our Business Analytics team. Summary


The Operations Research Analyst works under the guidance of the Training Advisor. The Operations Research Analyst role holds significant importance in the acquisition, analysis, and training of SIGINT for our organization. Primary objective is to provide crucial support to the training team, management, and leadership by delivering insightful and unbiased information to facilitate decision-making related to training, business strategies, and policy development. Additionally, the Operations Research Analyst will actively engage in research and development (R&D) initiatives, with the opportunity to evaluate and incorporate cutting-edge technologies into DST training programs. While DST's cope encompasses all facets of SIGINT, its primary focus centers on Electronic Intelligence (ELINT), particularly Technical ELINT. This includes the capability to identify radars based on their external parameters and determine

radar types through available analysis options.


Essential Functions

Technical Analysis: Proficiency in utilizing Technical ELINT analysis tools to distinguish various radar types and ascertain their specific parameters.
Technical Data Gathering: Collect relevant technical data from various sources within the organization, including research studies, testing results, performance metrics, and other pertinent information.
Data Analysis: Applying analytical techniques to analyze gathered technical data. Your analysis will involve identifying patterns, trends, and relationships to extract valuable insights.
Decision Support: Analysis and insights will play a vital role in supporting the training team, management, and leadership in making informed decisions. By providing objective information and recommendations based on your findings, you will contribute to the development of effective training programs, business strategies, and policies.
Research and Development: Actively engage in research and development initiatives, exploring new ideas and technologies that can enhance the organization's training programs. This may involve conducting experiments, studying industry trends, and evaluating emerging technologies.
Technology Testing: Responsible for testing the latest technologies relevant to the training programs. By assessing their effectiveness, feasibility, and impact on training outcomes, you will help determine their suitability for incorporation into the organization's training initiatives.
Collaboration: Collaboration with the training team, subject matter experts, and stakeholders will be essential. By working closely with these individuals, you can gather insights, validate findings, and ensure that your research aligns with the organization's goals and objectives.
Reporting and Presentation: Prepare reports and presentations to communicate your research findings, analysis, and recommendations. These reports will serve as a valuable resource for the training team, management, and leadership in understanding the implications of the research and the potential impact on training programs.
Continuous Learning: Staying updated with the latest advancements in technology and industry trends will be crucial for your role. Actively pursuing continuous learning opportunities will enable you to enhance your knowledge and skills, keeping you at the forefront of research and development in the field of training.
Support for local unit requested flights: Support local unit requested flights by providing subject matter expertise, hardware, software, and installation assistance as needed.
Development of solutions for technical problems: Develop solutions to known technical problems using current and emerging technologies to meet client mission requirements.
Production of technical products: Produce various technical products, including capability matrices, gap analysis, technical reports, test reports, analysis of alternatives, and others to support the client's needs.
Prompt and regular attendance.



Competencies

Excellent mathematical skills with the ability to create and conduct simulation models, data reduction, and trend analysis.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software.
Proficient with statistical analysis software.



Position Type and Expected Hours of Work


This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work are primarily Monday through Friday, 8:00 am to 5:00 pm with a one-hour unpaid lunch. However, evening and weekend shifts may be required as job duties demand.


Travel


Travel may be required as requested by the customer. Traveling includes overnight stays and outside of normal working locations.


Required Education and Experience

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics or related field.
6 years of Technical ELINT experience.
SIGINT/EW experience in a SOF environment.



Preferred Education and Experience

Master’s degree preferred.
Prior related experience preferred.
Understanding of EW, SIGINT, HUMINT, and Cyber disciplines.
Veteran.



Other Hiring Requirements

Valid Driver’s License.
U.S. Citizenship.
Must hold or be able to obtain a DOD Top Secret/SCI level clearance.
Must be able to obtain a passport.
Must pass a DOT/FAA-regulated drug screening.
Must be able to pass an FAA Class 3 flight physical.





Benefits

Company-paid Health, Dental and Vision Insurance for employee.
Company-paid Short Term Disability, Long Term Disability, Basic Life and AD&D Insurance.
Supplemental Insurance: Aflac and/or Gap Insurance.
Supplemental Basic Life and AD&D Insurance.
401(k).
Accruing Paid Time Off.
Floating Holiday Time.


Applications, cover letters and resumes must be submitted online via BambooHR.

Description

The Business Analyst is responsible for the business application support for Global Medical Affairs. This role is to consult on the current state of applications and provide data-driven advice on how to expand or refine its operations to meet department needs. The individual in this role will analyze business process issues and/or problems and provides assistance to end users; conducts research on practical solutions and makes recommendations based on findings. This individual will seek continuous improvement opportunities to streamline processes and work closely with the IT organization. The individual will be engaged in new implementations and rollouts learning new tools and technologies. The analyst plays many roles, sometimes balancing several at the same time. The three primary roles of the business analyst are: consultant, support, and agent of change.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Business Relationship: Develop and maintain business relationships with functional area subject matter experts within Medical Affairs to ensure system and process needs are being addressed and maintained. Candidate must be a people person, engaging and outgoing.
Functional / Technical Expertise: Experience supporting systems for the Global Medical Affairs department, such as document management applications, publishing tools, creation of html email templates, etc. Assist with Various business application including, but not limited to Icertis, Ariba, Smart Simple.
Documentation and Testing: Work with users to gather and document requirements for new and existing applications. Perform testing and coordinate testing with end users.
3rd Party management: Coordinate activities with our 3rd party vendors of the applications that Global Medical Affairs owns.
Support: Support key users and trouble shoot issues to resolve in a timely manner.
Configuration and Administration: Administer and configure where necessary key applications for Global Medical Affairs. Including, but not limited to Icertis, Ariba, Smart Simple, be the go to person for troubleshooting and problem solving.
Vendor selection: Work closely with the process owners, sourcing, and IT to participate in RFP's, vendor demos and evaluations and final selection of new solutions.
Project Management: Prepare project plans and schedules working closely with vendors that support the applications.
Training: Provide training and develop training materials for key users.
Other: Additional tasks as assigned

Job Related Qualifications/Skills

Professional Experience

Required:
A minimum of 3-5 years’ experience in a position of equal scope and responsibility
Demonstrated analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Preferred:
Experience in the pharmaceutical or medical device industry
Experience with systems design and configuration from starting from business requirements analysis through implementation and on-going support
HTML knowledge a plus

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

Required:
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Preferred:
Knowledge of business processes and systems, especially workflow applications
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
Exceptionally self-motivated and directed as well as ability to set and manage priorities
Proficient with or able to quickly learn systems and software used by the organization
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent interpersonal skills with a proven ability to collaborate with a team

Education

Required:
Four-year degree in Computer Science/Information Technology, Business Administration, Business Management
Preferred:
MBA

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

General Statement of Duties

Forsyth County’s Health and Human Services Department is seeking to hire a Business Process Analyst. This position will work collaboratively with the various human services programs including but not limited to Behavioral Health Services, the Department of Public Health, and the Department of Social Services. The ideal candidate will conduct research and make recommendations for process improvements based on software optimization and functionality, legislative constraints and interpretation, accreditation requirements, and program limitations.
As a Business Process Analyst, this individual will serve as project manager, reengineering existing business processes and delivering a comprehensive analysis that supports suggestions for business process change. This person will create and maintain the agency's best practices, supervise the development and customization of dashboards and datasets, create presentations, serve as a subject matter expert for business processes, and play a critical role in ensuring deliverables are completed on time and accurately.
The work will emphasize on analyzing financial reports and contracts, researching state and local operating standards, strategizing ideas to improve business operations, and proposing metrics to enhance, consolidate, and integrate departmental services.



Distinguishing Features

The ability to problem-solve and think critically.
The ability to function as a team player and to establish productive professional relationships with coworkers.
The ability to oversee and direct staff activities, roundtable discussions, and presentations.
The ability to work independently, multitask effectively, and possess solid public relations abilities.
The capacity to serve as a subject matter expert (SME) for departmental procedures.
Knowledge of process improvement methodologies is required for end-to-end project management.
The ability to communicate conversations, ideas, gap analysis, and other findings to end users, management, stakeholders, and/or third-party vendors in an accurate and effective manner.
The capacity to perform a comprehensive analysis of a process and identify its root cause.
The ability to effectively communicate both orally and in writing.



Minimum Education and Experience

Four year degree in Business, Management, Computer Science or related field and four years of experience in systems analysis, project management, and/or computer system design and development. An equivalent combination of education and work experience may be considered for minimum qualification requirements.

A graduate degree in a human services field is a plus.

Valid driver's license required.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Essential duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to:

Analyzing and evaluating the department's current business processes and identifying areas for improvement.
Researching and reviewing current business processes and new IT advancements to modernize systems.
Developing initiatives based on the requirements and demands of business needs.
Managing and monitoring the performance of projects.
Collaboration with upper management, partners, customers, and technicians.
The ability to listen and quickly come to understand work processes and data flows.
The capacity to communicate clearly with users, management, and third-party partners.
The ability to clearly document conversations, ideas, workflow, data process issues, and other discoveries in writing.
Consulting with staff and/or teams regarding performance management.
Creating improvement and/or corrective action plans.
Participating in the strategic planning process.
Troubleshooting processes and errors.
Managing, designing, creating & modifying custom reports and queries.
Tracking and monitoring audits in regards to findings and corrective actions.
Providing ongoing evaluation as it relates to external partnerships and contracts.

This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing Collections Center of Excellence (CCoE) team that has developed strong partnerships and working relationships with other key functional areas. The Senior Business Operations Analyst will be an integral member of the CCoE team, and will provide thought leadership to shape the strategy of the partner Ops teams. This person will partner with junior analysts to lead the analysis, reporting, and modeling to develop and interpret information. Driving operational decision-making, policy/procedure formation, growth management, and other managerial functions are core to this role. In addition to strong analytical skills, this person will need exceptional communication skills and relationship skills in order to turn ideas into reality.

This Senior Business Operations Analyst will be part of the Business Planning & Analytics (BP&A) team within CCoE. This is a critical role that will develop new Collections MIS Tableau reporting and analytics used to improve efficiency and effectiveness, while pursuing enhanced performance across all of the Collections life cycle focused on the Member experience

This individual will report directly to the head of BP&A's MIS team and serve as a senior analyst to create, improve and interpret new MIS Tableau reporting used to drive the Credit Card, Personal Loan and Student Lending Businesses

The ideal candidate will possess an analytics background and the strategic acumen to direct a function that draws strategic insights from data using database and statistical analysis tools to inform decisions and support SoFi Technologies' overarching strategic goals relative to loss prevention. They bring new ways of thinking, data sources, technologies, and capabilities to SoFi Technologies.

What you'll do:

Responsibilities include preparing PowerPoint presentations around Collections and Recovery insights, strategy changes, opportunities, and risks to senior leaders
Must possess extremely proficient SQL skills that are used on a daily basis
Develop and optimize strategies that balance effectiveness and efficiency through a combination of impact analysis, testing and collaboration with stakeholders
Independently lead the entire project lifecycle for complex data analysis, requirements gathering and creation of new production reporting
Work closely with other MIS team members to help mentor and collaborate on improving current processes, databases, and tables stored in a Snowflake data environment
Work with our outbound Dialer and IVR inbound teams on analyzing results and creating OMNI channel reporting
Work with Operations and Technology partners to identify gaps in system/operations process flows to ensure alignment of strategy/intent, execution, policies, state legalities and regulatory guidelines as it relates to contacting delinquent customers
Build strategic relationships with operations leaders to establish shared goals and deliver analytics and insights in a fast-paced and ambiguous environment.
Enhance and develop strong team culture and provide mentorship to members of the team.
Analyze data from various sources to compile a comprehensive picture of the overall business operational performance
Develop periodic reports on a wide range of strategic and tactical analysis
Develop recommendations and prepare written and oral presentations to senior management
Ensure adequacy and accuracy of reporting by applying business knowledge and data analysis
Develop performance measurements and analytical tools to improve operations
Partner with data engineering, data science, and other analytics teams to establish data sources that serve business needs - identifying and advocating for process improvements and industry best practices.



What you'll need:

3-5 years' experience in an operational analyst position or equivalent
High motivation to drive change, eager to learn, and able to work collaboratively in a complex and fluid environment
Expertise in analyzing large datasets using SQL/Python/R and other statistical analysis packages to read test results and deliver on strategies to improve member contact and overall loss prevention
Highly proficient in building reporting using Tableau (or similar tools)
Proven analytical skills in conducting sophisticated analysis using customer performance data, bureau attributes and other 3rd party variables to solve business problems; a demonstrated ability to synthesize and communicate analysis to peers and senior management
A history of success in leading initiatives and driving results through collaboration and hands-on work
Affinity for problem solving and detailed work
Ability to collaborate well with teammates and business partners and influence business decisions
High attention to detail and strong data & root cause analysis
Strong communication skills and an ability to provide technical guidance to less technical audiences.
Proven experience analyzing, interpreting, and summarizing complex data as it relates to financial services.
BA/BS Degree required

Nice to have:

Possess a strong collections industry knowledge, including a sound understanding of relevant regulations like FDCPA, TCPA, FCRA and a working knowledge on the impact of CFPB's Reg F on the collections landscape

Experience solving data heavy problems

Collection's reporting working outbound Dialer Data

A passion for well-tested code and utilizing testing frameworks

Job Title: Business Services Analyst Assoc. - Safety Program
Job Description:
Position Description






Work, Serve, Thrive. With the City of Durham Advance in your career while making a real difference in the community you serve.
