Please review the following job description:

Consult with business leaders to align activities and solutions to business strategy. Recommend strategic solutions based on research, information analysis, and collaboration with various stakeholders and partners. Depending on workflow and type of business requirements, may provide a variety of work, such as, reporting, financial or other analysis and recommendations, change management, vendor management or communications. May be focused on one area of expertise, depending on business need. Use executive-level leadership and communications skills to accomplish work objectives, working directly with Tech leaders and their teams and functional partners (such as Risk, HR, Finance, etc).

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.

1. Serve as a key liaison between the Technology Delivery team and LOBs.

2. Collaborate with peer groups in Technology and LOBs to identify, document and communicate business needs and technology solutions.

3. Work closely with business stakeholders to understand business processes and strategies.

4. Apply in-depth knowledge within own professional discipline and a broad understanding of concepts and principles of other related professional disciplines.



5. Provide a new perspective on existing solutions to solve complex problems. Explain and interpret complex, difficult, or sensitive information.

6. Perform current state analysis of existing business systems, applications and functions.


7. Understand organizational risk requirements and ensure compliance.

8. Understand the long-term business objectives and suggest strategies to meet those objectives and introduce innovative solutions, as needed.

9. Provide assistance and support where required, including; preparation for audit, maintenance of policies and other control documentations, and ad hoc reporting and analysis.

10. Assist/coordinate pre-planning activities (e.g. business case, project estimate, project risk assessment, stakeholder analysis, draft charter).

11. Facilitate routine meetings with business stakeholders to provide updates on in-flight initiatives.

12. Attend business unit management meetings, as needed.

13. Become deeply immersed and knowledgeable about core business functions, processes and workflows associated with assigned business areas and projects.

14. Observe and ensure strict adherence to all Technology and Truist Insurance Holdings policies and standards (e.g. Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC), Change Management).

15.Coach and mentor junior level Business Analysts.

QUALIFICATIONS

Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.
Required Qualifications:

1. Bachelor degree or equivalent experience to include six years of information technology experience with significant experience in software development

2. Four years of experience as a business analyst or related role/experience, with experience in one or more of the following areas: Project Management, Business Process Management, Relationship Management, Business Operations, Quality

3. Management Experience planning, facilitating, eliciting, documenting and managing business, functional and technical requirements

4. Experience with traditional Waterfall SDLC and/or Agile/Lean methodologies

5. Ability to interact with management, business staff, ADS and DTS personnel in order to gather, compile and exchange information on work requests/project requirements and negotiate disputes effectively

6. Strong presentation, verbal and written skills

7. Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects, activities and tasks under time constraints

8. Ability to effectively interface with staff at all levels and resolve conflicts

9. Exceptional communication, teamwork and influencing skills that foster a collaborative and continuous-improvement environment

10. Excellent facilitation and organizational skills

11. Strong critical and analytical thinking and problem-solving skills

12. Demonstrated proficiency in basic computer applications, such as Microsoft Office software products

13. Understand core systems, applications and technical platforms

Preferred Qualifications::
1. An understanding of current trends in technology

2. Ability to read, analyze and interpret technical data

3. Understanding of Insurance industry

Job Description

The Principal Business Applications Analyst will lead and coordinate work related to the identification of business requirements and solutions related to the support of the specific business area for implementation of a packaged system software. Lead configuration and administration of the Packaged Software, and participate in more complex process design and system testing.

Serve as the lead for multiple application areas, including data definitions, usage and file structure, technical structure of the code and the business rules, and structure of requirements that governs the functionality of the system.

Provide technical leadership and application expertise to multiple business project teams and non project related activities and in discovery and fact finding for the full understanding and execution of all types of assignments.

Lead development of Package Software modification requirements and Interface Design Specifications. Configure necessary tables in Packaged Software to support the specific business areas. Perform analysis of current usage of Package Software and reports back to business areas regarding improvements in process, data quality and results.

Establish and maintain all Packaged Software file configuration, including highly complex tasks.

Plan and serve as a key liaison with business areas during development and implementation.

Identify best practices, communicate and implement these practices within the department.

Independently analyze business problems or opportunities; develop recommendations and solutions for those problems/opportunities, implement those solutions, and provide communications on the associated actions, business impacts, and results. Job Title: Digital Banking Business Analyst


Dept: Digital Platforms


Position Location: 1000 St. Albans Dr.; Raleigh, NC 27609

Your impact:


As a Digital Banking Business Analyst, you'll have the opportunity to use your analytical and creative problem solving talents as well as your strong interpersonal skills and IT knowledge to help lead the Digital Banking experience. You'll work closely with our Digital Banking Partners to analyze system processes, identify points of friction and enhance engagement with the membership. You'll also manage the day-to-day operations of the Digital Banking platform, identify new products and/or applications enhancements, work with vendors to implement changes and upgrades, and configuring specific software to solve problems and improve the performance of digital banking systems.





The contributions you can anticipate making:


Enhancing communication:



Communicating system outages.
Providing assistance to business units by training, mentoring, and coaching on system functionality.
Acting as a liaison between business requirements and development in the analysis, design, configuration, testing, and maintenance of system changes and upgrades to ensure optimal performance.
Creating and maintaining workflows, approval processes, and validation rules based on internal stakeholder requirements.
Translating and simplifying business requirements.




Analyzing and documenting processes:



Tracking and documenting changes for functional and business specifications.
Writing detailed, universally understood procedures for permanent records and training use.
Defining and documenting business functions and processes.




Enhancing our current practices:



Reading and interpreting system upgrade release guides and service packs to understand impact to our Digital Banking platform.
Planning changes to and monitoring the performance of Digital Banking.
Ensuring issues are identified, tracked, reported on and resolved in a timely manner.
Leading year-end testing including reviewing year-end release guides, analyzing impact to the Credit Union, reviewing with affected business units, testing functionality prior to moving to production environment, validating production environment once release has been put into production.
Validating statements to ensure accuracy.


Providing Consultation:



Serving as the liaison between business units, technology teams, and support teams.
Leading requirement analysis.
Consulting with business unit to identify, define, and document business needs and objectives, current operational procedures, problems, input/output requirements, and levels of systems access.
Working with business unit to develop strategies as technical advisor for new functionality from the core, ancillary applications, releases, and upgrades. Identifying opportunities for improving business processes through information systems and/or non-system driver changes
Assisting in the preparation of proposals to automate processes, develop new systems and/or make operational changes.
Assisting with business cases.
Delivering informative, well-organized presentations as needed.




Utilizing your expertise in system development:



Managing requirements and communication.
Utilizing your technology proficiency including office applications, automation, database systems, executing data imports, running exports, merging records, and running reports.
Analyzing the feasibility and requirements for new systems and enhancements to existing systems.
Researching and preparing reports request documents.
Attending the Change Management Board meetings, conducting change impact analysis to assess the potential implications, and communicating changes and impacts to the business unit.
Performing testing of development projects assigned; e.g. testing new functionality, user acceptance, and new system upgrades, including service packs and general releases.


Defining systems:



Modifying/changing system parameters; e.g. changes to product definitions, security groups, rate changes, coordinating system jobs, etc.
Defining new system parameters; e.g. definitions, security groups, jobs, rate changes, etc.


Managing projects:



Creating the project plan, coordinating resources, managing timelines, and enforcing project deadlines and schedules.
Identifying needs and requirements, researching functionality, and assisting with the creation and scoring of the RFP process for new systems.


To be successful in this role, you will be:



An achiever who enjoys defining his/her own goals and methods of achieving them with minimal management oversight.
A person who has a passion for innovation and building rapport with others.
A detail oriented self-starter who is excited by the opportunity to analyze and interpret processes or data, identify needs, and coordinate resources to meet them.
A visionary who enjoys rapidly translating digital client-facing solutions into reality.
A person who enjoys using his/her strong communication abilities to relay information in a way that others outside the field can understand.
Someone who thrives on the opportunity to assist with improving processes and systems.
An organized person for whom time management and the ability to establish priorities while handling multiple projects comes naturally.
Someone who has a flexible schedule which allows them to work after regular business hours if necessary.

Three years' experience working with the design or creation of innovative and emerging technology.
Experience working with relational database systems such as Microsoft SQL.
Three years' experience developing apps.
Experience working with project management.

High school diploma or equivalent. Related college degree preferred.

Quanta Technology is an independent technology, consulting, and testing company providing business and technical expertise along with advanced methodologies and processes, to utilities and others in the power and energy industries. Our mission is to provide unparalleled value to our clients in every engagement across the value chain by using advanced software and hardware, laboratories, and custom tools for a holistic approach to practical service and the most insightful thought leadership in the industry.

At Quanta Technology, our people define us. We value a company culture based on core values of diversity, teamwork, respect, accountability, innovation, and entrepreneurial spirit. Not only will you get the chance to work alongside industry thought leaders, but the opportunity to become a thought leader yourself. We’re focused on creating an environment committed to employee growth. That is achieved by ensuring a quality workspace, allowing flexible schedules, and through our training & mentoring programs. Quanta Technology is committed to an equal-opportunity workplace.

Quanta Technology is a wholly owned subsidiary of Quanta Services (NYSE: PWR), a member of the S&P 500 and the largest specialty engineering construction company in North America, serving energy companies and communication utilities around the world.

POSITION OVERVIEW

The position of Business Analyst is an important technical position within Quanta Technology and is reserved for people with the ability to use and develop technical and business development skills to support projects. Business Analysts are encouraged to build an industry presence and aim at becoming a recognized expert in their area in the future.

Business Analysts are responsible for executing work under the direction of higher-ranked engineering advisors and business leaders. These individuals must be able to perform tasks related to technical or business analysis related to their field, under moderate supervision. A typical scope of work for this position includes performing and delivering results consistent with a pre-determined scope of work, the hours assigned, and the delivery date.

TARGETED OUTCOMES

As a Business Analyst at Quanta Technology, you will work in a multi-disciplinary, entrepreneurial environment using data to provide real-world impact for our clients in the power & utilities industry with their most pressing challenges with energy transition, climate risk & resilience, infrastructure financing, energy analytics, and digitalization, among other things. You will influence many of the recommendations our clients need to positively change their businesses and enhance performance.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Support projects in preparing and delivering detailed, comprehensive technical and business consulting reports, including key findings and recommendations, to senior management and stakeholders.
Start developing project management skills.
Identify and evaluate business opportunities related to climate change mitigation and adaptation within our customer’s power and utility operations, including but not limited to resilience measures against extreme weather events, climate-related regulatory landscape, and decarbonization strategy.
Be a team player, promoting overall Quanta Technology
Follow the Quanta Technology processes, strategic directions, and vision.
Utilize data analytics tools and techniques to collect, analyze, and interpret data related to renewable energy integration and financing, and climate-related capital programs and engineering solutions.
Keep abreast of related technical developments in the field.
Support business development initiatives in the infrastructure finance and climate advisory domain.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE

Degrees in Engineering and Business Administration or another relevant field
Bachelors in Engineering plus MBA; or
Bachelors in Engineering plus MS in Industrial Engineering/Operations Research with demonstrated high level of business acumen

SKILLS & SYSTEMS

Ability to break down and solve problems through quantitative thinking and analysis.
High level of interpersonal skills and ability to work collaboratively in a diverse and inclusive workspace.
Demonstrated aptitude for solving problems in the power and utilities industry.
Programming skills in one or more of these packages: Python, MATLAB, R, VBA

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE

Bachelor’s in Electrical Engineering plus an MBA in Finance
2 years of relevant work experience
Prior experience in the power utilities industry

SKILLS & SYSTEMS

High level of business acumen, entrepreneurial spirit, and soft skills required for client-facing roles
Good presentation and communication skills with the ability to explain complex technical and business concepts to people from other fields – both verbally and in writing

LOCATION

Quanta Technology has offices in Raleigh, NC, Markham, ON, Lombard, IL, and San Clemente, CA. We offer hybrid employment that supports a blend of in-office and remote work.

WORKING CONDITIONS

Working conditions are normal for a professional office environment. Work may require overnight national and international travel.

At Quanta Technology, we offer a challenging and rewarding work environment where our employees are encouraged to grow and develop their skills. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all individuals and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other legally protected status. If you are interested in becoming a part of our team and possess the required qualifications and experience, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

JLL supports the Whole You, personally and professionally.

Our people at JLL are shaping the future of real estate for a better world by combining world class services, advisory and technology to our clients. We are committed to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry; and we support them through professional growth, flexibility, and personalized benefits to manage life in and outside of work. Whether you’ve got deep experience in commercial real estate, skilled trades, and technology, or you’re looking to apply your relevant experience to a new industry, we empower you to shape a brighter way forward so you can thrive professionally and personally.

The Company

Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL) is a professional services and investment management firm offering specialized real estate services to clients seeking increased value by owning, occupying and investing in real estate. With annual revenue of $3.9 billion, Jones Lang LaSalle operates in 70 countries from more than 1,000 locations worldwide. On behalf of its clients, the firm provides management and real estate outsourcing services to a property portfolio of 2.6 billion square feet and completed $63 billion in sales, acquisitions and finance transactions in 2012. Its investment management business, LaSalle Investment Management, has $46.3 billion of real estate assets under management.

JLL is focused on winning in the marketplace and being the industry leader, executing better than anyone else and innovating to create great products and services. We operate in an atmosphere of excellence, integrity, respect and trust. We bring a sense of teamwork, inclusion and diversity in everything we pursue. Our clients see the results as we address their needs, solve their problems and bring new ideas.

As a distinguished market leader, we offer challenging career opportunities in an exciting environment. Our future success as a firm depends on our ability to attract, develop and retain the very best people in the business.

Our values define who we are, underscore our commitment to clients and provide direction for everything we do.

Our unique culture has been recognized by industry experts and our peers. We are:
The only real estate services and money management firm listed on Forbes magazine’s “Platinum 400 Best Big Companies” list for three consecutive years
One of the “100 Best Corporate Citizens” in the United States named by CRO magazine
A “best company to work for’ in multiple locations around the globe, including Chicago, San Francisco, London, Ireland, Shanghai and Hong Kong
World’s Most Ethical Companies from Ethisphere Institute for fourteen consecutive years.
America’s 100 Most Trustworthy Companies from Forbes Magazine

This partial list of awards demonstrates our record of achievement and our commitment to fostering an award-winning culture. For further information, visit www.jll.com.

The Position

Our dedicated on-account Business Intelligence (BI) team is seeking a Business Intelligence and Analytics Senior Analyst. The role joins a wider team of BI professionals supporting a large strategic client with a key focus on producing a growing array of BI solutions (dashboards, reports, apps, AI, ML, etc.). Our top talent team is on a journey to help the client shift from reporting the news to influencing it and we’re looking for team members who enjoy a challenge, never stop learning, and work well in a fast-paced team environment.

JLL BI bands progress as: Analyst à Sr. Analyst à Specialist à Sr. Specialist

This position will work as part of the greater Business Intelligence Center of Excellence, which has a well-established commitment to continuous learning and innovation. As such, the job holder will be expected to embrace the Tableau and Alteryx external communities to ensure their skills are constantly evolving and that they embrace new analytical techniques and functionality within our core BI products.

Roles and Responsibilities

This person will be accountable for building effective analytical products, being able to transform transactional data into meaningful business insights.

The ideal candidate will be:
Motivated and effective at time management
Collaborative and works well in a team environment
An effective data visualization and storyteller
Hungry for knowledge and someone who enjoys the journey of perpetual upskilling
Brave enough to try new techniques and technology

The candidate will support the account’s vision that:
Data is Governed:
Analytical solutions should be based upon data that is defined and documented based upon business rules and consistent ways of working.
When solutions are placed into production the underlying data should be transformed to ensure it complies with the account’s Data Architecture strategy; data being defined and structured once through relational models, but then used multiple times through published Tableau Data Sources.

Data is Accessible:
Solutions should be accessible to the business users, ensuring the benefits of analytics are realized and a measurable return on investment achieved.
Analytics developed by the BI Sr. Analyst should be implemented in partnership with the Business Partnering Teams who will be responsible for supporting the business users to identify actionable business insights from the data.

Operational Processes are Efficient:
Through the knowledge and expertise of the BI Analyst the efficiency of the account’s analytics should be maximized, ensuring Dashboards are developed using industry leading techniques and constantly referencing best practice identified through the BI community.
Solution approaches and underlying design processes must be shared across all members of the BI Centre of Excellence.

Innovative Analytical Techniques are enabled:
The account’s use of BI should always be seeking innovative and new techniques that drive increased efficiency and savings through effective utilization of data.

The outcome of the BI Sr. Analyst is to enable the business to make data-informed decisions, which are based on insightful analytics. Every deliverable of the role should be able to demonstrate a measurable return on investment and improved outcomes for the client.

Major responsibilities:
Complete the technical development of BI initiatives, ensuring constant communication and partnership with the BIT Initiative Owner.
Translate complex requirements into effective business solutions, commonly in the form of a Tableau dashboard but this is evolving.
Be an active member of the internal and external BI communities to ensure continuous personal learning and knowledge sharing with other members of the BI Centre of Excellence.
Ensuring iterative design processes are followed, providing regular feedback and engagement to the business.
Actively participating in feedback to other analysts with respect to the development of new initiatives.

Desirable Knowledge & Capabilities:
A BI expert with knowledge of data visualization and analytical techniques.
Bring global experience and best practice to bust silos and ensure effective utilization of data.
Proven examples of having utilized Tableau and Alteryx to develop innovative solutions to complex requirements.
Demonstrates an ability to learn new techniques and tools, as and when identified, for example predictive modelling.
Excellent communication and presentation skills (verbal and written) with a strong understanding of analytic/statistical concepts with the ability to explain them to others.
Strategic Thinking: Ability to think broadly, create a shared vision, and embrace change as an opportunity.
Client Management: Understanding client needs and setting and managing appropriate client expectations within system, project, or contract constraints all while providing exceptional and customer service, creating trust and transparency which enables integration
Team Building: Key stakeholder and collaborators are geographically dispersed. Getting results from ad hoc groups of disparate people is critical.
Experience in agile methodology.

The BI Analyst will have demonstrated the following competencies:

Leadership
Ability to engage with colleagues across the BI Team.
Exceptional communicator.
Experienced in working within a complex, corporate, environment.
Inspires trust, adapts, and learns.
Ability to drive focus and excitement within teams.

Results Focused
Ambitious and driven to win
Consistently exceeds in performance targets and takes quick, corrective action when required.
Ensure execution, drive targeted results, focus on customers and lead courageously.

Change Agent
Instills a proactive mindset that enables the organization to anticipate versus react.
Alters the firm’s capabilities to achieve a higher degree of production.
Able to affect change in the areas around them.

Talent Developer
Inspires and motivates toward new and stretch opportunities.
Ability to transfer knowledge and expertise to colleagues that enables and empowers them to grow and develop.
Influences others, engages and inspires proactive collaboration, builds talent, communicates effectively and builds relationships. Emotional intelligence and strong presentation skills required.

Personal characteristics
The candidate will thrive in creating and maintaining relationships, be a forward thinking and creative individual with the highest ethical standards, and driven to deliver on targets that develop the business.
The candidate must possess strong communication and interaction skills, the ability to influence others to achieve results and possess the following qualitative skills which are consistent with the company’s critical success factors.
Strong communicator, both written and verbal, who’s able to communicate to all levels of a client organization.

Technical Expertise:
Previous evidence of creating innovative solutions that push the known boundaries of analytical tools such as Tableau and Alteryx.
A proven track record of delivery and understanding of the latest industry approaches.
Able to embrace innovation.
Able to clearly position the JLL brand in the industry and raise its profile a plus.

Location
East Coast, USA ideal (Charlotte, NC preferred) but anywhere in continental US is acceptable.
Virtual position optional.

Reporting relationships
The Sr. BI Analyst will report directly to the Sr. Manager of Business Intelligence and Analytics

Direct reports
While this role is not a formal management position, the Sr. BI Analyst is expected to support both their own personal continuous learning journey as well as their peers’ within the on-account BI team and the greater BI Centre of Excellence community through consistent knowledge sharing and other engagement mechanisms facilitated by the BI COE.

TITLE: BI Analyst II
LOCATION: Charlotte, North Carolina

JOB SUMMARY: Member of a Business Intelligence group responsible for implementing and managing technologies capable of handling large amounts of unstructured data. Assume responsibility for production operations activities, including load monitoring, incident management, change management, break/fix development, access management, and performance tuning. Administer applications leveraging Teradata, SQL Server, Informatica, Python, Atlassian tools (bitbucket, Jira, Service Desk), Subversion, Git, MicroStrategy, Tableau and other industry technologies and tools. Provide subject matter expertise on the usage and interpretation of business data relevant to individual business units. Conduct in-depth critical path analysis for Job Scheduling via OA/Automatic and Teradata stored procedures. Develop, recommend, and implement optimizations to meet Service Level Agreements (SLAs). Collaborate with business partners in gathering requirements, establishing definitions, translating technical requirements, and gaining approval. Engage in impact-assessment of existing loads. Design, develop, implement, and support new and existing data integration projects using a wide variety of tools. Support all scheduled and non-recurring information needs of business users. Query large datasets and tables to provide information requested by users. Actively identify solutions to enhance the existing Business Intelligence infrastructure processes and technology. Identify areas for improvement. Leverage industry best practices for the purpose of guiding team to continuously improve BI practices. Evaluate cross functional and system-to-system impacts of requirements and change requests.


EDUCATION/REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s degree, or foreign equivalent, in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering (any), or a business-related field. Four years of experience with Product operations utilizing incident and change management, scheduling tools, load management, and monitoring tools; performing SQL design utilizing SQL and stored procedures, including Teradata; and, performing ETL development utilizing waterfall and agile ETL design and development methodologies.

Job Title: QA Engineer - Institutional Investor Group Technology
Job Description:
The IIG Full Service Transformation program is a multi year, multi million dollar initiative to modernize the client experience for our participants and plan sponsors. We are expanding our full stack team to develop end-to-end capabilities for Plan Sponsors in partnership with our vendor partner. We are developing greenfield applications using modern technologies and automated process to provide stakeholders transparency into the program and delivery business value to our clients.

Core Responsibilities:

Authors the project’s Test Strategy, as warranted, during the project’s planning phase or Sprint 0 and leads design and implementation of a detailed systems test plan to ensure an accurate and effective product.

Ensures the test approach, for every functional requirement/story, is captured in the Feature Files.

Collaborates with the team to develop and execute manual End-to-End test cases , and exploratory tests following the Test Case standards.

Provides services to one large team or one to two smaller teams. Works primarily on critical business systems with large numbers of interfaces and users.

Plays a significant role in development of Product Backlog, story prioritization.

Supports Developers & Automation Engineers scripting the automated tests at ALL levels of the “test pyramid” (i.e. – Unit, Integration, and End-to-End system tests); may participate in the automated test code reviews.

Assists the Developers & Automation Engineers identifying and/or provisioning system test data using homegrown tools or vendor products.


What it takes:

Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience.

5 years of business analysis experience, including 5 yrs of relevant testing experience, both manual and/or automated testing.

Experience with testing and collaboration tools or equivalent; Jira, Cucumber, Selenium, Appium, LeanFT, Protractor.

Strong facilitation and elicitation skills, Strong interviewing, probing, influence skill, Active listener, strong interpreter and sharer of information.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Good communications skills, both written & verbal.

Special Factors

Sponsorship

Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

How We Work

Vanguard has implemented a hybrid working model for the majority of our crew members, designed to capture the benefits of enhanced flexibility while enabling in-person learning, collaboration, and connection. We believe our mission-driven and highly collaborative culture is a critical enabler to support long-term client outcomes and enrich the employee experience.

Job Description:
The Business Systems Analyst position is part of the Data, Technology and Engineering (DTE) team, supporting Quality Systems and Vertex Innovation and External Research (VIER). This position is responsible for supporting and enhancing Vertex’s Learning Management SAAS solution provided by Cornerstone on Demand.

As Vertex works to build and enhance our existing system, we are seeking an individual who will help us research, configure, test, and document solutions to issues identified by our business stakeholders. This individual will partner with other Subject Matter Experts, both internally and via third parties. They will help us ensure that we provide a system that meets the compliance needs demanded in a validated environment while continuing to enhance Vertex’s learning ecosystem via the Learning Advancement Program.

Qualified candidates will have:
Cornerstone (or similar LMS technical experience)
GxP validation experience
System Administration, integration, and configuration experience

*** this role will not include the creating or assigning of training content ***

Key Responsibilities:
Participate in day-to-day project and support work, including analysis, documentation, configuration, testing, integration, and reporting activities.
Conduct systems analysis and configuration changes in accordance with industry Systems Lifecycle (SLC) and Vertex Change Management guidelines for a validated environment
Implement product enhancements; understand and document business processes and requirements
Manage customer support cases via case management tool
Participate in reviewing, planning, testing and implementing regularly scheduled system upgrades
Develop collaborative relationships with IT peers, Talent Management, Quality Systems, external partners, and various operational teams to help design, develop, and deliver learning solutions that satisfy business requirements
Translate technically complex analysis into easily comprehensible terms
Ensure data integrity including quality, accuracy, security, and usability of employee data and related interfaces by adhering to established processes and controls

Minimum Qualifications/EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or other technical discipline
Minimum 3 years of relevant experience
Demonstrate the ability to quickly learn new tools based on conceptual understanding of technology
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
Flexibility to adapt to a continually changing and fast paced business environment
Effective communications and presentation skills
Demonstrate an understanding of good project management practices as well as the fundamentals of the System Lifecyle (SLC) and Information Technology operational practices
Familiar with Microsoft Office products (e.g. Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote)
Experience administering Cornerstone on Demand preferred
Experience with Learning Management Systems preferred
Pharmaceutical industry experience including GxP requirements preferred
Proficiency leveraging analytical languages and tools preferred (e.g. SQL, PowerBI)
Pay Range:
$80-$90/hr

Job Title: Lead Business Product Analyst - Learning Management
Job Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Lead Business Execution Consultant, to join the Talent Management and Learning team within HR Product Management! This is an exciting opportunity to help lead Wells Fargo's Human Resources transformation to deliver a new experience to our team through process and technology.

The Lead Business Execution Consultant, will deliver compelling and integrated Learning technology solutions and ensure alignment to HR Product and Portfolio Management standards and best practices. The ideal candidate is a hands-on, proven contributor with strong leadership, communication and problem-solving skills, knowledge of the project tasks required to deliver solutions leveraging both in-house and SAAS based applications.

In this role, you will:
Evolve the HR Portfolio and roadmap in partnership with Product leadership, HRIS, our HR business owners, and other stakeholders across the business.
Work closely with business partners to evaluate business requirements, plan projects, and participate in efficient development, delivery, and deployments.
Function as the highest-level internal consultant within technology and business groups by building and/or re-engineering HR technical and business processes and tools for greater efficiencies with significant impact to the business.
Lead the planning, support, and execution of configuration and testing activities.
Produce effective documentation to capture and communicate business process and requirements in the format of business process flow diagrams, data flow diagrams, data definition documents, decision trees, logic diagrams, requirements documents, and user experience flows.
Influence, guide and lead less experienced members of the team.
Lead and facilitate workshops and discussions to effectively gather requirements and achieve a detailed understanding of client objectives and desired outcomes.
Own and execute on system administration for Learning systems, including configuration, business processes, security & compliance, notifications, auditing, and data quality management.
Assist in decomposing epics into effective user stories.
Maintain task status in JIRA or similar Agile management tool.
Required Qualifications:
5+ years of Business Execution, Implementation, or Strategic Planning experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education.
Desired Qualifications:
Deep knowledge of Learning & Development business functions and products.
4+ years of HR Systems experience (including learning) preferably in a global environment with multiple integrations. Experience with Cornerstone a plus.
Experience implementing learning centric SaaS applications (previous LXP implementation/configuration preferred)
Experience operating in an Agile environment and/or strong knowledge and understanding of Agile (Agile certification a plus)
Experience leading and facilitating workshops and discussions to meet client objectives and desired outcomes.
Experience driving the requirements process with both technical and business partners.
Experience interpreting business and technical needs and translating them into user stories.
Experience managing complex technology projects and presenting to multiple levels of management.
Ability to operate as part of cross functional work streams to execute projects with quality and on-time.
Knowledge of HR business processes.
Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.
Strong organizational, multi-tasking and prioritization skills
Ability to prioritize work, meet deadlines, achieve goals, and work under pressure in a dynamic and complex environment.
Job Expectations:
Ability to travel up to 5% of the time.
This position is not eligible for Visa Sponsorship
Office locations: Charlotte, NC; Minneapolis, MN
Must work on-site at posted locations, in the office at least 3 days/week.

Relay, a Raleigh-based tech startup, is looking to change the way we communicate. We're on a $mission that matters. Frontline workers are the lifeblood of our economy and we're building the cloud platform that makes them better, faster, and safer than ever before. Our cloud solution offers a data-driven approach to frontline work through real-time communications, real-time location information, and powerful real-time data and insights.

Here at Relay, we've designed, built, and launched an entirely new product category – a simple, rugged, internet-enabled smart device and all the software that runs it – and we're disrupting the handheld radio industry for B2B clients and frontline workers across multiple industries and verticals. We've achieved proven product-market fit with a user experience that solves real-world customer pain and unlocks new capabilities and are expanding our marketing team to support this growth. We are currently seeking a Business Analyst who will thrive in a dynamic start-up environment.

As a Business Analyst, Sales & Marketing you will play a crucial role in driving business intelligence around growth opportunities. Reporting to the Senior Director, Revenue Operations, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Sales, Marketing, and Finance to deliver insights around performance and growth opportunities. Your primary focus will be on delivering Sales performance and Growth opportunity insights to inform business decision making. If you have a strong analytical mindset, excellent organizational skills, and a passion for driving sales excellence, this is an exciting opportunity to contribute to Relay's growth in a revenue enabling role.


Responsibilities:


Data Analysis and Reporting:

Gather, analyze, and interpret marketing and sales data to provide actionable insights and recommendations for revenue growth strategy and performance improvements.
Develop and maintain revenue dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide visibility to sales leadership, enabling better decision making through easier access to critical data sets.
Conduct regular data audits to ensure data accuracy and integrity within the CRM system.
Collaborate with Revenue Operations team to implement processes and CRM systems changes to capture missing data or correct inaccuracies.
Collaborate with sales leadership to develop accurate sales forecasts and pipeline projections.
Monitor and analyze pipeline health, conversion rates, and sales cycle length to identify trends and areas for improvement.
Support sales and marketing leadership with other data-driven insights as needed

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Analytics, Business Administration, Sales, Marketing, or a related field.
2+ years of proven experience in business analytics, or a similar role within a SaaS or technology company.
Proficiency in SQL
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and present data effectively.
Proficiency in CRM systems (e.g., Zoho) and sales analytics tools.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively across cross-functional teams.
Detail-oriented with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines.
Strong problem-solving abilities with a proactive and solution-oriented mindset.
Understanding of marketing and sales methodologies, processes, and best practices.
Familiarity with SaaS business models and the technology industry is a plus.

Position Summary:

The Business Development Analyst is responsible for conducting market research, identifying new business opportunities, developing strategic plans to achieve revenue targets and optimizing our business processes.

Duties/Responsibilities:

Opportunity Identification:
Proactively identify and assess new business opportunities that align with the company's growth objectives.
Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to evaluate and prioritize potential business ventures.
Development of Business Plans:
Assist in the development and refinement of comprehensive business plans for the new opportunities, including the identification of key business drivers, and competitive advantages.
Conduct comprehensive market research to identify potential clients, customer needs, and industry trends.
Analyze market data and competitive intelligence to develop actionable insights.
Conduct financial analysis to project revenue, expenses, and profitability for proposed business initiatives.
Develop financial modeling, including forecasting and return on investment (ROI) assessments to support decision-making.
Assess potential risks associated with new business opportunities and develop risk mitigation strategies.
Development of Business Proposal:
Work closely with Sales to develop compelling proposals, presentations, and sales material.
Identify and leverage opportunities to upsell or cross-sell to existing Global Solutions clients.
Business Strategy Development:
Support the Director of Global Business Development with the development and refinement of business strategies and action plans.
Regularly present progress reports and insights for the ongoing business development initiatives to senior management.
Identify new areas for growth, exploring potential partnerships and alliances.
Build and maintain strong relationships with internal teams and external partners to foster collaboration and support the execution of business plans.
Industry Events and Networking:
Represent the company at industry conferences, events, and networking opportunities to promote brand awareness and foster potential partnerships.

Skills/Abilities:

Strong analytical and financial modeling skills with the ability to interpret data and market trends effectively.
Excellent verbal and written communication, presentation, and negotiation skills to convey complex information to diverse audiences.
Strategic thinker with the ability to identify opportunities, anticipate challenges, and develop innovative solutions.
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and lead projects to completion.
Highly adaptable and open to change in a dynamic business environment.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.

Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in business, finance and/or engineering, or a related field.
Desired 1-2 years of experience in business development, market research, strategic planning, or related roles preferably related to direct reduction, chemical, or steel industry.

Travel Requirements:

Up to 20% International and Domestic

Physical Requirements:

Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
Must be able to lift 20 pounds at a time.

About Wilmington Health

Since 1971, Wilmington Health has been committed to the care and health of our community in Wilmington as well as all of Southeastern North Carolina. Wilmington Health is structured as a multi-specialty medical practice with primary care providers integrated into the system. In this way, Wilmington Health is able to provide a comprehensive and coordinated approach to the care of all our patients. Wilmington Health is committed to using collaborative, evidence-based medicine in providing the highest quality of care to the patients we serve.

Purpose:

Wilmington Health is looking for a Business Analyst to support ACO operations. This position requires an in-depth understanding of healthcare data including provider, clinical and member data. In this role, the Analyst is charged with developing high level analyses, recommending strategic actions to be taken based on data and presenting opportunities to support internal and external initiatives in support of strategic efforts.

Essential Duties/Responsibilities:

Incorporate large amounts of healthcare data to discover patterns, trends, and relationships to produce actionable insights which can inform strategy and identify cost reduction, quality improvement, and risk capture.
Create and maintain documentation of operational practices used in the development of analysis and reports.
Present thoughtful analytical summaries to internal and external stakeholders, using strong written and verbal communication.
Actively participate in developing strategies and targets for scaling business and targeting initiatives that improve quality, improve patient satisfaction and control healthcare costs.
Work with clinical and operational leaders to identify, analyze, research, select, modify, or update population health solutions.
Assists with or facilitates meetings, conference calls, web meetings, presentations, and other communication methods.
Conducts or facilitates drill down and other ad hoc analyses of population healthcare data.
Writes reports for use by other team members and leaders to support population health management.
Proficient in use of Excel and SQL and SAS


Other Duties:

Appears for work on time and attends meetings as required
Maintains strict confidentiality
Communicates courteously and appropriately with patients, physicians, and coworkers
Other duties specified by manager


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:


Strong organizational skills
Ability to manage time-sensitive projects
Effective communication skills
Ability to work independently and take initiative in addressing concerns and issues
Proficient with computer-based applications such as MS Office, Adobe, registries/medical databases, claims data, population health benchmarking and electronic health records

QUALIFICATIONS

Required

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience
1-2 years of population health experience

Job Title: Security Operations Center Operator - Security Threat Analyst NOT CYBER
Job Description:
This is a GSOC, Physical Security Operations center; we are NOT a Cyber SOC.

We are growing our Global Security Center team from the ground up. Kellington Protection is excited to have the opportunity to hire career-devoted individuals who will staff a 24/7 Security Operations Center located in Carry, NC. We are seeking Security Center Operators & Security Analysts in our Global Security Operations center for our client with a global footprint. The 24/7/365 Noram Security Center (NSC) is in Cary, NC.

The GSOC Security will be responsible for monitoring the safety and security of employees and assets throughout the world our client, a prestigious high-tech international corporation.

The Security Operations Center will be staffed 24/7/365. A shift supervisor, operators, and a Threat Analyst, all under the guidance of the Vendor Manger or Sr. Manager assigned by the client. SOC operators use a variety of tools and platforms to conduct operational oversight of the entire world. Coordinating, alarm responses, physical security, surveillance cameras, incident investigation, readiness audits, technical failures, facilities issues, and emergency responses. GSOC team will also monitors open-source media and business intelligence sources to detect any potential threats and/or conditions that could adversely impact client operations, assets, and personnel.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities of Operators:

CCTV and alarm monitoring;
Dispatching;
Reviewing Incident Reports and preparing well-written, coherent, summarized information disbursement to stakeholders;
Conducting video reviews of incidents;
Acting as the hub for all emergency and routine communications;
Overseeing access control and credentialing;
Creating and maintaining Incident Reports;
Submitting work orders and maintenance requests.
Monitoring open-source media and business intelligence sources to detect any potential threats and/or conditions that could adversely impact client operations, assets, and personnel.
Triaging and liaising with security, law enforcement, and emergency teams in response to events;
Producing and daily and weekly summary reports;
Working collaboratively with the Security Leadership Team to prepare for, respond to, and recover from all incidents and crisis events that may impact business operations; and
Ensuring proper escalation of events/issues to appropriate stakeholders.

Required:

A criminal record devoid of felonies or serious misdemeanors;
Excellent knowledge of Windows or Mac computer operation, including Microsoft Office or G-Suite products;
Ability to work and multitask in a fast-paced work environment, across multiple platforms, departments, time zones, and cultures;
Ability to work calmly and accurately in crisis situations;
Ability to assess and evaluate information and situations quickly and accurately, and to identify critical issues;
Excellent oral and written communication skills in English;
Excellent customer service and phone skills;
Focused, organized, and detail-oriented;
A desire to work as a dependable, participating team player with a positive attitude;
Authorization to work in the United States;
HS Diploma or GED; and
A willingness to work varied shift hours, including overnights, weekends, and holidays. Schedules generally rotate monthly between Daylight-Afternoon-Night shifts.

Preferred/Plus:

Degree or relevant experience in lieu of a degree is preferred.
Customer service experience is preferred.
Experience with threat assessment/analysis is a plus.
Military experience is a plus.
Fluency in additional languages is a plus.
Working knowledge of security systems for access control, CCTV, employee/guest/vendor badging, alarm monitoring, and dispatch, is a plus.
Experience with different communication platforms and technologies, including 2-way radios, IP video surveillance, and computer databases, is a plus.

Job Description:

Department
Enterprise Application Services


About the Department
Enterprise Application Services (EAS) is in the Office of Information Technology (OIT) division at North Carolina State University. EAS is responsible for the design, implementation, operation, enhancement & maintenance of the University’s enterprise business applications. This includes: development, operation & maintenance of all enterprise administrative systems (Advancement, Financials, HR, Portal and Student Information Systems, REPORTER, etc.), configuration management, maintenance, enhancements, and application integration.


Essential Job Duties
This senior level position on the Enterprise Information Management & Analytics (EIMA) team is primarily responsible for the following:
Primary support and platform administrator for the SAS enterprise environments (frontend) including installation, configuration, security design, configuration management/migrations, and patches/upgrades (not responsible for OS support)
Interface with the Application Infrastructure Services(AIS) team for server (backend) related issues
Lead technical efforts of SAS enterprise platform support and solutions, including monitoring server activity and administer logging and debugging and performance tuning
Assess technical and functional impacts from vendor-supplied updates and upgrades and provide recommendations for organizing and planning of projected work to minimize customer impact
Ensure uptime for various SAS servers, workspace, LASR, web tier, etc
Optimize the use of the platform by developing and implementing best practices of existing products and provide recommendations for new data management and analytics products, including security model
Deliver excellent customer service using a customer-first and continuous improvement mindset to foster customer and SAS community relationships, to include onboarding new business units to be introduced to SAS, existing business units that may be more proficient, as well as a variety of levels within the organizational structure
Administrate and support the connections and security to various Databases, primarily Oracle, Redshift, MySql and SFTP, but not limited to
Support, manage, monitor, and debug SAS jobs, stored processes and custom SAS programs through the preferred SAS tools available to the enterprise
Develop tools and software to manage internal processes and third-party software, including additional Analytics tools not limited to SAS (such as Power BI, Tableau, etc)
Diagnose, document, report, and resolve system problems
Work directly with external customers and interface with other support teams and vendors


Other Responsibilities
Assist in recommending process improvement ideas to streamline team tasks and activities
Assist in determining improvements in structural configuration and security design for a rapidly growing environment that includes various customer requirements
Ability to adapt to a dynamic and growing environment


Qualifications

Minimum Education and Experience
Master’s degree and 2-4 years of relevant experience; or Bachelor’s degree and three to five years of relevant experience; or an equivalent combination of education, training and relevant experience.


Other Required Qualifications
Proficiency in relevant technologies:
Enterprise Business Analytics system architecture and performance tuning
ETL processes, programming and Analytic report development
Business Analytics process design and implementation
Analytic reporting delivery, platform administration, configuration management/migration processes and metadata management
Oracle database design
Data Analytics and Management software implementations, updates, upgrades and administration (various tools)
Enterprise-wide operational and reporting data integrations
Security model for various levels of enterprise developers and report readers across different business and IT units as it relates to data analytics
Ability to work with various levels within customer and IT organizations (including senior management) and to manage multiple concurrent projects
Ability to balance immediate and long-term priorities to meet critical objectives while considering the impact of those decisions and activities on the ability to achieve long-term goals
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both technical and non-technical subjects including the ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization.
Excellent at problem solving, analytical and evaluative skills with an ability to resolve complex, difficult technical issues at the macro level
Data Analytics and management tools/language
Must be capable of quickly learning new tools and processes, detail oriented, and possess strong interpersonal, communication, time management and organizational skills


Preferred Qualifications

Knowledge of Oracle Peoplesoft in a University setting
Data Analytics and management tools/language, including SAS Management Console, SAS Environment Manager, SAS Data Integration Studio, SAS Enterprise Guide, SAS Web Report Studio, SAS Visual Analytics, SAS Stored processes, SAS Studio, SAS programming, SQL, XML

Experience in Data Mart/Data Warehouse design and implementation

Job Title: Business Management Senior Analyst (Charlotte, NC (Hybrid) Or Remote)
Job Description:
Req Id: 4930
Job location: Charlotte, NC, US, 28277

Where you'll work:
Our flexible, hybrid work model offers the option to work remotely or in the office.

How you'll contribute:
As a Business Management Senior Analyst, you'll be responsible for business operations across the Variable Annuities (VA) Asset Liability Management (ALM) team and key stakeholders across departments. This includes owning and managing risk & control policies and procedures, as well as various project work.

In this role, you'll get to:

Lead work across business partners to analyze, design, and implement solutions that drive standardization, efficiency and quality of processes, including workflows and controls.
Lead process walkthroughs with team leaders across impacted business areas, along with risk and audit.
Develop and maintain documentation of policies and procedures for VA ALM, including model risk, controls, and business continuity.
Support system and process enhancements along with key projects and initiatives.

We're looking for people who have:

Experienced business manager or analyst with at least 5-7 years of experience.
Advanced knowledge of risk and control frameworks along with internal and external audit requests.
Insurance industry hedging, valuation, capital, and regulatory knowledge a plus.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite.
Organized with a never-ending drive for constant improvement.

Research shows some people may not apply for a role if they don't check all the boxes of a job description. If you don't check every box listed, that's okay. We would love to hear from you.

What you'll receive:

Compensation - Base salary ranging from $95,000 to $125,000 plus competitive performance-based incentives determined by company and individual results.
Flexible Work Environment - Work remotely or in the office to better thrive in all areas of life.
Paid Time Off - Recharge with a minimum of 20 days of paid time off and 16 paid company holidays per calendar year plus paid volunteer time and paid study time.
Financial Health - Work toward achieving your financial goals through our 401(k) savings plan with company match (up to 6%) and annual company nondiscretionary contribution (3%), 15% employee stock purchase plan discount, and financial counseling services.
Health and Wellness - Enjoy competitive medical, vision, and dental plans plus tax-free health savings accounts with potential company contributions up to $1,000 per family.
Family Support - Care for loved ones with up to 16 weeks of paid leave for new parents, back-up dependent care, dependent care flexible spending account, and up to a $25,000 lifetime maximum during your adoption, infertility, or surrogacy journey.
Life and Disability Support - Gain access to company-paid basic life insurance and short-term disability insurance.

The company and your department may occasionally gather in person throughout the year to foster a culture of belonging and promote team building. We'd love for you to join us during those company-wide and department-wide events to help you strengthen connections across the company.

Why join us?
Brighthouse Financial is on a mission to help people achieve financial security. Our company is one of the largest providers of annuities and life insurance in the U.S.,* and we specialize in products designed to help people protect what they've earned and ensure it lasts.

We empower employees to collaborate, bring their passion to work, and make an impact. Our inclusive work environment fosters a culture that celebrates diverse

backgrounds and experiences. You can find out more about our company culture by visiting brighthousefinancial.com/about-us/careers/.

We're proud to be a Fortune® 500 company** and recognized as one of the Healthiest Employers of Greater Charlotte by the Charlotte Business Journal. We're also honored to be named to Newsweek's list of Most Trustworthy Companies in America.

Job Title: IT Business Relationship & Program Senior Manager
Job Description:
Join the Weisiger Group Team

As a family-owned company under our fourth generation of leadership, we have built our business based on the principles of trust, integrity, and a desire to help our customers and employees succeed.

Since 1926, we’ve supported the strength of our communities by supplying equipment for critical infrastructure and commerce, and by funding programs that advance social and economic vitality. Being around for nearly 100 years means we change and pivot to capture opportunities and avoid challenges. We make smart investments in our company and continuously improve as part of our vision to be a trailblazing company that’s built to last.

We’re looking for hard-working, team-oriented professionals who enjoy working on new challenges every day. We believe our employees are the key to our success, and we’re committed to providing a work experience that helps our team grow to their full potential.

Join a leading solutions provider and be a part of a group of highly skilled technicians, sales and support team members who exist to serve as a trusted partner to our customers, communities, and fellow employees.

Summary

The IT Business Relationship & Program Senior Manager is a member of the Business Technology team, reporting directly to the Vice President of Applications and Business Relationships. This position will be responsible for acting as the liaison between IT and the LiftOne business function to understand both business operational and development needs, to assist with the oversight and prioritization of IT projects, to develop IT/business capability roadmaps and to ensure IT projects align with technology that best provides return on investment aligning to both the IT and business strategies.

The BR/P Sr. Manager will manage the overall delivery of IT services to the designated business function, including vendor and project management. This position will coordinate with the PMO, infrastructure, support, development/database/integration, and technology services teams for ensuring quality of support and solutions. The BR/P Sr. Manager will leverage agile principles and a project management discipline to deliver a portfolio of technology solutions with the aid of an agile scrum master, PMO Project Managers, but also will need to act and serve as a lead project manager as needed.

This position will develop and manage the CAPEX and OPEX budgets for its application portfolio, as well as communicate project and budget status to key business stakeholders.

Specifically, this role will oversee the team and development of customized solutions within the ServiceMax / Salesforce platform and middleware and digital layers to support critical business functions that meet project objectives.

The expectations of this position, as stated above, are not all inclusive, but generally describe the responsibility of the position. Other responsibilities may be assigned as necessary to support the business environment.

Given that the role will interact heavily with senior members of both the LiftOne business and Business Technology teams, candidates must bring a “customer service” oriented approach to their work, seeing their primary function as an enabler to business solutions. As such, the following traits will be valued when evaluating candidates:

Customer Driver: Uncompromised focus on helping our internal customer achieve success.
Positive Engaged Employee: Recognizing that our employees work and succeed together.
Accountability: Honoring commitments, taking action, and following through to closure.
Adaptability: Continuously seeking to improve the business and one’s self.
Detail Oriented: Getting the details right in all work products and communications.

Essential Functions

TECHNOLOGY SPECIFIC

Provide leadership advice on the ServiceMax / Salesforce and Digital platforms.
Build, Vet, and Communicate technology roadmaps for the Salesforce and ServiceMax platforms tied to business unit/s strategic objectives and goals.
Oversee the development and testing of solutions within the ServiceMax / Salesforce and digital platform to support critical business functions and meet project objectives.
Oversee and manage daily support and maintenance of our Salesforce instance.
Oversee and manage daily support and maintenance of our MuleSoft middleware layer.
Other duties as assigned.

DOMAIN SPECIFIC

To represent IT within LiftOne by maintaining a high degree of visibility within the business and attending business meetings and appropriate management forums, providing a central point of information for all related IT activities
To represent the business needs and interests within IT, contributing to appropriate IT team, operational and development meetings.
To maintain a detailed knowledge of the key business processes and systems employed by the business.
Oversee or Lead solution business requirements gathering and solutioning.
To maintain an up to date, detailed understanding of both Business and IT strategy
To assist with the prioritization of projects, particularly using cost / benefit analysis to proactively manage business demand.
To assist the Solution and Enterprise Architect/s to develop the information technology architecture model by being able to make objective recommendations regarding the relative fit of technology to business need.
To maintain a detailed understanding of IT both operational performance and progress of ongoing development, playing a leading role in problem resolution.
To assist with the operational and commercial relationship management of third-party suppliers.
To assist the business to form process and systems solutions that are appropriate and adequate to satisfy both tactical and strategic business needs.
To play a proactive role in Contract and Service Level Agreement negotiations.
Conduct solution/vendor RFP’s.
Act as a program or project leader/manager, coordinating the work of both internal and external IT resources when required.
Participate in the organization’s Change Management Process.
Other duties as assigned.

Supervisory Responsibilities

This job has supervisory responsibilities.

Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualifying individuals to perform the essential functions.

Education and/or Experience

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience in Software Development.
Preferred: Degree in Information Technology or Computer Engineering.
Preferred: B.A. or Masters in Computer Science or Management Information Systems
Required: Eight or more years of IT Application Delivery / Operations / Management experience.
Required: Eight or more years of IT Business Analysis experience.
Required: Five or more years of Program or Project Management experience.
Required: Five or more years specific business domain experience or equivalent cross-functional IT project work.
Required: Four or more relevant Salesforce Certifications.
Required: Process mapping and improvement capability.
Required: Strong technical program and project management experience.
Required: Subject matter expertise relevant to assigned business area.
Required: Ability to effectively communicate business needs to the technology teams.
Required: Strong Business Analysis background in relevant domain.
Required: Proven experience hiring, building, and managing a Salesforce team.
Preferred: Technical background with coding experience.
Preferred: Experience utilizing MuleSoft as a middleware
Preferred: Strong blend of service industry experience and technology

Certificates, Licenses, Registrations

Preferred for candidate to have Salesforce, ServiceMax, or relevant certifications.

Attributes

Customer first focus and seek to understand how solutions can benefit the customers daily life.
Growth mindset with the desire to work in a collaborative environment to promote and drive team performance.
Possess strong analytical, design, and problem-solving skills. Able to communicate complex problems in a non-technical and simplified manner.
High level of motivation, self-starter, excellent at follow-up, team-player with ability to deliver within defined timelines. Well organized and able to work on own initiative.
Demonstrated ability to succeed in a fast-paced, dynamic, and high growth technology environment.
Accountable: Does what they say. Honors commitments. Takes action. Follows through.
Detail Oriented: Gets the details right in all work products and communications.
Positive & Engaged: Brings a positive attitude to work. Understands that employees succeed together.
Principled: Does the right thing. Remains honest and provides constructive feedback.
Adaptable: Improve always. Seeks to continuously improve the business, the team, and themselves.

Language Skills

Strong communication skills (written, verbal, presentation).
Able to communicate understanding and empathy when dealing with internal customers.
Excellent presentation and communication skills. Able to influence and engender collaboration.

Workplace Requirements

The physical demands and work environment described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Physical Demands

Job Title: Business Analyst, Solutions and Compliance - Americas
Job Description:
We are the leading provider of worldwide smart end-to-end supply chain & logistics, enabling the flow of trade across the globe. Our comprehensive range of products and services covers every link of the integrated supply chain – from maritime and inland terminals to marine services and industrial parks as well as technology-driven customer solutions.

Cargoes Runner is a rapidly growing logistics ERP application serving freight forwarders and the larger logistics community as a cloud based SAAS application. Cargoes Runner serves as a complete operating system allowing users to manage their forwarding operations end-to-end on a single platform. Cargoes Runner has 200+ customers across 15 countries and is rapidly expanding leveraging the scale and global reach of DP World.

The Cargoes Runner product management team is looking for candidates who can contribute to the development of the product and adoption of the solution by DP World internal business units & external customers.



JOB ACCOUNTABILITIES

Working with internal and external stakeholders to deeply understand specific operations use cases & problem statements
Translate user needs to requirements for product enhancements / new capability development as applicable, in-line with the product component and overall vision
Work with engineering, design, and program teams to get features/solutions shipped in an agile environment keeping in mind needs and priorities of internal and external stakeholders
Collaborate with peers in ongoing problem solving, knowledge sharing, design/requirement reviews and sprint planning
Contribute to the development of the component and overall product roadmap/vision
Work with sales and onboarding teams to support process mapping for sale prospects and product demos
Collaborate with customers/users to solve problems, act as a gatekeeper for product requirement intake from internal and external customers; serve as an advocate for the product to customers and operations users
Contribute to the technical assessment of third-party vendors for integration with Cargoes Runner and assist with commercial agreement closure
Work with stakeholders for identification and closure of process gaps in software delivery and customer onboarding
Work with product managers and analytics team to measure impact of ongoing deliveries to customer acquisition, activation, and retention


QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE

5+ years of experience working with a freight forwarding organization AND/OR leading freight forwarding product in one or more of the following roles:
Product manager
Business analyst
QA
Onboarding/Delivery manager
Customer service/Operations
Understanding of user workflows in forwarding and customs in two or more of the following areas:
Ocean exports/imports
Air exports/imports
Customs
Taxation
Finance/accounting

Familiarity with warehousing and transportation management will be a plus.

Knowledge of one or more of existing Freight Forwarding ERP products
Ability to be adaptable and creative in an aggressive, fast-paced environment



ABOUT DP WORLD

We deliver these services through an interconnected global network of 128 business units in 60 countries across six continents, with a significant presence both in high-growth and mature markets. Wherever we operate, we integrate sustainability and responsible corporate citizenship into our activities, striving for a positive contribution to the economies and communities where we live and work.

Our dedicated, diverse and professional team of more than 104,000 employees from 131 countries is committed to delivering unrivalled value to our customers and partners. We do this by focusing on mutually beneficial relationships – with governments, shippers, traders, and other stakeholders along the global supply chain – relationships built on a foundation of mutual trust and enduring partnership.

We think ahead, anticipate change and deploy industry-leading technology to further broaden our digital vision to disrupt world trade and create the smartest, most efficient and innovative solutions, while ensuring a positive and sustainable impact on economies, societies and our planet.

DP World is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO). We strongly believe that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success and we make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, gender, disability, race, religion or belief.

By submitting your resume and application information, you authorize DP World to transmit and store your information in the world-wide recruitment database, and to circulate that information as necessary for the purpose of evaluating your qualifications for this or other job vacancies.

Quanta Technology is committed to an equal-opportunity workplace.
