Job Title: Director, Business Relationship Management, Growth & Innovation
Job Description:
We’re Hiring for a Director, Business Relationship Management, Growth & Innovation!

If you are excited and passionate about helping #LetsSolveWater, consider joining our team today! Xylem, Inc. is a leading global water technology company servicing more than 150 countries and is dedicated to solving the world’s most challenging water issues. We are looking for individuals to join our mission by exceeding customer expectations through smart sustainable solutions. At Xylem, you will have the opportunity to solve water by participating in our paid Volunteer Program, Xylem Watermark!

THE ROLE: The Director, Business Relationship Manager (BRM) is accountable for driving the creation of a strategic business technology roadmap and to ensure legacy technologies are enhanced, maintained and supported to address business needs. This position will report to the VP, BRM, Strategy & Planning with a dotted line to Senior Vice President & Chief Growth Officer.

This role works closely with the Growth and Innovation leadership and IT leadership to align business strategy, processes and systems needs to support local, regional and global requirements. They are the primary liaison between Growth & Innovation and the enterprise IT organization. The individual will lead the development of technology in support of key strategies for the Growth organization – including commercialization / product management, simplified e-Commerce and extensive experience in formalizing strategies to consolidate and rationalize enterprise processes market-to-order and ideation-to-creation .

Reporting into this role, a team of analysts will support the identification and prioritization of business demand, develop the case for change and the business case of change and ensuring the delivery of a portfolio of projects to help business divisions achieve their financial objectives.

We offer a full benefits package to include Flexible Time Off (FTO) for salaried positions, health, dental, vision, investment savings plan, and additional miscellaneous benefits.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES: To perform the job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.

Develop multi-year business capability roadmaps with enterprise architecture.
Review requirements with change management and business transformation teams.
Develop a “healthy and well-managed initiative portfolio” with the project, program or portfolio management organization (PMO).
Communicate with business leadership to evaluate joint initiatives and proposals to see how they align with established roadmaps and business priorities.
Identify business value when developing ideas with a focus on digital awareness, risk assessment, business continuity and business capability requirements.
Identify strategic business function opportunities both short-term and long-term and track adoption across the relevant departments.
Build and manage a relationship team to oversee “convergence and strategic partnering” across the organization, including with executive and senior leadership.

Visionary Leadership and Strategic Planning:

Responsible for aligning business needs, creating business value return model and working with enterprise information technology execution teams.
Review business strategies in cooperation with business owners and enterprise IT teams to enable future business solutions
Act as the primary liaison to identify emerging business trends and technologies that will enhance growth within the ISC.

Relationship Management:

Build, manage and nurture a solid relationship with Growth & Innovation leadership, IT Leadership Team, IT colleagues and governance or project teams to address business needs while driving system and process standards.
Communicate proactively with key stakeholders
Have ability to influence without direct authority and demonstrate conflict management skills
Partner with key personnel to develop key business needs or requirements in support of sustaining or developing IT related solutions.

Demand Management:

Closely collaborate with Growth & Innovation leadership, IT Leadership, and other key stakeholders to understand and assist with prioritizing technology enabled business initiatives.
Coordinate with Program Management Office personnel to ensure projects are delivering to cost, schedule and expected delivery milestones
Act as primary liaison where appropriate to align the business staff and expectations of projects to ensure goals are being achieved.

Advocate:

Act as an ambassador and the primary focal point for IT within the growth group to optimize technology enablement and create standard work – both in the current environment and long-term strategy

Business Expertise:

Lead in developing proposals and business cases for technology enabled business initiatives.
Experience in leading SAP, CRM implementations – particularly with deployment methods and risk-mitigation exercises
Experience in implementing quoting, e-comm and product catalog projects.
Participate in the translation of business requirements to the Enterprise IT organization so that business needs are understood and addressed.

Change Management:

Lead adoption of technology and business process standards
5+ years of experience in a business analysis or related role, with a proven track record of successful project delivery.
Be active in the growth group to gather business requirements, assist with the creation of business value projections and deliver key communication from IT to the Growth group.

Service Management:

Work with IT execution team service owners to understand Service Level Agreements (SLA) and as needed provide feedback to ensure business needs are being addressed within the expected levels.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor degree (or equivalent), with 10+ years of experience preferred; or relevant and equivalent Business or IT experience
Strong knowledge of business operations, preferably performing a business partner role working with business executives for 3+ years
Possess general knowledge of related business technologies and applications that drive business growth, business management and long term business sustainability
Program or Project management experience strongly preferred
Financial & business analysis experience, specifically working with budgets and project costing
Travel is expected 10 to 20% annually.

DAY IN THE LIFE:

In this role, the working environment is generally in an office setting and may be performed remotely. The physical demands may include but are not limited to moving around in an office environment, frequent oral communication, close vision, and ability to operate office equipment. Up to 40% of time spent traveling.

SALARY:

The estimated salary range at this professional level is $115,000 to $207,000 plus bonus. Starting pay is dependent on multiple factors, such as skills, experience and work location, and is not typically at the top of the range. At Xylem we offer a competitive compensation package with a generous benefit package, including Medical, Dental, Vision plans, Wellness programs, 401(k) with company contribution, paid time off, paid parental leave and tuition reimbursement.

At Xylem, we embrace diversity and strive to create avenues where employees feel valued and appreciated through our DE&I initiatives and Employee Resources Groups (ERG). Xylem is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action workplace. Xylem prohibits discrimination, harassment of any kind and does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex or sexual orientation (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, marital status, medical conditions or disability, genetic information, age, or other non-merit factors.

Join the global Xylem team today! Xylem is a team creating advanced technology solutions to the world’s water challenges through developing new technologies and services that will improve the way water is used, conserved, and re-used in the future is central to our work. Our products and services move, treat, analyze, monitor, and return water to the environment, in public utility, industrial, residential, and commercial building services settings. Xylem also provides a leading portfolio of smart metering, network technologies and advanced analytics solutions for water, electric and gas utilities.

Employees must be able to perform the essential functions of the position satisfactorily and if requested, reasonable accommodations will be made to enable employees with disabilities to perform the essential functions of their job absent undue hardship. Xylem reserves the right to modify this job description or assign other duties to this position as needed.

Job Description Summary
The primary purpose of this position is to support and enable the Lowe’s Salesforce Customer Relationship Management (CRM) platform. The Lowe’s Salesforce CRM platform is used to drive and streamline sales operations for Pro Sales teams, enable growth, daily execution, drive customer engagement, and provide valuable business and customer analytics and insights. This role will be working with leadership, sales teams, and a large group of cross-functional partners focusing on large data sets and functionality needs, along with driving towards simple, scalable solutions to difficult problems to improve internal operations and the selling experience of the sales teams.

Key Responsibilities

Gathers quantitative and qualitative feedback from within various platforms and from end users
Helps identify and drive continuous improvement of current business processes as a result of the downstream effect of broader company initiatives, systems changes, ideation efforts, efficiencies, etc.
May analyze pro customers’ and sales team habits and tendencies, in order to maintain and enhance new programs and processes that will attract profitable Pro business
Creates and analyzes key reports
Provides necessary support across the ProServices organization to maximize all sales and growth opportunities for pro sales
Maintains/updates data and file storage integrity in platforms via organizational best practices
Recognizes and resolves technology defects
Creates a collaborative environment by working in a team of peers to solve problems and shares information with peers, manager, sales teams, and customers as appropriate
Creates innovative and informative training and educational materials, including PowerPoint presentations and documents to educate Lowe’s associates of all levels on relevant topics
Influences key stakeholders without authority
Communicates to end users and leadership regularly
Stays connected with the needs of the business and the sales organization
Maintains transparency of availability
Quickly adapts to market and business changes
Works cross-functionally across the Lowe's enterprise

Required Experience

Bachelor’s Degree in business, marketing, mathematics, statistics, or the equivalent analytical background , or equivalent combination of education and work experience.
5+ years of experience working cross-functionally with multiple groups and/or across an enterprise
Ability to work successfully in a remote manner
5+ years of experience with remote interfacing tools such as Zoom, Google Meet or Microsoft Teams or a willingness to learn and leverage these tools
Ability to work with a high degree of autonomy
Willingness to travel for specific training or tradeshow events

Preferred Experience

Experience in Home Improvement or Industrial/Commercial Supply House very helpful, with experience at Lowe’s or another mass retailer
Experience working with Salesforce CRM or other similar platforms

About Lowe’s

Lowe's Companies, Inc. (NYSE: LOW) is a FORTUNE® 50 home improvement company serving approximately 17 million customer transactions a week in the U.S. With total fiscal year 2022 sales of over $97 billion, approximately $92 billion of sales were generated in the U.S., where Lowe's operates over 1,700 home improvement stores and employs approximately 300,000 associates. Based in Mooresville, N.C., Lowe's supports the communities it serves through programs focused on creating safe, affordable housing and helping to develop the next generation of skilled trade experts. For more information, visit Lowes.com.

Takes a leadership role in managing projects for systems and business solutions. Coordinates Finance project teams to implement systems upgrades, replacements and/or new applications. Job Title: Sr. IT Business Analysis Manager, R&D
Job Description:
For Current Gilead Employees and Contractors:
Please log onto your
Internal Career Site
to apply for this job.
At Gilead we believe every employee deserves a great leader. As a people leader now or in the future, we expect that you will model and create an environment of inclusion, be intentionally focused on the hiring, development, growth and retention of talent, and empower teams to align and achieve goals.

Job Description
Gilead Sciences, Inc. is a research-based biopharmaceutical company founded in 1987. Together we deliver life-saving therapies to patients in need. With the commitment and drive you bring to the workplace every day, you will be part of a team that is changing the world and helping millions of people live healthier, more fulfilling lives. Our worldwide staff is a close community where you can see the tangible results of your contributions, where every individual matters, and everyone has a chance to enhance their skills through ongoing development. Our scientific focus has resulted in marketed products that are benefiting hundreds of thousands of people, a pipeline of late-stage drug candidates, and unmatched patient access programs to ensure medications are available to those who could otherwise not afford them. By joining Gilead, you will further our mission to address unmet medical needs and improve life by advancing the care of patients with life-threatening diseases.

Office Location: Raleigh, NC

POSITION OVERVIEW:
IT Business Analysis is a core job family within Gilead's broader Information Technology (IT) group. IT Business Analysts support Gilead business strategies and operations by taking the lead on evaluation, analysis and planning of technology, process and related business needs to enable more efficient business operations and faster, more effective achievement of business strategies and goals. IT Business Analysts work closely with business leads and other IT partner functions to develop and maintain in-depth understanding of business needs and objectives in both general business and technology realms. IT Business Analysts play a critical role in use case analysis, functional design specification, processing mapping, testing and validation of business technology solutions. IT Business Analysts lead the coordination of IT resources to deliver against business needs and objectives. This group stays abreast of dynamics and evolutions in their business and technology areas of assignment to proactively recommend future solutions or other opportunities to the business.
You will act as lead business analyst to assigned business groups or for assigned IT domains. You will lead or otherwise participate in evaluation and feasibility analysis for new or updated systems or applications. You will lead or otherwise participate in all analyses, planning and coordination of IT resources to support assigned projects, including compilation and recommendations on possible solutions, process or other implications, costs, etc. You will develop testing and training plans for assigned projects and you may test or oversee testing of new / updated solutions. You will develop and deliver or oversee process updates and user training. You will lead or otherwise participate in in post-implementation reviews. You will monitor systems / applications and processes in the assigned area to ensure appropriate, effective, and efficient operations, and recommend updates or other opportunities. You may participate in or oversee configuration, debugging and other related activities for systems / applications in the assigned area. You will provide and/or arrange technical support and problem resolution for customer inquiries and to resolve other operating issues. You will coordinate and manage internal and external IT resources to support assigned projects. You will play a key role in supporting and modeling the culture within your team and the broader IT organization - a culture of high-performance, data-driven decision-making, value-driven prioritization, quality governance, and compliance.
Essential Duties and Job Functions
General responsibilities for this position will include (but are not limited to) the following:
Conducts or otherwise oversees and manages business / user requirements gathering / needs analysis
Conducts or otherwise oversees and manages analysis for initial business case, resource requirements, categorization, and prioritization
Ensures timely and appropriate analysis of current business processes and systems / applications and recommendations for improvement based on business needs and objectives, industry trends and best practices
Documents or otherwise oversees and manages business process flows for current and future state
Documents or otherwise oversees and manages user requirements and use cases
Ensures timely and appropriate requirements and other analysis are provided to development teams for functional requirements definition
Where applicable, collaborates on request for proposal submissions and responses, vendor evaluation, contract readiness and other assessments, such as GxP / SOX requirements
Participates in design reviews
Creates and develops or otherwise oversees and manages test scenario definition
Ensures timely and appropriate support for user acceptance testing (UAT), including reviewing UAT test results and collaborating with technical teams on any issue resolution
Ensures timely and appropriate support for project roll-out on deployment / project delivery, including implementation requirements, project communications and training end users
Conducts or supports value affirmation analysis once the project is operational
Manages or otherwise oversees enhancements, defect analysis, and recommendations for resolution
Where applicable, manages vendor deliverables associated with own work
Ensures assigned work complies with established practices, policies, and processes and any regulatory or other requirements

REQUIREMENTS:
We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. Please see the following for the qualifications and skills we seek for this role.
Minimum Education & Experience
10+ years’ relevant experience with High School Diploma or equivalent
8+ years’ relevant experience with AA
6+ years’ relevant experience with BS / BA
4+ years’ relevant experience with MS / MA / MBA
Computer Science or related discipline is preferred
Significant IT experience in a corporate or other relevant business environment
Experience supporting IT business systems analysis, planning, budgeting and coordination of IT resources to support business needs
Business process engineering and project management experience is preferred
Experience with IT integrations and cloud transformations is preferred
IT experience in support of business areas in life sciences is a plus
NOTE: Years of experience may not apply outside of the U.S.

Knowledge & Other Requirements
Demonstrates expertise in one or more technology environments and ability to lead projects or workstreams for one or more IT areas in support of a particular business function or key IT workstream
Demonstrates understanding of design and solution development methods, the Project Execution Process, and the fundamentals of requirement specification, design and development, configuration, and testing of business systems / applications
Knowledge of best practices in IT or related project management, continuous improvements and change management
Experience in relevant platforms (ARGUS, Automation BOTS, DataVision, Eclipse, GLASS, MedDocs) as well as other IT Research & Development industry systems
Thorough knowledge of Agile and proven abilities to apply these to support IT solutions to meet business needs and objectives
Thorough knowledge of SDLC and SLC relevant to business functions and their business and technology needs, including knowledge of the multiple IT functions involved
Thorough knowledge of key programming languages and requirements relevant to assigned domain
Knowledge of cloud computing, e.g., AWS, and migration requirements
Knowledge of IT security, quality and risk management requirements relevant to assigned domain
Strong working knowledge of installed technologies, with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve problems on existing technologies
Knowledge of integration points between supported and other technologies and how to manage these for optimal operations
Understands basic architectural considerations and appropriately factors these into recommendations and decisions
Understands UX principles, practices and techniques and is able to apply to IT solutions to ensure a good user experience
Understands future trends in IT
Knowledge of or aptitude to learn regulatory requirements relevant to the biopharma industry
Demonstrated ability to be a fast learner
Demonstrated ability to be flexible and adaptable to change, to move between projects easily and provide support/expertise where needed
Proven analytical abilities with high attention-to-detail as demonstrated through past experiences and/or academic achievements
Strong communication and organizational skills
Ability to lead and influence programs, projects and / or initiatives
When needed, ability to travel

Position Overview

This position performs intermediate skilled technical and operational support work assisting the Director with planning, directing, coordinating, and supervising the elections process and related work as apparent or assigned.

Grade 22

Duties and Responsibilities

Assists in Implementing changing election laws, coordinating elections, and supervising activities of the office.
Oversees set up of One-Stop voting sites and network.
Sets up all E-poll books according to polling place.
Assists in machine logic and accuracy.
Administers Campaign Reporting schedule
Provides requested information such as registration analysis, voting analysis, lists of precinct officials, precinct locations, precinct political committees, and campaign reports to the various candidates, campaign committees, party chairs, news media, and the general public.
Provides requested information regarding the North Carolina Campaign Reporting Act to prospective candidates, candidates, elected officials, media, and the general public, provides and notices of required reports to Candidates.
Assists with audits submitted campaign reports, reviews, and verifies records to ensure that required information is provided and correct.
Assists with polling sites database
Prepares campaign reports for public viewing.
Assists with planning for and coordinating all early voting site, including the set up and close out of all sites. Assists in training of one-stop workers.
Assists in canvassing the returns of all elections.
Explains policies, laws, rules, regulations, and procedures to the public and other inquiring parties.
Assists with voter registration verification procedures.
Assists in ADA compliance and Campaign zones at polling places.
Assists in processing and verifying petitions.
Assists in preparing and conducting elections.
Assists with state reporting requirements
Interacts with elected officials, candidates, the North Carolina Campaign Reporting Office, the general public, and the media.
Performs other related job duties as assigned

Education and Experience

High school diploma or equivalent; two (2) years directly related experience; or Associate’s Degree in paralegal science, business administration, political science, or related field; and directly related experience; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Bachelor’s Degree in paralegal science, business administration, political science, or related field is preferred.

Licenses or Certifications:
Possession of a valid, State of North Carolina driver’s license to operate a motor vehicle. Requirement exists at the time of hire and as a condition of continued employment.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Knowledge of County and departmental policies and procedures.
Knowledge of computers and job-related software programs.
Knowledge of Chapter 163 of the General Statutes of North Carolina, with specialized knowledge of Articles 20, 21, and 22 f .
Knowledge of requirements related to registration processes, voting procedures, and of the maintenance and protection of voting registration lists and records.
Knowledge of NVRA, HAVA, and UOCAVA policies and procedures.
Knowledge of Federal, State, and County laws and procedures pertaining to elections and the maintenance of Jackson County election records.
Knowledge of office management techniques, including the ability to organize workflow and coordinate activities.
Knowledge of effective supervisory practices.
Skill in prioritizing and organizing work.
Skill in oral and written communication.
Skill in the operation of a computer and correlated software.
Ability to plan and supervise the work of others.
Ability to work well in a team environment.
Ability to analyze, interpret, recommend and implement policy and procedural guidelines.
Ability to learn and apply new skills
Ability to undertake self-development activities
Ability to seek increased responsibilities
Ability to communicate effectively in person and by telephone.
Ability to understand and follow oral and written instructions.
Ability to answer inquiries independently and coordinate a variety of resources in acquiring information.
Ability to be impartial, fair, and professional when working with candidates and voters.
Ability to effectively communicate and interact with management, employees, members of the general public and other groups involved in the activities of the County as they relate to the department.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has a client that is seeking a Remote Lead Business Systems Analyst.

Day to Day Responsibilities:

Lead Business Systems Analyst will engage with stakeholders and SME submitting user stories to flush out detailed requirements to include
Interviewing multiple stakeholders based on customer personas to derive root cause issues and desired results
Extrapolating data and interpreting the results to inform the requirements build and validate desired results are credible
Engaging with the assigned scrum teams, including the IT Developers and BSA to refine the requirements to ensure all the information is present to support IT solutioning
As a Lead Business Systems Analyst, you will validate proposed IT solution with the stakeholders to glean a common understanding to the approach
Assisting product ownership in prioritization discussions/determinations and interdependency management between teams
Assisting the UAT testing team in testing support as needed
Develop and refine best practices, processes and procedures related to requirements gathering
Mentor/Coach other testing partners those items
Works on complex issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors
Exercises judgment in selecting methods, techniques, and evaluation criteria for obtaining results
Internal and external contacts often pertain to company plans and objectives
REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor's degree in related field
5+ years of experience with BAIV level accountabilities
Having wide-ranging experience, uses professional concepts and company objectives to resolve complex issues
JIRA, Confluence, SharePoint, Microsoft Office skills
Financial Acumen for building value creation models in support of product development preferred

Overview:

Morgan Advanced Materials is a business rich in history and innovation. Founded in the UK in 1856, we have grown into a global organisation with 70 sites in 18 countries. Our model to serve our customers where they need us has led to a diversified product range using our unparalleled expertise in ceramic and carbon materials, which we exploit to solve difficult problems for our customers across a diverse range of markets.


We are a purpose driven organisation. Our purpose is to use advanced materials to make the world more sustainable and to improve the quality of life. We deliver on that purpose through the products that we make, and the way that we make them.


We help our customers push the limits of their processes and products to meet the demanding requirements they face, from higher process temperatures to higher product performance to increasing miniaturisation.

Key Figures: Revenue £1,112m (2022), ~8,500 employees, manufacturing in 30+ countries, and a global customer portfolio. A UK PLC with head office located in Windsor, Berkshire UK. Listed on London Stock Exchange; Member of the FTSE 250 Index.


Responsibilities:

OVERVIEW & SCOPE OF ROLE:

Morgan IT is on a mission to enable and drive the Morgan goals by being a valuable business partner to all Global Business Units and Functions by:

Running Effective and Efficient IT
Delivering Solid Business Foundations
Extracting Maximum Business Value from IT
Driving disruptive innovation

To do so, the OneIT team is currently executing on a strategic roadmap to make significant step changes in IT performance and business value from IT.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES & REPONSIBILITIES:
The D365 IT Business Analyst will ensure the line of business applications, primarily Dynamics 365 (D365), can sustain current and future business needs for our businesses. This role is responsible for providing D365 technical and functional expertise, ensuring business requirements are gathered and subsequent technical/functional resolutions are implemented appropriately. In addition, the role will ensure efficient and effective business as usual operation of D365, including remediation of issues.

The D365 IT Business Analyst understands both technology as well as business and is responsible to capture all business requirements in order to ensure proper IT solutions are delivered. The key focus is mapping functional requirements of the Finance & Supply Chain modules in D365, data and processes.
Key Accountabilities
Serves as liaison to business and IT teams to understand business requirements and create and implement solutions as well as understanding root causes of current issues.
Assembling business requirements with requisite analysis and translation into D365 solutions; along with alternative options and recommendations.
Supports designing business solutions that ensure alignment with the architecture principles and standards.
Documents and provides training for newly implemented systems and/or processes using Click Learn
Resolving incidents/issues, with root cause analysis and fix where appropriate, for D365 applications.
Applying functional and technical understanding of D365 to develop new functionality and integrations/interfaces with other systems as required, to support business growth.
Ensuring all aspects of the D365 development lifecycle are completed successfully, incorporating ISV solutions.
Assuring quality of releases (fixes/upgrades/enhancements etc) into production, through thorough testing and first-class environment management.
Ensuring vendor relationships remain transparent and with clearly understood outcomes
Supports Business Information Managers, Project Managers and Solution Architects in writing program / project proposals
Work with business end users to ensure the project meets business needs
Assumes ownership of the process, system, and expands skill base.
Interacts frequently with business process owners.
Conduct unit testing for project deliverables and facilitate user acceptance testing
Engage in efforts to establish scope and business case for new programs and initiatives.
Collaborate with team members to collect and analyse data

Strata Solar is a national leading developer of commercial and utility-scale solar farms ranked amongst the top five solar producers in the US. We understand that our employees are the lifeblood of the company. We strive to align company goals with those of our employees. We're constantly innovating to make a difference for our customers, our employees, and our planet. Our mission is to make a difference by developing cost-efficient alternatives to traditional energy sources, without long-term dependence on government subsidies. We’re leading the industry in sustainable energy careers. We hope you’ll join us.

The ROC Operations Analyst position is responsible for safely operating a fleet of photovoltaic solar power plants owned by
Strata Solar and 3 rd party customers. The schedule is rotating including both night shifts, day shifts, and weekends with some
holidays to support the 24/7 operation all year long. Main duties include fault evaluation, alarm handling, ticketing, and support
of field teams. Specific knowledge or work experience relating to solar operation is not required.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
 Monitors plant performance, evaluates faults, and creates work orders (tickets)
 Provides logistical and technical support for on-site teams, grid operators, and customer account representatives.
 Develops safe switching orders that help energize or de-energize components within a power plant
 Engages vendors when necessary to support efficient and successful operation
 Troubleshoots remote data acquisition system components and network infrastructure (meters, sensors, etc.)

Education and/or Work Experience Requirements:
 Ability to work 12 hours per day covering some holidays in our Durham, NC headquarters.
 2 year degree or 2 years toward a 4 year degree (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics preferred)
 Ability to work in a team environment and support technicians
 Strong organizational skills necessary to document and track issues from inception to resolution
 Outstanding problem solving skills with the ability to analyze situations and recommend solutions

Bonus Experience:
 Completion of PV100/200 Series
 Coursework in Power Systems, Statistics, Engineering, Energy or related field
 Previous operations experience

Physical Requirements/Work Environment: Work is performed in an office environment and in the field occasionally. Must
be able to sit, stand, bend, twist and lift up to 20 pounds.

Job Title: Business Management Senior Analyst (Charlotte, NC (Hybrid) Or Remote)
Job Description:
Req Id: 4930
Job location: Charlotte, NC, US, 28277

Where you'll work:
Our flexible, hybrid work model offers the option to work remotely or in the office.

How you'll contribute:
As a Business Management Senior Analyst, you'll be responsible for business operations across the Variable Annuities (VA) Asset Liability Management (ALM) team and key stakeholders across departments. This includes owning and managing risk & control policies and procedures, as well as various project work.

In this role, you'll get to:

Lead work across business partners to analyze, design, and implement solutions that drive standardization, efficiency and quality of processes, including workflows and controls.
Lead process walkthroughs with team leaders across impacted business areas, along with risk and audit.
Develop and maintain documentation of policies and procedures for VA ALM, including model risk, controls, and business continuity.
Support system and process enhancements along with key projects and initiatives.

We're looking for people who have:

Experienced business manager or analyst with at least 5-7 years of experience.
Advanced knowledge of risk and control frameworks along with internal and external audit requests.
Insurance industry hedging, valuation, capital, and regulatory knowledge a plus.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite.
Organized with a never-ending drive for constant improvement.

Research shows some people may not apply for a role if they don't check all the boxes of a job description. If you don't check every box listed, that's okay. We would love to hear from you.

What you'll receive:

Compensation - Base salary ranging from $95,000 to $125,000 plus competitive performance-based incentives determined by company and individual results.
Flexible Work Environment - Work remotely or in the office to better thrive in all areas of life.
Paid Time Off - Recharge with a minimum of 20 days of paid time off and 16 paid company holidays per calendar year plus paid volunteer time and paid study time.
Financial Health - Work toward achieving your financial goals through our 401(k) savings plan with company match (up to 6%) and annual company nondiscretionary contribution (3%), 15% employee stock purchase plan discount, and financial counseling services.
Health and Wellness - Enjoy competitive medical, vision, and dental plans plus tax-free health savings accounts with potential company contributions up to $1,000 per family.
Family Support - Care for loved ones with up to 16 weeks of paid leave for new parents, back-up dependent care, dependent care flexible spending account, and up to a $25,000 lifetime maximum during your adoption, infertility, or surrogacy journey.
Life and Disability Support - Gain access to company-paid basic life insurance and short-term disability insurance.

The company and your department may occasionally gather in person throughout the year to foster a culture of belonging and promote team building. We'd love for you to join us during those company-wide and department-wide events to help you strengthen connections across the company.

Why join us?
Brighthouse Financial is on a mission to help people achieve financial security. Our company is one of the largest providers of annuities and life insurance in the U.S.,* and we specialize in products designed to help people protect what they've earned and ensure it lasts.

We empower employees to collaborate, bring their passion to work, and make an impact. Our inclusive work environment fosters a culture that celebrates diverse

backgrounds and experiences. You can find out more about our company culture by visiting brighthousefinancial.com/about-us/careers/.

We're proud to be a Fortune® 500 company** and recognized as one of the Healthiest Employers of Greater Charlotte by the Charlotte Business Journal. We're also honored to be named to Newsweek's list of Most Trustworthy Companies in America.

Ally and Your Career
Ally Financial only succeeds when its people do - and that’s more than some cliché people put on job postings. We live this stuff! We see our people as, well, people - with interests, families, friends, dreams, and causes that are all important to them. Our focus is on the health and safety of our teammates as well as work-life balance and diversity and inclusion. From generous benefits to a variety of employee resource groups, we strive to build paths that encourage employees to stretch themselves professionally. We want to help you grow, develop, and learn new things. You’re constantly evolving, so shouldn’t your opportunities be, too?
The Opportunity

Member of the Ally Supply Chain (ASC) Shared Services & Operations team supporting the Operations Manager to ensure data integrity, efficient processes within Supply Chain’s technology and Ally Policy, Procedure & Standard adherence.

This position will also provide operational support for ASC’s Sourcing, Procurement and Contracting teams in Coupa, Archer and overall ASC technology. Operational support includes monitoring and reporting of Supply Chain compliance and controls with relevant policies and procedures and the ability to initiate and execute small to medium scale projects. Manages relationships with internal customers and technology partners. Exceptional attention to detail with the ability to document and effectively communicate problems, trends, or analysis with leadership to promote positive change.

The Work Itself
Co-lead five+ offshore resources to detect and enforce data governance and Certificate of Insurance program compliance within the Third-Party Lifecycle process.
Tactically supports the Supply Chain team in efforts of Coupa and Archer end to end process to ensure data accuracy, compliance, and operational efficiency.
Responsible for maintaining accurate Desk Procedural Manuals (DPMs) for Coupa modules and Data Governance control points.
Support sampling internal audit and external regulator requests for the controls and compliance program.
Conduct on-going analysis of Supply Chain reporting in Power BI or Excel to identify defective trends, continuous process improvement and automation opportunities.
Responsible for identifying process issues and submitting ideas with technology partners to improve or automate the customer experience (Sourcing, Procurement, Contract Management, Purchasing, RFP).
Develop and maintain strong working relationships with internal business partners and supply chain peers.
Lead for Sourcing and Contracting Product Ownership – providing subject matter expertise on existing end to end process, gathering feedback from Sourcing and Contracting teams and optimizing Supply Chain technology to meet organizational objectives.
Participate in project management activities, program development efforts, process enhancement initiatives, and compliance management efforts intended to facilitate achievement of objectives.
Responsible for providing operational support relative to Supply Chain Operations with Sourcing, Third Party Risk Management and Lines of Business.
Applies knowledge of company policies and industry best practices to resolve problems.
The Skills You Bring
3+ years of experience in Supply Chain Sourcing or Procurement.
Operations, Risk, Compliance, or Financial Services industry experience is preferred.
Bachelor’s Degree Supply Chain, Finance, or related field preferred.
Proven track record of driving for results with minimal ongoing direction.
Advanced experience with Microsoft Office Suite.
Experience in Coupa and Archer preferred or related Procurement or Third Party Risk technology.
Ability to leverage data and technology to improve a process, mitigate risk or solve problems
Embracer of change.
Detail-oriented, energetic, motivated, and takes initiative.
Strong written and verbal communication skills with an ability to communicate effectively across business levels (both vertically and horizontally).
Ability to support multiple assignments and stakeholders, prioritize workload for self, and coordinate with teammates to meet deadlines.
Demonstrates skillset to organize data (VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables) and exercise effective problem solving.
Capable of building strong relationships with internal business partners and working stakeholders in a collaborative, team-oriented manner.
Always focused on improving customer experience.
How We'll Have Your Back
Ally's compensation program offers market-competitive base pay and pay-for-performance incentives (bonuses) based on achieving personal and company goals. Our Total Rewards program includes industry-leading compensation and benefits plus additional incentives that are designed to meet your needs and those of your family so you can get the most out of your career and your life, including:
Time Away: 11 paid holidays, 20 paid time off days, and 8 hours of volunteer time off, yearly (paid time off is prorated based on start date)
Planning for the Future: plan for the near and long term with an industry-leading 401K retirement savings plan with matching and company contributions, student loan pay downs and 529 educational save up assistance programs, tuition reimbursement, employee stock purchase plan, and financial learning center and financial coach access.
Supporting your Health & Well-being: flexible health and insurance options including medical, dental and vision, employee, spouse and child life insurance, short- and long-term disability, pre-tax Health Savings Account with employer contributions, Healthcare FSA, critical illness, accident & hospital indemnity insurance, and a total well-being program that helps you and your family stay on track physically, socially, emotionally, and financially.
Building a Family: adoption, surrogacy and fertility assistance as well as paid parental and caregiver leave, Dependent Day Care FSA back-up child and adult/elder care days and childcare discounts.
Work-Life Integration: other benefits including Mentally Fit Employee Assistance Program, subsidized and discounted Weight Watchers® program and other employee discount programs.
Other compensations: depending on the role for which you are considered, you may be eligible for travel allowances, relocation assistance, a signing bonus and/or equity.
To view more detailed information about Ally’s Total Rewards, please visit this link: https://www.ally.com/content/dam/pdf/corporate/ally-total-rewards-snapshot.pdf

Ally Financial is a customer-centric, leading digital financial services company with passionate customer service and innovative financial solutions. We are relentlessly focused on "Doing it Right" and being a trusted financial-services provider to our consumer, commercial, and corporate customers. For more information, visit www.ally.com.

Job Title: Associate Sales Operations Analyst- North Carolina
Job Description:
About Teleflex Incorporated

Teleflex is a global provider of clinically effective medical technologies designed to improve the health and quality of people’s lives. We apply purpose driven innovation – a relentless pursuit of identifying unmet clinical needs – to benefit patients and healthcare providers. Our portfolio is diverse, with solutions in the fields of vascular and interventional access, interventional cardiology, surgical, anesthesia, cardiac care, interventional urology, urology, emergency medicine and respiratory care. Teleflex employees worldwide are united in the understanding that what we do every day makes a difference. For more information, please visit teleflex.com.




Global Functions – The Corporate division is the central operating unit of the company; setting strategy and policy and providing business development, finance, human resources, information technology, investor relations and legal support to the businesses. The global Company headquarters is located just outside of Philadelphia in Wayne, PA. Join a dynamic, growing team that offers healthcare providers an array of medical technology solutions that make a difference in patients’ lives.

Position Summary

The Associate Sales Operations Analyst position works closely with Commercial Operations to provide analytics in support of strategic business initiatives. The ideal candidate will use their analytical skills to provide reporting and analysis for multiple business units.




#LI-LP1

Principal Responsibilities
Analyze data, draw sound conclusions, and recommend effective courses of action.
Analyze, trend and validate adherence to strategic pricing initiatives and objectives.
Extract data, analyze and make recommendations based on impact analysis.
Support Commercial Operations in goal achievement.
Contribute to team efforts by accomplishing related queries in a cooperative and supportive manner.
Ad Hoc Reporting as needed/required
Other duties as assigned


Education / Experience Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Accounting, Analytics or related field. Equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.
1-3 years of business analytics, report writing, sales support or marketing experience in a B2B or medical device environment
Capability to work independently and accurately, with interruptions, to meet business critical deadlines
Ability to manage large volumes of complex data


Specialized Skills / Other Requirements
Knowledge of Tableau Desktop, Tableau Server, and/or Power BI
Advanced knowledge in MS Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint
Demonstrated ability to perform data extraction and manipulation, analyze data, and generate reports.
SQL Database creation and maintenance and VBA code writing are a plus.
Strong analytical, statistical, and problem solving skills.
Good interpersonal/customer relations skills; good verbal and written communications
Ability to build and maintain relationships with different departments and leadership levels
Demonstrated ability to contribute to the profitability of targeted objectives.

Enterprise Business Intelligence Lead

Position Summary:

Catalent is a global, high-growth, public company, and a leading partner for the pharmaceutical industry in the development and manufacturing of new treatments for patients worldwide. Your talents, ideas, and passion are essential to our mission: to help people live better, healthier lives. Catalent is committed to a Patient First culture through excellence in quality and compliance, and to the safety of every patient, consumer and Catalent employee.

The Enterprise Business Intelligence Lead will be responsible for overseeing the evolution and maturity of the business intelligence lifecycle, from data collection and transformation to analysis and visualization. The Enterprise Business Intelligence Lead requires a strong blend of technical expertise, leadership skills, and business acumen. The successful candidate will collaborate closely with business stakeholders, cross-functional teams, and Enterprise Data Sciences & Analytics teammates to ensure the correct business needs are identified, effective BI/analytics solutions are designed, and ensure data integrity and accuracy, and drive self-service BI across the organization.


Location: Remote



The Role:

Provide strategic direction, solution architecture and approach, and leadership to the business intelligence project teams, promoting self-service BI, launching, and establishing and leading a new Analytics Community of Practice, fostering a collaborative and results-oriented environment

Take accountability for overseeing and managing the life cycle of a portfolio of BI apps, technologies, and projects

Manage and oversee a team of offshore contractors who perform managed services, project delivery work, and continuous improvement projects

Drive a culture of self-service BI and thought leadership through experience and expertise

Ensure data governance and data quality standards are met throughout the data lifecycle

Assist in maintaining Catalent’s Enterprise Data Catalog to ensure accuracy, integrity, and completeness

Utilize advanced analytics techniques to extract insights from complex data sets regardless of their source or format

Oversee the design and development of intuitive and highly impactful data visualizations, dashboards, and reports using Power BI to facilitate understanding and communication of key insights

Other duties as assigned

The Candidate:

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Data Science, or related field required; Master's degree is a plus

7+ years of proven experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or a related role, with a strong track record of leading global BI initiatives

Familiarity with Cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their services relevant to data management and analytics

Experience with Power BI apps leveraging Databricks as the underpinning is highly desirable

Experience in data visualization tools (SQL, Python, R) and BI visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, QlikView, etc.)

High proficiency with Microsoft Power BI

Why You Should Join Catalent:

Opportunity to impact and help build a growing early talent organization

Potential for career growth within an expanding team

Diverse, inclusive culture

152 hours of PTO + 8 Paid Holidays

Competitive medical benefits and 401K

Dynamic, fast-paced work environment

Catalent offers rewarding opportunities to further your career! Join the global drug development and delivery leader and help us bring over 7,000 life-saving and life-enhancing products to patients around the world. Catalent is an exciting and growing international company where employees work directly with pharma, biopharma and consumer health companies of all sizes to advance new medicines from early development to clinical trials and to the market. Catalent produces more than 70 billion doses per year, and each one will be used by someone who is counting on us. Join us in making a difference.

Catalent is committed to the health and safety of its employees, visitors and the customers and patients we serve. As a result of the global pandemic, we have modified many of our recruitment and on-boarding processes to maintain everyone’s safety. The Human Resources teams will communicate all necessary safety processes and procedures throughout each stage.


personal initiative. dynamic pace. meaningful work.

Visit Catalent Careers to explore career opportunities.

Catalent is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability and veterans.

If you require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process due to a disability, you may submit your request by sending an email, and confirming your request for an accommodation and include the job number, title and location to DisabilityAccommodations@catalent.com. This option is reserved for individuals who require accommodation due to a disability. Information received will be processed by a U.S. Catalent employee and then routed to a local recruiter who will provide assistance to ensure appropriate consideration in the application or hiring process.

Resumes submitted to any Catalent employee by a third party agency and/or search firm without a valid written & signed search agreement, will become the sole property of Catalent. No fee will be paid if a candidate is hired for this position as a result of an unsolicited agency or search firm referral. Thank you.

Catalent NEVER asks candidates to provide any type of payment, bank details, photocopies of identification, social security number or other highly sensitive personal information during the offer process, and we NEVER do so via email or social media. If you receive any such request, DO NOT respond— it is a fraudulent request. Please forward such requests to spam@catalent.com for us to investigate with local authorities.

California Job Seekers can find our California Job Applicant Notice HERE.

THE COMPANY

Onward Energy is an independent power platform that owns and operates over 6.2 GW of utility-scale wind, solar and natural gas generation projects across the U.S. Our Vision is to reliably power a sustainable future. Our Mission is that as North America’s premier independent power generator, we will deliver renewable and reliable power to our customers, opportunities to our associates, sustainable returns to the families who invest in us, and a better world to the next generation. Based in New York, Denver, and Charlotte, we are where renewable meets reliable. See www.onwardenergy.com for more information.

THE CHALLENGE

Onward Energy is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Lead ERP Business Systems Analyst to play an instrumental role in our exciting transformation journey to implement Workday Finance, HR, and Planning solutions across our organization. This role will be pivotal in all facets of the project implementation and postproduction maintenance.

THE RESPONSIBILITIES

Requirements Gathering: Collaborate with key stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into requirements.
System Configuration: Configure Workday modules to align with business requirements across the ERP solution.
Data Migration: Validate transition of data from legacy systems to Workday, ensuring accuracy and data integrity.
Testing and Quality Assurance: Develop and execute comprehensive test plans to validate Workday configurations and integrations.
Documentation: Create and maintain detailed documentation of system configurations, business processes, and project-related workflows.
Training: Provide training and support to end-users, ensuring they are proficient with Workday functionalities.
Issue Resolution: Act as the primary point of contact for troubleshooting issues and collaborate with the implementation team to resolve any challenges that arise.
Project Collaboration: Work closely with the project team members to ensure the successful and timely delivery of the Workday implementation project.
Post Implementation: Support troubleshooting production issues, configure and test new requirements, and develop and test additional reporting requirements.
Continuous Improvement: Stay updated on Workday updates and industry best practices, and emerging trends, providing recommendations for system enhancements.
Other duties as assigned.

THE PROFILE TO SUCCEED

Bachelor’s Degree in business, information technology, or related field.

Ten (10)+ years of experience as an ERP business systems analyst, particularly in all facets of an implementation project.
Strong understanding of Financial and\or HR business processes.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills.
Self-starter with a strong work ethic and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to engage with project stakeholders.
Ability to work under strict deadlines and adapt to change in a fast-paced environment; ability to work on multiple tasks concurrently.
Work well independently and collaboratively with a cross-functional team.
Team player with a “no task is too small” attitude.

THE PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Must be able to accomplish physical requirements with or without reasonable accommodation.

Ability to talk, hear, and close and distance vision capability.
Ability to travel up to 10%.

THE WORK ENVIRONMENT

The position functions in a smoke and vaping free professional office environment. The role routinely utilizes standard office equipment such as laptop computer, phone, and scanner/photocopier.

THE TOTAL REWARDS

Onward Energy total rewards philosophy is motivated by a key tenet of People First and offers associates a comprehensive total rewards package which includes market competitive compensation, health insurance, life insurance, and retirement savings benefits.

If you require an accommodation for any part of the employment process due to a disability to HR@onwardenergy.com.

Why Work at Lenovo

We are Lenovo. We do what we say. We own what we do. We WOW our customers.

Lenovo is a US$62 billion revenue global technology powerhouse, ranked #171 in the Fortune Global 500, employing 77,000 people around the world, and serving millions of customers every day in 180 markets. Focused on a bold vision to deliver smarter technology for all, Lenovo has built on its success as the world’s largest PC company by further expanding into growth areas that fuel the advancement of ‘New IT’ technologies (client, edge, cloud, network, and intelligence) including server, storage, mobile, software, solutions, and services.

This transformation together with Lenovo’s world-changing innovation is building a more inclusive, trustworthy, and smarter future for everyone, everywhere. To find out more visit https://www.lenovo.com, and read about the latest news via our StoryHub.

Description and Requirements

We are currently seeking a skilled and motivated Software Finance Operations Analyst to join our Cloud & Software organization. As a Software Finance Operations Analyst, you will play a key role in analyzing financial data, providing insights, and supporting strategic decision-making within the company. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical background, excellent financial modeling skills, and a deep understanding of the cloud and software industry.

Responsibilities:

1. Financial Planning and Analysis:

Prepare financial forecasts, budgets, and long-term financial plans for the organization.
Analyze financial data and key performance indicators (KPIs) to identify trends, risks, and opportunities.
Provide insightful financial analysis and recommendations to support strategic decision-making by senior management.

2. Financial Reporting:

Prepare accurate and timely financial reports, including monthly and quarterly financial statements.
Create financial dashboards and presentations to communicate financial performance to stakeholders.
Assist in the preparation of board presentations and management reporting packs.

3. Business Performance Monitoring:

Monitor and analyze business performance metrics, comparing actual results to budget and forecast.
Identify and investigate variances, providing explanations and recommending corrective actions.
Develop financial models and scenarios to support business planning and resource allocation decisions.

4. Investment Analysis:

Evaluate investment opportunities, including new projects, product launches, and market expansions.
Conduct financial feasibility studies, analyzing potential returns, risks, and market dynamics.
Provide financial recommendations and support business cases for capital expenditure requests.

5. Pricing and Profitability Analysis:

Analyze product and service pricing structures, evaluating profitability and margin trends.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop pricing strategies and optimize revenue streams.
Conduct profitability analysis by customer, product, and market segment.

6. Data Management and Systems:

Collaborate with IT teams to enhance financial systems, reporting tools, and data integrity.
Develop and maintain financial models and databases to support forecasting and analysis.
Ensure data accuracy and consistency, implementing controls and validation procedures.


Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field
5+ years of experience as a Financial Analyst


Preferred Qualifications:

Financial Analyst experience preferably within the cloud and software industry.
Strong analytical and financial modeling skills.
Proficiency in financial analysis tools, spreadsheet applications, and financial software.
Solid understanding of financial statements, accounting principles, and financial metrics.
Ability to work independently and collaborate in cross-functional teams.
Detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy and attention to detail.
Strong organizational skills and ability to meet deadlines.
MBA
Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking abilities.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Proven experience in the following areas:
Group Budget Management
Executive Financial Reporting
Financial Analysis
SaaS/SW Forecasting

About The Role:

Responsible for conducting a variety of analyses for the development of deliverables focused on multifamily commercial real estate strategies in support of CBRE Southeast Multifamily’s clients. Draws conclusion(s) from analyses and makes recommendations to senior leaders for new business development and transactions. Knowledgeable on fundamental concepts, practices and procedures associated with commercial real estate finance, including commercial valuation, market analysis and investment analysis.

What You'll Do:

Generates, reviews and understands reports; uses aggregate data from multiple sources to assist in creating a complete analysis, improvement and/or recommendation.

Types of analyses includes one or all of the following: real estate industry/market, underwriting and valuation, variance analyses, budgeting, forecasting and strategic planning.

Prepares a variety of analyses, presentations and proposals for new business development

Provides recommendations for management/Producer review.

Compiles information for the creation of marketing campaigns for sale of properties to include customized property information materials, comparable market analysis, and market and industry research

Compiles analysis and internal and external collateral into offering memorandums for seller clients, proofreads content, ensures appropriate branding, and approves materials for final distribution.

Assists in the coordination and implementation of strategic platform strategies; performs research and analysis to support those strategies.

Serves as liaison with clients, lenders (if applicable), and government agencies (if applicable).

May conduct ad hoc studies for producers upon request.

What You'll Need:

To perform this job successfully, an individual will need to perform each crucial duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

Bachelor's Degree required. Minimum of two years of experience in Real Estate or Finance required. Experience with Multifamily Commercial Real Estate preferred.

Real Estate Sales License preferred but not required.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Professional writing capability / very strong business vocabulary, and ability to create a narrative that best positions an asset for Marketing and Sales.

Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, internal rates of return and/ or cash on cash calculations. Conducts intermediate financial analysis.

Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret documents. Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.

Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely results, courteous service to customers, and to effectively present information.

Extremely organized with regard to electronic filing in a team environment where consistency and labeling are key for multiple team members accessing the same folders.

Working knowledge of Microsoft Suite products including: Word, PowerPoint, Excel, etc. Knowledge of ARGUS or excel modeling preferred.

Why CBRE?

When you join CBRE you will have the support and resources of a global firm where an entrepreneurial mentality is encouraged. You'll realize your potential with exciting work, fast-paced assignments, an environment of constant learning and dedication to results! To enable your success, we provide the best tools, training and leaders in the industry.

Our culture is built on our RISE values and reflects the needs and perspectives of our clients and our people. Our work is guided by our North Star: Crafting the real estate solutions of tomorrow, so businesses and people thrive.

Coming to work for CBRE, you will receive a comprehensive benefits package, 401k, and extraordinary perks such as career growth and longevity!

Job Description
Overview

The Billing Operations Analyst is responsible for billing customers in an accurate and timely manner. Critical job duties include reviewing sales documentation for billing and revenue implications, ensuring that relevant contractual terms are captured in the billing system, preparing reports and other supporting documentation, generating customer invoices, and recommending changes to improve billing processes. The Billing Operations Analyst develops solutions to billing issues and works with systems design to implement new features, and may work on billing projects with Billing Operations Mgmt.


Responsibilities

Job Responsibilities

Review sales agreements and orders to ensure that relevant contractual terms are captured in the billing system
Verify that subscriptions are set-up in the billing system properly so that resulting invoices are accurate and produce the correct accounting treatment
Respond in a timely manner to billing inquiries from customers and internal constituents
Process customer cancellations requests and verify that customer accounts are de-provisioned and accurately refunded if needed
Work across departments to research and resolve customer issues related to billings
Prepare billing reports and other related supporting documentation
Identify and implement billing process improvements that increase efficiency, improve the accuracy of invoices, or strengthen controls
Assist with the development and implementation of billing system improvements, including defining requirements and performing user acceptance tests
Fulfill quarterly and annual audit requests
Perform special projects as requested


Qualifications

Required Qualifications (absolute must haves walking in the door)


Bachelors' degree, preferably in Business Administration with an emphasis in Accounting or Finance
3+ years of experience in a billing role at a SaaS company (preferred) with revenues of at least $100 million. No medical billing will be considered.
Hands-on experience with a top-tier CRM, billing, and/or ERP system
Advanced Excel skills (Vlookup, pivot tables)
Track record for meeting deadlines
Ability to work across multiple systems and navigate quickly from one system to another
Aptitude for the accurately processing a high-volume of data
Familiarity with revenue recognition and other generally accepted accounting principles
Effective working both independently and within a team
Skilled at problem-solving; able to discern alternatives, make objective recommendations, and collaborate with others to accomplish goals
Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in written form
Preferred Qualifications (great to have but not absolutely necessary)


Proficiency using SQL
Hands-on experience with Salesforce, Zuora and/or NetSuite


About Avalara

About Avalara:
We’re building cloud-based tax compliance solutions to handle every transaction in the world. Imagine every transaction you make — every tank of gas, cup of coffee, or pair of sneakers, every movie ticket, meal kit, or streamed song, every sensor-to-sensor ping. Nearly every time you make a purchase, physical or digital, there’s an accompanying unique and nuanced tax compliance calculation. The logic behind calculating taxes — the rules, rates, and boundaries is a global, layered, three-dimensional mess of complexity, with compliance dictated by governments and applied by every business, every day.

Avalara works with businesses of all sizes, all over the world — from corner stores to gigantic global retailers — to calculate tax accurately and automatically, at speeds measured in milliseconds. That’s a massive technical challenge, in terms of scale, reliability, and complexity, and we do it better than anyone. That’s why we’re growing fast. Headquartered in Seattle, Avalara has offices across the U.S. and around the world, in Brazil, Canada, India, U.K, Belgium and across Europe.

Labcorp is recruiting a IT Business Intelligence(BI) Analytics Manager for a dynamic team in RTP or Burlington, North Carolina. Our passion lies in leveraging LabCorp Holding's data assets, to create value for the company and its stakeholders. The IT Business Intelligence (BI) Analytics Manager is primarily responsible leading a team of BI Professionals for the design and maintenance of business intelligence and analytical capabilities. These include both new development and ongoing support for various LabCorp Holdings business units. The IT Business Intelligence (BI) Analytics Manager will support and implement solutions that lead to insightful analytics, make predictions or generate recommendations, using best-in-breed tools.

This candidate is someone who is master at analyzing data and has experience developing analytical models to predict customer behavior and business events. Passionate about developing algorithms to solve real problems in wide range of areas from Marketing, Finance, Supply Chain to Clinical Bioinformatics. A successful candidate will thrive in an environment where problem solving is the core function of their role. He/she is confident being pushed to learn new technical concepts or programming languages in a short period of time.

This role is part of Corporate IT and you will have overall responsibility for the dissemination of analytical thinking and skills into the rest of the informatics organization, including our BI team that utilize advanced techniques to interpret and represent machine learning and statistical modeling outcomes. You will work closely with teams to champion informatics-based innovation efforts and execute a prioritized roadmap of experiments that take advantage of business opportunities.

Required Knowledge, Skills - Abilities:

Hands-on experience Data analysis, predictive model, statistical model design, development and validation including:

Write complex SQL queries to turn transactional data into information.

Develop traditional supervised and unsupervised analytical models (Regression, Decision Tree, Clustering, Segmentation, PCA/SVD, Mixture Modeling, and Expectation Maximization).

Meet with stakeholders, develop positive relationships, and turn problems into projects.

Design, develop, implement and oversee high-end analytical, technology processes and solutions with a focus on leveraging advanced analytical methods.

Build analytical solutions for diverse business areas from Value chain to HR by manipulating large data sets and integrating diverse data sources.

Build skills in analytical areas relating to pattern recognition, machine learning, knowledge discovery, and information retrieval techniques.

Develop and score both classification and predictive models.

Create information-rich data visualizations and reports from complex data.

Build knowledge of health care business processes, including billing, results delivery, clinical trials, marketing, diagnostic testing.

Perform ad-hoc analysis and develop reproducible analytical approaches to meet business requirements.

Ability to gather data, compile information, and prepare reports.

Understanding and hands-on use of ETL tooling (Alteryx, Tableau Prep,

DataStage, Talend, Glue) and replication processes to centralize and standardize data coming from one or more source system.

Management experience building and leading a team of designers for analytical applications.

Strong information architecture and visualization skills required.

Proficient with user interface design patterns, data visualization, data mining and/or analytics and standard user centered design methodologies.

Ability to deliver quality work within strict deadlines while managing multiple priorities and acting with a sense of urgency; able to work well with complexity and ambiguity.

Excellent interpersonal, analytical, and problem-solving skills.

Relates well to others, engages people and helps them understand change, provides and looks for feedback, articulates clearly, and actively listens.

Understanding of Agile Methodologies and Scrum framework Teamwork skills with the ability to work in complex cross-functional settings.

Your ability to interpret highly specialized healthcare and value chain terms and data, and present derived insights, visually and orally, to others with different areas of expertise, will be key to your success.

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Engineering or Computer Science and 4 years' experience OR Master's degree in quantitative field, such as Statistics, Engineering, or Advanced Analytics.

Experience leading large scale data science projects and delivering from end to end.

7+ years of experience using variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations.

Experience in advanced machine learning algorithms - deep learning, boosting methods, time series etc.

5+ years of experience in SQL development Deep expertise with R, Python, Alteryx SageMaker, Spark, PySpark. SAS a bonus.

This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Proven experience in creating effective sales pitches and playbooks

Exceptional writing skills with the ability to create compelling sales narratives
Strong business acumen and understanding of the industry ecosystem
Experience in building comprehensive sales materials
Craft engaging stories that resonate with a variety of audiences
A background in narrative design or a related field is a plus
Strong leadership and problem-solving skills
