Why You’ll Love Cisco
We change the World, you will become passionate about your employer and the brand you represent. Everything is converging on the Internet, making networked connections more meaningful than ever before in our lives. Our employees' groundbreaking ideas impact everything. Here, that means we take creative ideas from the drawing board to dynamic solutions that have real world impact. You'll collaborate with Cisco leaders, partner with mentors, and develop incredible relationships with colleagues who share your interest in connecting the unconnected. You'll be part a team that cares about its customers, enjoys having fun, and you'll take part in changing the lives of those in our local communities. Come prepared to be encouraged and inspired.
What You'll Do
We have a fantastic opportunity for a Business Software Analysis Manager who wants to develop their technical skills and functional understanding as they plan, design, and implement new capabilities in the Salesforce platform. You would play a critical role in the team, defining business processes for, and guiding the tactical execution of, our development teams.
Who You'll Work With
You'll be part of a highly dynamic and empowered team of collaborative engineers, technical leads, architects, business systems analysts who are passionate about building, supporting and enhancing our partner platforms. You will interact with key business partners in Channel related Sales, Legal, Finance, Business Operations, and Customer/Partner Experience teams. You will align your work with the project team and multi-functional programs related to Recurring Revenue Growth, Partner Experience and New Routes to Market. In addition, you will work with the business and technical architecture groups, Product Owners, Release Train Engineers and leads from the Enterprise Release Management Office along with operational leaders responsible for Sales and Partner Operations.
Who You Are
A hardworking, experienced, and self-motivated professional who enjoys digging into complicated problems and exploring details of technical implementations. Someone who has a clear passion for solving functional challenges using technology and thrives in bringing transparency to ambiguous and business critical situations. A standout colleague capable of influencing within and outside of the team, as well as being an agent for change and transformation. Someone with an ability to take the lead in developing business solutions and clearly communicating complex concepts.
Minimum Requirements
Bachelor’s and 7+ years of experience in IT/Business Analyst or a technical role or a master’s and 4 years of experience
Understanding of software development lifecycles and tools, including design and operations.
Preferred Requirements
Lead and maintain an agile partnership between business, operations, and IT.
Experienced in facilitating estimation and decision-making sessions.
Test Automation experience with tools such as UiPath
Experience, knowledge of Oracle, PL/SQL, API frameworks will be an additional advantage.
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills.
Familiarity with Business models and principles.
Why Cisco
#WeAreCisco. We are all unique, but collectively we bring our talents to work as a team, to develop innovative technology and power a more inclusive, digital future for everyone. How do we do it? Well, for starters – with people like you!
Nearly every internet connection around the world touches Cisco. We’re the Internet’s optimists. Our technology makes sure the data traveling at light speed across connections does so securely, yet it’s not what we make but what we make happen which marks us out. We’re helping those who work in the health service to connect with patients and each other; schools, colleges, and universities to teach in even the most challenging of times. We’re helping businesses of all shapes and sizes to connect with their employees and customers in new ways, providing people with access to the digital skills they need and connecting the most remote parts of the world – whether through 5G, or otherwise.
We tackle whatever challenges come our way. We have each other’s backs, we recognize our accomplishments, and we grow together. We celebrate and support one another – from big and small things in life to big career moments. And giving back is in our DNA (we get 10 days off each year to do just that).
We know that powering an inclusive future starts with us. Because without diversity and a dedication to equality, there is no moving forward. Our 30 Inclusive Communities, that bring people together around commonalities or passions, are leading the way. Together we’re committed to learning, listening, caring for our communities, whilst supporting the most vulnerable with a collective effort to make this world a better place either with technology, or through our actions.
So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco


Message to applicants applying to work in the U.S. and/or Canada:


When available, the salary range posted for this position reflects the projected hiring range for new hire, full-time salaries in U.S. and/or Canada locations, not including equity or benefits. For non-sales roles the hiring ranges reflect base salary only; employees are also eligible to receive annual bonuses. Hiring ranges for sales positions include base and incentive compensation target. Individual pay is determined by the candidate's hiring location and additional factors, including but not limited to skillset, experience, and relevant education, certifications, or training. Applicants may not be eligible for the full salary range based on their U.S. or Canada hiring location. The recruiter can share more details about compensation for the role in your location during the hiring process.
U.S. employees have access to quality medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with a Cisco matching contribution, short and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance and numerous wellbeing offerings. Employees receive up to twelve paid holidays per calendar year, which includes one floating holiday, plus a day off for their birthday. Employees accrue up to 20 days of Paid Time Off (PTO) each year and have access to paid time away to deal with critical or emergency issues without tapping into their PTO. We offer additional paid time to volunteer and give back to the community. Employees are also able to purchase company stock through our Employee Stock Purchase Program.
Employees on sales plans earn performance-based incentive pay on top of their base salary, which is split between quota and non-quota components. For quota-based incentive pay, Cisco pays at the standard rate of 1% of incentive target for each 1% revenue attainment against the quota up to 100%. Once performance exceeds 100% quota attainment, incentive rates may increase up to five times the standard rate with no cap on incentive compensation. For non-quota-based sales performance elements such as strategic sales objectives, Cisco may pay up to 125% of target. Cisco sales plans do not have a minimum threshold of performance for sales incentive compensation to be paid.

Job Title: Operations Analyst, Advisor; Senior Operations SME - Secret clearance required
Job Description:
Clearance Level Secret Category Military Operations Location Fort Liberty, North Carolina Onsite Workplace

Public Trust: None
Requisition Type: Regular
Your Impact

Own your opportunity to work with the largest government agency in the nation. Make an impact by advancing the Department of Defense’s mission to keep our country safe and secure.

Job Description

Ensure the safety and security of our nation as an Operations Analyst Advisor at GDIT. You’ll apply the latest technology and provide operational support to deliver actionable intelligence for the Intelligence Community. Here, your work will have meaning and impact as you deliver your best every day.

At GDIT, people are our differentiator. As an Operations Analyst Advisor you will help ensure today is safe and tomorrow is smarter. Our work depends on an Operations Analyst Advisor joining our team to strengthen our Lower Command and Control Cell (LOWCOM) and to accurately and realistically develop exercise products and role-play tactical Special Operations Force units during exercises. Most of our exercises will be Commander's Assessments, designed to assist a unit Commander to train and assess his/her staff, and other exercises will be External Evaluations (EXEVALs) conducted as part of unit pre-deployment activities.

HOW AN OPERATIONS ANALYST ADVISOR WILL MAKE AN IMPACT

Provides military subject matter expertise to assigned programs
Participate with other members of the LOWCOM team in exercise vignette development to address relevant staff Mission Essential Tasks (METs).
Review "Lessons Learned" from previous exercises to identify and resolve training shortfalls in order to assist newly formed Special Operations Task Force (SOTF), Joint Special Operations Task Force (JSOTF), and Special Operations Joint Task Force (SOJTF) staffs to efficiently execute all staff Battle Drills.
Work with fellow employees who are former Special Forces, Civil Affairs, PSYOP, USAF CCT/TACP personnel and sister service veterans to identify and develop cross-functional team injects and vignettes.
An Operations Analyst will ensure that exercise scenarios encompass the following activities: Special Forces Operations, Intelligence, Psychological Operations, Civil Affairs, Logistics, Fires, Insurgency Forces, Future Operations, other Government agencies, and non-government agencies. Operations Analysts ensure successful completion of these activities in a training environment to assure Commanders that units are prepared to fully execute their assigned missions upon deployment.
An Operations Analyst will maintain familiarity with and adhere to current Army and Joint doctrine and training strategies throughout the exercise development Life Cycle.


WHAT YOU’LL NEED TO SUCCEED:

Education: Bachelor's Degree. Eight (8) years of related military experience may substitute for academic degree.
Required Experience: Assignment to Special Operations Forces (Special Forces, Military Information Support Operations, Civil Affairs, Ranger Regiment, Special Operations Aviation, Special Mission units), or assignment to one of the following: Military Intelligence, Logistics Corps, Field Artillery. (Equivalent assignments within other Department of Defense military branches apply.)
Required Technical Skills: Graduate of U.S. Army Special Forces Qualifying Course (Officer) 18A, Warrant Officer (180A), Noncommissioned Officer (18-series) Military Occupation Specialties) and graduate of a U.S. military officer’s intermediate course or Senior Service College, or Special Forces Warrant Officer Advanced Course, or from one of the following U.S. military Noncommissioned Officer Education System courses: First Sergeant Course or Sergeants Major Course.
Security Clearance Level: Secret
Required Skills and Abilities: Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written), problem solving, and mission planning. Must have basic computer skills.
Preferred Skills: Two years of experience researching, planning, preparing, coordinating, and executing Mission Readiness Exercises (MRXs).
Location: On Customer Site at the Special Operations Mission Training Center (SOMTC), Fort Liberty, NC.
US Citizenship: Required


GDIT IS YOUR PLACE:

401K with company match
Comprehensive health and wellness packages
Internal mobility team dedicated to helping you own your career
Professional growth opportunities including paid education and certifications
Cutting-edge technology you can learn from
Rest and recharge with paid vacation and holidays

#GDITArmy

Company Name: City of Charlotte and Mecklenburg County
Job Description:
Charlotte’s local government, with more than 7,000 employees and a $2.39 billion budget, works hard to ensure that the community will be a winning city for everyone – a truly remarkable place to live, work, learn and play.


Charlotte Water is an enterprise department of the City of Charlotte and one of the largest public water and sewer service providers in the southeast with 300,000 customer accounts and over 1000 employees. Our service area includes the City of Charlotte, Mecklenburg County and the towns of Huntersville, Cornelius, Davidson, Mint Hill, Matthews and Pineville. Charlotte Water’s FY 23 budget is $535M and a five-year capital program of $2.5 billion. We enjoy the highest credit ratings from all three major credit rating agencies as a result of sound financial planning and management and strong support from our City Council. We value competent, skilled candidates with a customer service focus to work in a team environment.


Overview

The City of Charlotte is the largest municipality in North Carolina and the 15th largest city in the United States, with a total population of more than 897,000 citizens. A major commerce center, Charlotte hosts several of the nation’s largest banks and technology companies.

Also known as the Queen City, Charlotte is home to the Carolina Panthers, the Charlotte Hornets and the NASCAR Hall of Fame. We work hard to ensure that the community will be a winning city for everyone – a truly remarkable place to live, work, learn and play. Join us in helping to keep our City thriving, ensuring upward mobility and advancement in the workplace.

Function
Professional - Technology
Summary
The Center for Digital Government named Charlotte one of the top five digital cities in the nation. The City of Charlotte Innovation & Technology department (I&T) provides executive-level leadership, delivers technology services to city departments and partner agencies, and coordinates information technology initiatives across the organization to support, enhance and advance citizen service delivery. Charlotte Water Technology is a division of the I&T Department and directly supports Charlotte Water.


Charlotte Water is seeking a Business Systems Manager to lead, develop, and manage, business system supervisors, business system analysts, application administrators, and technical resources. These resources support various business systems and programs that support content management, construction management, and business analytics. The position is responsible for the life-cycle management of the OnBase and eBuilder applications and developing a data and analytics program for Charlotte Water. The data analytics program responsibilities include building and maintaining the data integration architecture, framework, and processes that support data warehouse and business analytics and developing and implementing business processes to manage the related program and system activities. Other essential activities include collaboration with managers and resources to identify business needs and lead planning, budget development, procurement, and managing costs across all activities.


Major Duties and Responsibilities
Supervises the work of personnel, including assigning and reviewing work, providing guidance, and conducting performance evaluations.
Facilitates strategic planning for departmental initiatives. Recommends technology to meet current and future needs.
Participates in the RFP process, selection of solution/vendor, and contract negotiation.
Monitors program-level budget and deliverables.
Manages service delivery expectations and ensures system availability for 24x7 operational departments. Drives continuous improvements in availability across technology offerings, functional capabilities, and performance objectives.
Works with vendor partners to ensure data collection standards and regulatory tracking.
Serves as a representative of the department at meetings with other technology managers.
Develops and implements business processes to manage program and system activities.
Interacts with stakeholders and other departments to identify opportunities and drive growth.
Performs related work as required.


Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
Knowledge of relational database management systems and system architecture.
Knowledge of data warehouse system architecture and related architectural frameworks, including Data Vault 2.0 and Dimensional Modeling (Star Schema)
Knowledge of reporting and dashboarding tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, and SSRS
Knowledge of Data Governance
Knowledge of metadata standards and procedures
Ability to direct and organize project or program activities
Ability to apply principles and practices of employee supervision, including managing and monitoring work performance, evaluating program/work objectives and effectiveness, and realigning work and staffing assignments
Ability to think strategically
Ability to consider the business implications of applying technology to the current and future business environment
Ability to provide leadership and vision in managing teams and initiatives
Ability to establish governance teams that offer control and prioritization to administrative support personnel
Ability to form and define system scope and objectives based upon business needs
Advanced ability to use WhereScape, Visual Studio. SQL Server Management Studio, Master Data Services, and Tableau.
Ability to manage vendor relationships
Ability to meet schedules and deadlines of the work
Project management methodology and service delivery.
Principles and practices of budget management, including annual budgeting and long-term forecasting
Principles and methods of business analysis and business process improvement
Understand system life cycle management
Customer service oriented
Communicate effectively, both orally and in writing


Preferred Qualification
Minimum of three years of supervisory experience
Proficiency in scripting languages such as Transactional SQL, Python, PowerShell, and Batch
Knowledge of project management software
General knowledge of Water and Wastewater Utility business operations


Minimum Qualifications
High school diploma or equivalent
Eleven (11) years of work experience in business analysis, requirements definition, and information technology support, including prior supervisory experience


OR
Associate's Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field
Nine (9) years experience in business analysis, requirements definition, and information technology support, including prior supervisory experience


OR
Bachelor's level degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field
Seven (7) years experience in business analysis, requirements definition, and information technology support, including prior supervisory experience
OR
Master's level degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field
Five (5) years relevant work experience


Conditions of Employment

The City’s Background Check Policy requires background checks to be conducted on final internal or external candidate(s) applying for any position with the City of Charlotte. The type of information that will be collected as part of a background check includes, but is not limited to: reference checks, social security verification, education verification, criminal conviction record check, and, if applicable, a credit history check, sex offender registry and motor vehicle records check.

Background checks must be in compliance with all federal and state statutes, such as the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA). The checks must be consistent with the guidelines set forth by these laws requiring organizations to obtain a candidate’s written authorization before obtaining a criminal background report, motor vehicle records check or credit report; and to properly store and dispose of information derived from such reports.

Final candidates must pass a pre-employment drug-screening test and physical examination. During the selection process, candidates may be asked to take a skills test, and/or participate in other assessments.

The City of Charlotte is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

How To Apply

Apply online.

Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job.

You are welcome to visit the City of Charlotte Human Resources Department lobby where we have workstations available. Our office is located at 700 East 4th Street, Suite 200, Charlotte, NC 28202. Our hours are Monday through Friday, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. (EST), excluding official City holidays.

Anyone seeking an accommodation to apply for a job may call (704) 336-2285 for assistance or you may email questions to CityHrJobPostingsNotify@ci.charlotte.nc.us.

Benefits

The City of Charlotte provides a comprehensive benefits package to all employees.

Click here to learn more about the City of Charlotte’s benefits.

The City of Charlotte is a drug and alcohol-free workplace.

In Conclusion
If you have technical issues submitting your application, click here.

The Role at a Glance
Lincoln National Corporation seeks an Analyst, Contact Center System Configuration in Greensboro, NC. Analyze and deliver complex interaction routing and overall system configuration assignments and projects. Serve as a central point-of-contact to analyze and support configuration and deployment of Five9 system capabilities that enhance call routing and conversational design for voice and chat channels and provide a high quality and internal/external customer experience. Maintain full understanding of all available Five9 admin training modules. Maintain knowledge on current and emerging developments /trends and available features in Five9, assess their impact, and collaborate with senior management to incorporate new trends and developments for current and future solutions. Enhance organizational initiatives by influencing and supporting change management and/or departmental/enterprise initiatives. Collaborate with internal/external stakeholders to assess, select, and recommend more complex solutions or alternative approaches to achieve business goals. Identify and recommend implementation of process improvements to significantly improve quality and automation of work tasks across the team, department, and business unit. Maintain accuracy and quality of system decision tables and workflow rules per requirements. Responsible for all VCC (Virtual Contact Center) and Studio configurations and new developments in Five9. Optimize configurable data and business rules to fully utilize functionality and flexibility of systems by creating and adjusting campaigns, campaign profiles, IVR’s, dispositions, and dialing strategy. Develop and configure more complex interaction routing and conversational design per low-level design and technical design documentation to meet defined requirements. Ensure documentation for more complex configuration, interaction routing, and conversational design is well maintained. Comply and assist in enforcing configuration standards, policies, and procedures. Perform testing and provide complex testing support to ensure quality of configured components. Use automation tools such as scripts, ActiveSync, or Cyara to reduce or eliminate manual efforts when possible

What we're looking for
Requirements: Bachelor’s degree (or foreign equivalent) in Electronics & Communications Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, or related degree and 3 years of experience in business analysis of contact center system configurations within the financial or insurance industry. Additional experience must include: 3 years of experience with developer tools and languages including Splunk, JavaScript, C#, HTML, GITLAB, and App Dynamics for developing, troubleshooting, and consulting on Contact Center technology solutions; 3 years of experience developing and consulting on Contact Center integration solutions for Contact Center applications (e.g. Pindrop or Verint), connection methods and tools, including Webservices, API and API integration, and desktop application packaging; 1 year of experience with Telephony administration, a combination of two or more Contact Center technologies (e.g. Five9, CRM tools, Workforce management, or Pindrop), and key performance indicators to enhance the customer experience; and 1 year of experience with AGILE project methodologies (SCRUM or Kanban). 100% WFH, but must live within commutable distance of Greensboro, NC office. Salary: $85,000/year to $125,000/year. Apply to https://jobs.lincolnfinancial.com & use Req ID 72450


What’s it like to work here?

The base pay is just one component of Lincoln’s total rewards package for employees. In addition, the role may be eligible for the Annual Incentive Program, which is discretionary and based on the performance of the company, business unit and individual. Other rewards may include long-term incentives, sales incentives and Lincoln’s standard benefits package.


About The Company
Lincoln Financial Group helps people to plan, protect and retire with confidence. As of Dec. 31, 2022, approximately 16 million customers trust our guidance and solutions across four core businesses – annuities, life insurance, group protection and retirement plan services. As of September 30, 2023, the company had $290 billion in end-of-period account balances, net of reinsurance. Lincoln is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and Instagram.


Be Aware of Fraudulent Recruiting Activities
If you are interested in a career at Lincoln, we encourage you to review our current openings and apply on our website. Lincoln values the privacy and security of every applicant and urges all applicants to diligently protect their sensitive personal information from scams targeting job seekers. These scams can take many forms including fake employment applications, bogus interviews and falsified offer letters.
Lincoln will not ask applicants to provide their social security numbers, date of birth, bank account information or other sensitive information in job applications. Additionally, our recruiters do not communicate with applicants through free e-mail accounts (Gmail, Yahoo, Hotmail) or conduct interviews utilizing video chat rooms. We will never ask applicants to provide payment during the hiring process or extend an offer without conducting a phone, live video or in-person interview. Please contact Lincoln's fraud team at fraudhotline@lfg.com if you encounter a recruiter or see a job opportunity that seems suspicious.


Additional Information

If you are a person with a disability that impedes your ability to express your interest for a position through our online application process, or require TTY/TDD assistance, contact us by calling 260-455-2558.

JOB
Serving as a member of the Parks and Recreation Department senior staff, reporting to the Director, the purpose of this position is to provide support to the department and its director by performing planning and research activities to strategically support department operations. This includes preparing and conducting research and analysis for forecasting current and future department operational and capital demands. This is accomplished by analyzing department expenditures and revenues, including the implementation, monitoring and evaluation of a service cost recovery program, managing data collection, and analyzing department functions. The analyst interacts and coordinates with department divisions; reviewing and analyzing their budget requests; providing information and recommendations to staff; preparing financial forecasts and compiling data for staff. Other duties include managing and updating the department’s business plan, managing and developing the department’s budget process, recommending policies, maintaining benchmarks and performance measures, and serving as the department’s technology advisor and software manager.

EXAMPLE OF DUTIES
Analyze and monitor budget, including expenditures and revenue targets.Ongoing implementation of the department’s fee schedule and cost recovery program.Assist divisions with budgetary questions, review change requests, identify budget issues and recommend corrective measures.Takes a lead role in completion of the department’s annual budget submittal and department business plan: compiles and reviews requests, analyzes information for trends and compliance, meets with divisions and managers on requests, reviews revenues, fees and trends, recommends funding levels.Takes a lead role in developing performance measures: compiles performance data, supplying justifications, coordinating information with division heads/managers.Works with Division heads and managers to research grant opportunities; assists in grant application development and submittal.Analyzes business needs, workflows, and business processes to determine areas and opportunities for improvement. Provides recommendations based on the data and assists staff in understanding data sets and their context.Provides consultative support to the department on technology issues; serves as the primary department liaison to RecTrac technology support, other software support teams.Serves as a department liaison in committees and meetings.Serves as a backup manager for the department’s webpage.Additional duties as assigned by department director.

Job Title

IT Support Specialist

Location:

Charlotte, NC

Reports to Job Title:

IT Manager

Job Summary

The IT Support Specialist is responsible for developing and managing all Renewal by Andersen of the Carolinas (RbAC) IT equipment, programs, and initiatives. The focus of this role will be to design and develop scalable technology programs and solutions that align with our company culture, business objectives, and growth strategy. The incumbent needs to be highly organized, an advanced problem solver, able to manage multiple projects and priorities at any given time and have a strong background and aptitude with the Microsoft and Apple platforms. The incumbent needs to be adept at executing and bringing projects to completion within required timelines. In addition, this individual will need to be able to manage both internal and external IT and business resources.

Key Job Responsibilities

Working with our external Managed Service Provider (MSP) and using their written IT security protocols, you will monitor and maintain IT security standards and protocols with RbAC employees, including standard security settings and operating procedures for accessing and using the RbAC Microsoft tenant; insure the execution of relevant teammate training programs and documentation from the MSP on an ongoing basis.
Management of our single IT Managed Service Provider and other software vendor partners including our contract renewals, service level agreements, scheduling vendor meetings, and holding vendors accountable for these standards and service deliverables.
Must have experience in developing, implementing, and maintaining proper IT onboarding and offboarding programs, overseeing an external help desk system, creating relevant IT policies, and process documentation if needed.
Working independently and in coordination with our MSP, develop an audit schedule and processes to maintain and manage accounts and licenses. Audits include but are not limited to Microsoft 365, distribution lists, Adobe, Zoom, DocuSign, Verizon SIM cards, our Dell Laptop and Apple iPad fleets.
This position will play a primary role in IT project management and delivery and must be able to manage 2 to 3 multi-location issues/ projects at any given time.
Act as an escalation point for resolving all internal IT software, hardware and network connectivity issues including setup, connectivity, functionality as needed.
Stay current with relevant technology trends and provide recommendations for cost-effective solutions for efficiency and productivity.
Onsite support, including new equipment set up as needed; other duties as assigned.

Job Requirements

Knowledge/Skills

Strong technical capability and aptitude, including knowledge of IT security best practices and technologies. Apple experience a plus.
Exceptional vendor management skills.
Process oriented with good business analysis and requirements gathering skills, adept at problem solving and using given resources.
Highly organized with exceptional follow-through with the ability to manage multiple projects with varying degrees of priority both in a team and independent setting.
The ability to pivot with our ever-changing business needs is required.
Polished and professional communication style required, ability to communicate technical concepts to a non-technical audience.
Experience / Education
1-3 years of professional IT experience with technical knowledge of a variety of applications and front-end administration technical solutions required.
At least 1 year managing technical projects or programs.
Bachelor’s degree

Job Title: Global SAP Supply Chain Functional Architect
Job Description:
Overview:
The work we do at FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies (FDB) has never been more important—and we are looking for talented candidates to join us. We’re growing our locations, our capabilities, and our teams, and looking for passionate, mission-driven people like you who want to make a real difference in people’s lives.

We are looking for a Global SAP Supply Chain (MM/PP/QM) Functional Architect to join our Global SAP- IT organisation. This is a strategic role for our company as we embark on a multi-year transformational effort of our global IT and SAP-IT organization.
External US:
About the position
Act as internal consultant and design architect for SAP solution within MM/PP/QM. Partner with peers in the IT organization and fellow Functional Architects to align business processes with solution design, leveraging the capabilities of the SAP modules.
Responsible for the full systems development lifecycle from requirements gathering through implementation of various functional architecture solutions. Translate overall business process requirements to SAP configuration. Understand non-SAP business systems integrated with SAP.
Work closely with our businesses and functional groups to properly diagnose and resolve issues within the supply chain, manufacturing, and quality functional areas.
Interfacing with other CoE Functional Architects, assist business leadership teams in implementing strategic improvements to SAP. Support the identification and prioritization of enhancement opportunities to standardize/improve processes and system configuration that supports the customer-focused approach but ensures compliance to the business management goals and objectives.
Lead and support project initiatives to expand the usage of the SAP solution to improve and expand processes across the enterprise.
Mentor business superusers to increase their competency in SAP.

Qualifications

Passionate about using technology to improve business outcomes for our customers. Understanding user needs and insights with an ability to translate these system requirements specifically to reduce manual tasks.
Current SAP configuration experience in MM, PP, and QM modules.
Pharmaceutical manufacturing industry experience.
Business process analysis and redesign experience: strong business analysis skills; process mapping; business process redesign and implementation. Focused on promoting process best practices.
Systems implementation skills: requirements/process analysis, conceptual and detailed design, configuration, testing, training, change management, support.
Works well with teams or in a team environment, with the ability to work independently. Proven team leadership, mentoring, and project management skills.
Strong stakeholder management skills with the ability to communicate complex messages and drive alignment on the product direction.
Ability to stay motivated in a fast-moving environment where priorities change and with a requirement to deliver results.
Independent and self-motivated with a desire for continuous learning.
Fluency in English is required as we are an international company.
You work equally well independently as well as in a team and you have proven team leadership, mentoring, and project management skills. Furthermore, you are strong in stakeholder management, and you can communicate complex messages and drive alignment on the product direction.
When things go fast and priorities change, you are able to stay motivated, energetic and on top of things. You are self-motivated with a desire for continuous learning.

About the department
You will be part of the Global SAP COE within the FDB IT Department. Our SAP S/4Hana environment comprises all current FDB sites worldwide including Denmark, UK, and US locations - based on a global template flexed to address both MTO and ETO process models. You will work together with other highly dedicated and skilled colleagues focused on the mission of ensuring a stable, efficient, and compliant SAP solution. Simplicity and agility is important in everything we do.

Position Overview:
The primary responsibility of the position is the management of the financial planning, reporting and analysis for Operations including: 1) Operational costs at the Soap and Floor & Surface manufacturing location in Stanley, NC, 2) Distribution expenses, including all freight expenses and costs, at three distribution centers, and (3) inventory valuation (GAAP) including reserves and controls. The position reports directly to the Finance Manager – SCJP North America Operations and interacts with all levels of Finance and Operations. The individual must be a high calibre, self-starter, thrive in an entrepreneurial environment and seamlessly move between multiple objectives. The successful candidate should possess strong analytical and systems skills, demonstrating improvement in business results.
Position & Team Responsibilities:
Financial Planning & Analysis
Develop the annual budget for the Soap and Floor & Surface manufacturing location: (1) operational expenses – labor (direct & indirect), overheads, PPV, MUV and other (transfer pricing and exchange rate), (2) distribution expenses – freight to distribution centers, freight to customers and warehousing expenses, 3) inventories including slow moving, obsolescence and other reserves, (4) headcount, (5) cost savings projects.
Develop annual standard costs for the Soap and Floor & Surface manufacturing location utilizing SCJP costing methodologies.
Analyze actual financial results vs. budget/forecast/prior year and investigate variances.
Make recommendations of cost savings initiatives
Special projects as requested.
Reporting
Develop and prepare monthly financial reporting packages and related commentary for the Soap and Floor & Surface manufacturing location and three (3) distribution centers.
Generate analytic reports measuring operational profitability (labor, overheads, PPV, MUV, headcount, cost savings), product cost analysis, freight costs, warehouse expenses, inventory trends and other reports as requested.
Review monthly manufacturing & distribution costs and recommend inventory reserves adjustments as necessary.
Ensure inventory reporting is accurately valued in accordance with US GAAP including slow moving & obsolescence, lower of cost or market and other required reserves.
Identify system tools required to continuously improve product/cost analysis and reporting.
Controls
Assist in the annual physical inventory / period cycle count process and ensure financial policies are properly followed at the dispensers & inserts manufacturing location.
Conduct periodic review to ensure BOM’s and Routings are calculating costs correctly.
Provide updated cost data as necessary to Marketing to ensure pricing/profitability is maintained.
Skills/Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Finance or Accounting required; Master’s degree preferred
4+ years of progressive cost, financial or business analysis experience
Budgeting and forecasting experience required and must demonstrate the ability to understand how operational activities impact financial results.
Proven ability to understand ERP systems required; prior experience with SAP preferred.
Advance skills in Excel, Word, and PowerPoint; ERP report writing experience would be a plus.
Understanding of manufacturing cost structure required; experience in a manufacturing environment required.
Comfortable working with a team in a fast-paced environment, and ability to prioritize/meet deadlines within specific time constraints.
Excellent verbal, written communication, and interpersonal skills.
Travel required to manufacturing location in Stanley, NC (approximately 30 minutes from the Charlotte office).

SUMMARY/OBJECTIVES

It is the role of the Commercial nCino Delivery Manager to be able to serve and provide leadership in a variety of capacities to ensure effective delivery and execution of business objectives. This includes but is not limited to the ability to lead and coordinate business analysis, testing and project management activities across multiple projects as needed. In addition, will work to develop relationships with business leaders with the objective of becoming a trusted business partner. The Commercial nCino Delivery Manager will establish and direct efforts of project teams and related resources to successfully plan, develop, test, and implement assigned projects and other initiatives to support achievement of defined business objectives. This individual will apply proven analytical and problem-solving skills to help manage through resolution systems or software application issues through careful testing in order to maximize the benefit of IT investments and initiatives.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Ability to lead all aspects of execution activities in support of the nCino Platform and Process to achieve business goals. This includes but is not limited to coordinate, monitor, provide leadership, and align testing across multiple projects and project-related activities.

Develop in-depth Commercial Banking business knowledge/skills with the objective of becoming a trusted business partner in the execution of the nCino business’ goals and objectives.

Identifies, develops, and executes strategies and supporting tactics based upon the defined strategy and priorities to engage and influence all stakeholders to make needed organizational and operational changes.

Serves as the primary contact for nCino designated projects to the business partner, building partnerships and trust through understanding of their end-to-end processes; works closely to understand strategic and business intent of projects.

Able to facilitate cross-functional / departmental collaboration to achieve consensus on objectives and solutions as needed.

Understand application development and deployment methodologies, as well as, application versioning and release processes.

Understand technical components related to multi-party integrations and define appropriate test plans and cases.

TEST MANAGEMENT & FACILITATION

Manage testing activities in a manner to ensure that the solution delivery meets business requirements and project goals, fulfill end-user requirements, and identify and resolve application issues applicable to deployed technology.

Collaborate with project team members, outside consultants, analysts, and application owners to develop test strategy and plans for the new initiatives.

Ensure any new software integration meets functional requirements, system compliance, and interface specifications.

Review and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems and develop testing strategies for improving or leveraging these systems.

Provide testing leadership and guidance for cross-departmental projects when needed.

Evaluate, plan, design, develop, and deploy testing techniques for new initiatives as required.

Manage the translation of business requirements and use cases into test conditions and ensure expected results for product, performance, user acceptance, and operational acceptance testing are well defined.

Develop and execute test scripts, cases, and scenarios that will determine optimal system performance according to specifications and defined expected results.

Determine and orchestrate all types of application testing such as system, unit, regression, load, and acceptance testing methods.

Manage delivery and collection of formal test findings/results from testing resources in order to discover and resolve defects, bugs, errors, configuration issues, and interoperability flaws.

Perform analysis on documentation and technical specifications of any new application under deployment or consideration to determine its intended functionality.

Produce and present testing status reports and documentation for all testing efforts, results, activities, data, issue logging, and tracking.

Provide proactive communication to project stakeholders related to project testing results/findings, their risks and the steps being taken to mitigate these risks.

Partner with project manager and project team members to develop effective resolutions to testing issues and conflicts.

BUSINESS DELIVERY

Contribute to in-depth end-user reviews for project requirements and related dependencies.

Cultivate and disseminate knowledge of testing best practices.

Adhere to existing processes/standards including the system development life cycle (SDLC), business technology architecture, risk and production capacity guidelines and escalate issues as required.

PROFESSIONAL

Serve as a resource for change enablement by embracing change and championing new ideas/opportunities, demonstrating knowledge expertise and training and performance support needs.

Prioritize and manage own workload to deliver quality results and meet timelines.

Support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality, innovation, and teamwork and ensure timely communication of issues/ points of interest.

Participate in knowledge transfer within the team and business units.

Establish effective relationships across multiple business, technology partners, and project members.

Effectively communicate ideas and concepts both verbally and in writing. Select and use appropriate communication method and style; keep others adequately informed.

Successful in creating confidence in the department and division value to the organization with the lines of business within the bank, team members and business stake holders.

Create a positive atmosphere of inspiration for others that aligns with South State Bank’s community and corporate values.

OTHER DUTIES

Accepts other duties as assigned.

COMPETENCIES

Ability to facilitate relations between business partners and on project teams specifically related to test planning and performance.

Ability to lead conversations with business and technical partners around test planning and coordination. Can conform to shifting priorities, demands, and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities.

Ability to leverage interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills to ensure proper performance of test planning and performance by business, technology partners, and outside consultants.

Adept at leading testing status meetings with project members and creating, distributing, and presenting (where needed) associated reporting.

Solid leadership skills.

Acts as a resource and leader for the project team and the business.

Knowledge and understanding of businesses supported.

Experience at working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.

Knowledge of bank and project, business analysis, and testing methodologies.

Knowledge of tools (e.g., MS Office, Project, Visio) within own area.

Ability to read communication styles of team members, and contractors who come from a broad spectrum of disciplines.

Adept at conducting research into project-related issues and products.

Must be able to learn, understand, and apply new technologies.

Demonstrate a commitment to working with customers, both internal and external.

Possess excellent organizational skills and is detail oriented.

Exhibit good listening, comprehension, questioning and interpersonal skills.

Demonstrate consideration, understanding, courtesy, tact, empathy & concern in the appropriate time and format.

Support the operating model; understand how own responsibilities fit within the context of other areas and the organization; think and reach outside the silo to ensure testing success

Advanced knowledge of banking/financial services

Advanced knowledge of Project management methodologies, Business Analysis practices, and Test Management practices.

Advanced knowledge of tools (e.g., MS Office, MS Project, Visio) within own area

Advanced understanding of businesses supported

Works independently as the senior or lead role and coaches/ guides members within area of expertise

Capable of managing/leading multiple cross-functional teams.

Acts as a key resource for the project team and the business

Qualifications and Education Requirements

Education : Bachelor’s Degree or 5 years’ experience required

Certifications: Preferred ITIL, PMP, CAP-M, but not required

Experience : Three (3) years related experience in application management, test/quality assurance management, change management, or environment management.

Knowledge : Demonstrated experience in testing management and relationship management.

TRAINING REQUIREMENTS/CLASSES

Complete New Employee Orientation and other training classes as determined by the Testing and Application Services Managers. Required annual compliance training.

RECOMMENDED ADDITIONAL TRAINING

New Employee Orientation, as well as continual update of processes and applications.

Supervisory Responsibility

This position does not have supervisory responsibilities.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS/WORK ENVIRONMENT

Occasional evening and weekend work to meet deadlines.

Must be able to lift to 50 pounds, must be able to stand and/or sit for long periods of time. Must be able to effectively access and interpret information on computer screens, documents, and reports.

TRAVEL

This position requires some travel.

Position Description





Service Market Logistics (SML), part of Volvo Group Trucks Operations, serves all brands and business areas by managing and optimizing service parts availability and distribution to secure customer uptime. Through our operations, we provide world class service focusing on delivery precision, quality, continuous improvement, cost efficiency and synergies delivering value all the way to our customers. We embrace innovation and new technologies and work with environmental care and sustainability at heart. Our footprint consists of 40 distribution centers and 3,800 employees worldwide, and we strive for an innovative and diverse workplace, exercising the Volvo Group values with high focus on Customer Success. We are Proud to Deliver. Making a Difference. For People. Every Day.

SML North America (NA) is a part of SML and has about 1,000 employees across the United States, Canada, and Mexico. We operate the Central Distribution Center in Byhalia, MS as well as Regional Distribution Centers across the NA region.

Mission/Purpose of the Position
The Regional Business Controller is part of the SML NA Business Control team and will report directly to the Manager of Business Control - Reporting and Analysis.

The Business control team is responsible to secure the financial reporting is done in an accurate and timely manner. Even more important, the thorough analysis of the performance is critical to support the SML NA team to take decisions to achieve the Volvo Group’s strategic objectives.

One of the most interesting reasons to join the Business Control team is that we work cross-functionally with all SML departments, with all the different Business Areas and supporting four different Brands - Volvo Trucks, Mack Trucks, Volvo Construction Equipment and Volvo Penta.
With us, you can continuously develop yourself, improve your own professional skills and drive change together with committed people!

Scope & Influence
The Business Controller is responsible of collecting data, analyze and consolidate information to support decision making.

This role works closely with the whole business control team to understand current performance and proactively identify how to further improve performance.

In addition to a continuous improvement mindset, all controllers may understand the End-to-End impact of different actions and decisions to secure satisfaction of our customers.

Essential Functions
Prepare, analyze, and explain financial reports including year-over-year and quarterly comparisons.
Challenge and support in terms of efficiency and performance in line with the overall strategy and objectives.
Consolidate the financial estimate process with analysis of underlying cost drivers and validation of assumptions.
Monitor performance indicators, highlighting trends and analyze causes of deviations.
Collaborate closely with other business controllers to identify opportunities to increase performance.
Perform proactive controlling and drive cost awareness to achieve short- and long-term financial targets.
Support in the preparation of financial presentations for different stakeholders.
Participate in financial review meetings with different stakeholders as needed.
Support with our financial master data structure including GL accounts, Cost Centers, and Profit Centers.
Actively contribute to developing routines, processes, and ways of working on global and regional levels
Other duties as needed by the organization.
Minimum Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in finance, Business Administration, Economics, or related field.
Although Professional accounting designation is not required, a CPA, CMA or MBA or advanced education is a plus.
Minimum of 5 years of financial planning and/or business analysis experience
Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced team environment striving towards operational excellence.
Demonstrated ability to achieve goals with minimum supervision and ability to drive initiatives to completion.
Necessary Skills
Proficiency in the English language is required.
Teamwork and cooperation are critical factors to the success of the team and motivation of the individuals.
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills. Ability to analyze data in detail and tell succinct stories. Capable to communicate effectively with line and senior management as well as finance and non-finance audience.
Strong analytical skills.
Advanced Excel skills required, PowerPivot / PowerBI highly desirable.
Experience in SAP and Business Objects required.
ESSBASE, VGCS preferred.
Ability to be coachable
Creative thinking and innovative problem solving.
Unafraid of failure, willingness to learn and continually improve.
Comfortable with a fast-paced environment as priorities are subject to change.
Necessary functional/language skills
As all documentation is in English, proficiency in the English language is required

Market Logistics offers the opportunity to learn about, and impact, all our North American brands. In addition, we offer:
Health, vision, and dental insurance
Competitive compensation
Generous ETO (earned time off)
401k with matching

The Volvo Group drives prosperity through transport solutions, offering trucks, buses, construction equipment, power solutions for marine and industrial applications, financing and services that increase our customers’ uptime and productivity. Founded in 1927, the Volvo Group is committed to shaping the future landscape of sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions. Countless career opportunities are offered across the group’s leading brands and entities that share a culture of Trust, Passion, High Performance, Change and Customer Success.
www.volvogroup.com/career.

A new era is here. Technologies such as big data, automation and artificial intelligence are changing the way we look at manufacturing and logistics. Volvo Group Trucks Operations encompasses all production of the Group’s engines and transmissions as well as the production of Volvo, Renault and Mack trucks. The organization is also responsible for spare parts supplies to the Group’s customers and for designing, operating and optimizing logistics and supply chains for all brands. Together, Volvo Group Trucks Operations represents 30,000 employees at 30 plants and 50 distribution centers across the globe. About our Team

About the Role

You will be supporting the Segment General Managers to develop and execute key tactical Go-To-Market opportunities. You will manage projects, execute product launches, and Go-To-Market program opportunities that will continue to accelerate the growth trajectory. Furthermore, you will also own Go-To-Market planning and execution of those plans in each of our geographical markets.

Responsibilities

Supporting Go-To-Market strategy in multiple markets and segments by planning and executing product launches and growth initiatives.
Achieving project goals by managing global teams, collaborating, and influencing in complex situations.
Developing project plans to execute key business initiatives, e.g. to deliver on approved business cases (including new solutions, monetizable product modules, content exclusives, product partnerships, or analytics projects).
Leading the successful execution of project plans to deliver on approved financial outcomes and report on progress.
Collaborating across GM, Product, Marketing, Sales, and Operations functions to ensure effective Go-To-Market execution around product initiatives.
Ensuring tactical opportunities are identified, prioritized, and actioned and our Go-To-Market execution is optimized to drive growth.
Tracking and monitoring Go-To-Market success metrics and evaluating performance against strategic business goals.
Supporting the Go-To-Market execution by conducting analysis, data modeling, and Go-To-Market requirements gathering.

Requirements

Have Go-To-Market experience in Project Management, Business Analysis, Sales, Marketing, or Product Operations.
Demonstrate a successful background in collaborating, motivating, influencing, and coordinating other stakeholders to deliver results. In particular within complex matrix environments.
Have the ability to generate Go-To-Market planning, implementation, and product launch plans a priority for deliverables.
Be able to master the art of impactful presentations by effectively communicating complex ideas and recommendations.
Be implementation-oriented with recommendations grounded in reality, willing to roll up sleeves and ‘get hands dirty’ as required.
Possess expertise in utilizing CRM (Salesforce) and marketing automation tools. Agile/Six Sigma experience is recommended.

Our US Delivery Centers have been growing since 2014 with significant, continued growth on the horizon. Interested? Read more about our opportunity below:

The Team
The HR Transformation team is a core component of our Human Capital practice; the work we do supports the five major issues our clients are facing. We collaborate with our clients to develop leading global HR strategies and support organizations in achieving excellence through implementing solutions that transform how they organize, develop capabilities, deploy leading technology, and deliver a leading employee experience.
Keeping the employee in mind, all our services cater to improving an organization's productivity through their human capital asset. The client issues we work with range from the need for a comprehensive HR strategy, to determining the need for new and enabling technologies, to streamlining HR operations and transforming the way HR is delivered.

How you'll grow

At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there's always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

Work you'll do/Responsibilities
As a ServiceNow Business Analyst for our HR Transformation team, you will utilize your knowledge and experience of ServiceNow to support Deloitte's Human Capital Consulting ServiceNow team. In this role you will be responsible for:

INTEGRATIONS ANALYST

Preferred Location: Charlotte, NC

Reports to: Director of IT Operations

ABOUT EDRAY

EDRAY thrives in the most difficult part of the supply chain - the final mile at the ports. Through proprietary technology, processes and most importantly - innovation, we work on your behalf with all stakeholders to keep your freight moving in the most efficient way possible.

SUMMARY

The Integrations Analyst is a critical role in ensuring that we efficiently and effectively manage system-to-system and manual-to-system data integrations within our core platforms.

In this role you will serve as an analyst and SME for integrations with key customers/vendors and external platforms with a focus on the implementation and ongoing support of three key areas: EDI/FTP integrations, web services/API integrations, and automation of current manual inbound data submissions. Your key responsibilities will include:

Develop integration technical requirements including strategy, tactical approach, and documentation
Manage third-party integration relationships
Manage and maintain integration mappings and processes, including testing and troubleshooting
Collaborate with data quality and operations teams to reduce and/or mitigate integration data errors
Work with IT and Business Intelligence team members to establish effective process monitoring and reporting in order to meet and maintain integration and data quality SLAs
Must be comfortable in an external-facing role, representing EDRAY in customer onboarding and/or third-party integration project discussions

REQUIRED SKILLS/EXPERIENCE

Working knowledge of the following file types: EDI X12, JSON, XML
2+ years technical EDI development (onboarding, mapping, testing in a direct-connected environment) OR
2+ years business analysis experience in API web service integration, development, and strategy utilizing REST and SOAP.

HELPFUL ADDITIONAL SKILLS/EXPERIENCE

Ability to function as project manager for integration development projects
Experience in trucking, ocean carrier/port operations, distribution, or other logistics/transportation industry
Ability to develop and/or support .NET applications supporting EDI, API, FTP processes
SQL development and/or PowerBI and DAX to support Operations teams reporting requirements
Experience with Dell Boomi

Job Title: Advisory Lead Business Analyst 1 - PDM Senior Consultant
Job Description:
Risk and Financial Advisory - Hybrid Operate

Lead Business Analyst - PDM Senior Consultant

Do you have a drive to be a part of the technology evolution , and a passion for turning challenges and opportunities into long-term competitive advantages? If so, please consider an opportunity with Deloitte under our Project Delivery Talent Model. The Project Delivery Model (PDM) is a talent model tailored to long-term, client service delivery. PDM practitioners are local to project locations, minimizing the need for extensive travel . As a Lead Business Analyst in our Hybrid-Operate business, you'll have the opportunity to gain valuable hands-on experience, share ideas, and collaborate with leading professionals as we engage a diverse set of industries with effective solutions

Work you'll do

As a Lead Business Analyst, you will work on client teams , supporting technology products - including onboarding new client implementations, performing data analytics, and expanding existing business features and functionality to meet client needs. You will be working with other analysts and developers to identify and address technical and non-technical issues. Additional responsibilities m ay include:

Documenting highly complex business processes, data flow and architecture for new systems and data
Creating business cases to provide cost effective solutions.
Following complex data flow to interpret source of information in support of new systems and data.
Recommend ing change s based on business system impact analysis.
Serving as functional lead in technical implementation of agreed upon solutions.
Translating business requirements into test cases
Facilitating User Acceptance Testing of system enhancements and new applications, including initial root cause analysis of failures
Preparing and presenting complex written and verbal materials such as reports, findings, and systems training
Building reports using Crystal Reports and SSRS and, ad-hoc queries and dashboards leveraging market leading business intelligence tools
Serving as an escalation point, and guiding less tenured business analysts to troubleshoot and resolve issues
Participat ing in Agile development process and contribut e to sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives
Help develop requirements for, and assist in testing of, software enhancements including providing market and user insights

The desired candidate is a team player who is passionate about learning and working with technology, finance, and alternative investments. The candidate will be detail oriented, possess strong listening, verbal/written communication skills, and able to collaborate well with others.

The Team

We are a growing global team of Analysts and Technology professionals. You will be working directly with team members at all levels, with the focus on enhancement or customization to meet the needs of our clients. Our teams understand the dynamics of serving complex, global clients across multiple industries, and the importance of increasing transparency around business performance. Learn more about our Deloitte Risk & Financial Advisory practice at Deloitte.

Technical Knowledge and Experience :

Required

Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent experience
5-7 years of relevant experience
Minimum of four years of work experience in IT and data driven projects as a Business Analyst/ Product Manager
Experience working in Agile projects with good understanding of Agile ways of working
Ability to influence peers and leadership stakeholders
Relevant certifications in Agile, Scrum or project management
Strong experience in IT consulting and business analysis - process definition, requirements gathering, Proficiency in writing Business Requirements Documents ( BRD ) , and Functional Specification Documents ( FSD )
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future. and user stories

Job Title: Sr Services Business Analyst - Life Sciences -Remote
Job Description:
Welcome to Veradigm! Our Mission is to be the most trusted provider of innovative solutions that empower all stakeholders across the healthcare continuum to deliver world-class outcomes. Our Vision is a Connected Community of Health that spans continents and borders. With the largest community of clients in healthcare, Veradigm is able to deliver an integrated platform of clinical, financial, connectivity and information solutions to facilitate enhanced collaboration and exchange of critical patient information.

Veradigm Life Science

The Veradigm Network is well-positioned to address the unique needs of Life Sciences customers. By leveraging the Veradigm Network, research data and associated insights become both an output of care delivery, as well as additional knowledge to improve quality of care, a true virtuous cycle.

Our portfolio of solutions provides insights using real-world data directly sourced from the Veradigm Network. These solutions can help Life Sciences customers discover timely, actionable real-world evidence to improve patient experience and outcomes, and demonstrate how their products can benefit appropriate patient populations.

Support our Client Success team as they help our Life Sciences clients leverage RWD in the research and commercial ecosystem.

The Senior Services Business Analyst role anticipates and enables the creation of data elements that directly supports the financial, operations and business success of the Client Success Organization.

Are you the right fit?

Are you passionate about how real-world data can help address the unique needs of our life sciences customers? Do you have a life sciences background with strong project management skills? Do you enjoy using your analytical skills to solve problems?

What you will contribute:

Understands the trade and workflow of Life Sciences companies
Facilitates clear communication inter and intra-departmentally to promote collaboration
Assists senior project managers to maintain project documentation
Adapts learning to independently prepare common deliverables needed for business effectiveness
Connects business data elements and articulate impact to variations found in metrics
Demonstrates a complete knowledge base of insight to the Life Sciences Business Unit by anticipating potential business issues before realized
Influences needed decisions to allow for near and long-term resolution to challenges and opportunities presented in the business
Seeks out creative means to thoughtfully support the Client Success Organization in operational and business best practices, ensuring compliance and success
Measures and articulates business benefit(s) and outcome(s)
Initiates tool enhancement design suggestions and scope and sees development through completion and production
Leads the ongoing need to continuous process improvement of the organization and function
Anticipates business trends based on industry knowledge and market climate for preparedness and organizational awareness
Creates creative means to describe and represent compelling business issues to leadership leveraging data accurately with insight and context
Demonstrates flexibility and open to evolving roles and responsibilities as need to support Sales, Client Success, and the Business Unit.

The ideal candidate will have:

Bachelor's Degree or equivalent Technical / Business experience (Required)
4-7 years relevant work experience (Preferred)
Life Sciences background (Required)
Project Management experience (Required)
Understanding of data elements within life sciences and how they move through the ecosystem (Required)
External certification in Project Management (Preferred)
Up to 10% travel may be required

Compliance

Job responsibilities include fostering the Company's compliance with all applicable laws and regulations, adherence to the Code of Conduct and Compliance Program requirements, policies and procedures. Compliance is everyone's responsibility.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Excellent written and verbal communication skills
PC skills including spreadsheet, all Microsoft Office Suite applications and database applications
Experience with Salesforce and JIRA (Preferred)
Power BI


Enhancing Lives and Building Careers

Veradigm believes in empowering our associates with the tools and flexibility to bring the best version of themselves to work and to further their professional development. Together, we are In the Network. Interested in learning more?

Take a look at our Culture, Benefits, Early Talent Program, and Additional Openings.

Job Title: Salesforce Technical Business Analyst with Marketing Cloud
Job Description:
For one of our ongoing project we are looking for a Salesforce Technical Business Analyst in Marketing cloud.
Job Title: Salesforce Marketing Cloud (Technical BA) (REMOTE during COVID-19)
Job Description


10 years of experience as Tech BA with experience in Salesforce and Salesforce Marketing Cloud
Should have good understanding of working with system integration programs specifically involving Salesforce
Expertise on SQL and should be able to analyze data flows
Ability to draft technical user stories from the business requirement
Excellent written and verbal communication
Experience working with multiple squads in Agile mode

The Basics:

In this role, you will provide support for the worldwide sales teams and lead continuous improvement initiatives of both sales compensation processes and systems. You will focus on assisting in maintaining the end-to-end commission process and provide real time information to various stakeholders within the organization in a timely and accurate manner. As a key member of the team, you will also act as a trusted advisor and processor on a wide variety of tasks including commissions calculations, reporting, accruals, and Xactly and Salesforce (SFDC) hygiene. This role requires a well-rounded individual who has demonstrated the ability to deliver results in a high-growth, dynamic and collaborative environment.

What you'll do:

Administer and manage all aspects of the day-to-day operations of Xactly ultimately leading to accurate and timely compensation payments
Partner with the Talent, HR, Sales Operations and Finance and Accounting teams to understand new hire offers and non-standard terms as it relates to sales compensation
Assist in the rollout of sales compensations plans and new sales compensation processes including system suggestions/configurations for new plans
Research and respond to sales team and sales leaders for commission and incentive related issues, questions, or concerns
Participate in design and user acceptance testing, and providing feedback and/or best practices for incentive systems integrations and enhancements to current automation
Work with Sales team to ensure quota and commissions adjustments are applied correctly and timely
Monitor new hire and termination data and update internal systems accordingly
Perform SFDC opportunity review for accuracy in the deal closeout process
Learn, maintain and provide input on changes to multiple systems that could potentially impact Tanium's ability to process commissions
Understand current policies and applying the policies to the most complex/creative deal structures as well as being able to propose improvements and enhancements
Ability to use critical thinking to analyze problems and proactively offer solutions
Take on any ad hoc projects and process improvement initiatives

We're looking for someone with:

Education

Bachelor's degree required with an emphasis in Business, Finance or Accounting or equivalent preferred.

Experience:

1-3 years of hands-on sales commission processing, preferably for an on-premise Software, SaaS or IT related company.
Strong knowledge of Salesforce.com required
Experience working with the Xactly's Incent application required
Advanced Excel knowledge required

Other:

Ability to take initiative, work flexibly, and set priorities with minimal direct supervision.
Strong analytical skills, disciplined attention to detail, highly organized and thorough.
Experience working in high-growth, performance focused environments and administering complex programs

About Tanium

Tanium, the industry's only provider of converged endpoint management (XEM), leads the paradigm shift in legacy approaches to managing complex security and technology environments. Only Tanium protects every team, endpoint, and workflow from cyber threats by integrating IT, Operations, Security, and Risk into a single platform that delivers comprehensive visibility across devices, a unified set of controls, and a common taxonomy for a single shared purpose: to protect critical information and infrastructure at scale. Tanium has been named to the Forbes Cloud 100 list for six consecutive years and ranks on Fortune's list of the Best Large Workplaces in Technology. In fact, more than half of the Fortune 100 and the U.S. armed forces trust Tanium to protect people; defend data; secure systems; and see and control every endpoint, team, and workflow everywhere. That's the power of certainty. Visit www.tanium.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.

On a mission. Together.

At Tanium, we are stewards of a culture that emphasizes the importance of collaboration, respect, and diversity. In our pursuit of revolutionizing the way some of the largest enterprises and governments in the world solve their most difficult IT challenges, we are strengthened by our unique perspectives and by our collective actions.

We are an organization with stakeholders around the world and it's imperative that the diversity of our customers and communities is reflected internally in our team members. We strive to create a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone feels they have opportunities to succeed and grow because we know that only together can we do great things.

Each of our team members has 5 days set aside as volunteer time off (VTO) to contribute to the communities they live in and give back to the causes they care about most.

What you'll get

The annual base salary range for this full-time position is $45,000 to $135,000. This range is an estimate for what Tanium will pay a new hire. The actual annual base salary offered may be adjusted based on a variety of factors, including but not limited to, location, education, skills, training, and experience.

In addition to an annual base salary, team members will receive equity awards and a generous benefits package consisting of medical, dental and vision plan, family planning benefits, health savings account, flexible spending account, transportation savings account, 401(k) retirement savings plan with company match, life, accident and disability coverage, business travel accident insurance, employee assistance programs, disability insurance, and other well-being benefits.




For more information on how Tanium processes your personal data, please see our Privacy Policy
