Lead teams in the design, development, integration and support of software products and systems.
Lead teams to be more T-shaped.
Identify and resolve project issues and risks, including tracking, escalation, and mitigation.
Perform ongoing support role regarding application and system operations and results - includes the following: direct support, problem investigation and/or liaison to other departments to ensure timely problem resolution.
Supervise performance and professional development for technical members of the team to include regular 1:1 meeting, hiring of new resources and delivering regular evaluations.
Follows Railinc’s Agile approach to software development as appropriate.
Partners with product managers, business analysts, and other stakeholders to ensure success of the product/functionality being developed.

Project Communication (20%):

Report project progress to senior management and stakeholders, identifying issues and resolutions.
Manage stakeholder expectations and deliver to them.

Key Measures:

Project metrics.

Knowledge, Skills, abilities/minimum requirements/competencies:

Capability to understand customer application use from the customer’s perspective business needs.
Strong interpersonal, communication, organization, and planning skills.
Capable of managing multiple projects in a fast-paced cross-functional development environment.
Demonstrated strength in project management methodology and practice.
Strong project leadership and management skills required, including previous experience leading successful technical teams and projects.
Knowledge in AWS or other cloud technologies preferred.
Knowledge of multi-tier architecture technology and its use, specifically Java, High Availability, and Disaster Recovery highly desired.
Broad understanding and experience of full development life cycle.
Knowledge of business analysis tools and techniques required.
Must possess initiative with strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, and Project.
Previous experience working with offshore technical teams desired.
Deadline driven projects with possibility of heavy workloads at times.

Education, experience, certification/training:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent field desired.
Minimum of seven (7) years software development experience.
2 years of previous software development management/team lead experience required.
Experience with Agile, SCRUM preferred.
PMP Certification preferred (must earn in first 12 months of employment).
Agile certification (PMI or Scrum Alliance) preferred.

Values:

Results: We deliver on our promises to create value for the freight rail industry through talented people, good ideas, business leadership and great technology.
Collaboration: We collaborate with our teams and our customers to get the job done, respecting individual ideas and contributions and moving forward in pursuit of shared goals.
Service: We serve the changing needs of our customers and our industry to enhance the value they bring to our community, the environment and our economy.

Physical Requirements:

Sedentary work: Assignment involves sitting at workstation (desk) most of the time (up to 8 hours) with only occasional walking and/or standing.
Keyboarding: Primarily using fingers for typing.
Talking: Expressing or communicating verbally through use of spoken words (accurately conveying detailed or important spoken instructions to others).
Hearing: Ability to receive detailed information through oral communication and to make discriminations in sound.
Visual: Through close visual acuity, required to perform activities such as: preparing and analyzing data and figures; transcribing; viewing computer terminal; extensive reading (with or without correction).
Environment: Work is performed within an office setting and therefore there is no substantial exposure to adverse environmental conditions (i.e., extreme heat, cold, noise, etc.).

SUMMARY/OBJECTIVES

It is the role of the Commercial nCino Delivery Manager to be able to serve and provide leadership in a variety of capacities to ensure effective delivery and execution of business objectives. This includes but is not limited to the ability to lead and coordinate business analysis, testing and project management activities across multiple projects as needed. In addition, will work to develop relationships with business leaders with the objective of becoming a trusted business partner. The Commercial nCino Delivery Manager will establish and direct efforts of project teams and related resources to successfully plan, develop, test, and implement assigned projects and other initiatives to support achievement of defined business objectives. This individual will apply proven analytical and problem-solving skills to help manage through resolution systems or software application issues through careful testing in order to maximize the benefit of IT investments and initiatives.




ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Ability to lead all aspects of execution activities in support of the nCino Platform and Process to achieve business goals. This includes but is not limited to coordinate, monitor, provide leadership, and align testing across multiple projects and project-related activities.
Develop in-depth Commercial Banking business knowledge/skills with the objective of becoming a trusted business partner in the execution of the nCino business’ goals and objectives.
Identifies, develops, and executes strategies and supporting tactics based upon the defined strategy and priorities to engage and influence all stakeholders to make needed organizational and operational changes.
Serves as the primary contact for nCino designated projects to the business partner, building partnerships and trust through understanding of their end-to-end processes; works closely to understand strategic and business intent of projects.
Able to facilitate cross-functional / departmental collaboration to achieve consensus on objectives and solutions as needed.
Understand application development and deployment methodologies, as well as, application versioning and release processes.
Understand technical components related to multi-party integrations and define appropriate test plans and cases.

TEST MANAGEMENT & FACILITATION

Manage testing activities in a manner to ensure that the solution delivery meets business requirements and project goals, fulfill end-user requirements, and identify and resolve application issues applicable to deployed technology.
Collaborate with project team members, outside consultants, analysts, and application owners to develop test strategy and plans for the new initiatives.
Ensure any new software integration meets functional requirements, system compliance, and interface specifications.
Review and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems and develop testing strategies for improving or leveraging these systems.
Provide testing leadership and guidance for cross-departmental projects when needed.
Evaluate, plan, design, develop, and deploy testing techniques for new initiatives as required.
Manage the translation of business requirements and use cases into test conditions and ensure expected results for product, performance, user acceptance, and operational acceptance testing are well defined.
Develop and execute test scripts, cases, and scenarios that will determine optimal system performance according to specifications and defined expected results.
Determine and orchestrate all types of application testing such as system, unit, regression, load, and acceptance testing methods.
Manage delivery and collection of formal test findings/results from testing resources in order to discover and resolve defects, bugs, errors, configuration issues, and interoperability flaws.
Perform analysis on documentation and technical specifications of any new application under deployment or consideration to determine its intended functionality.
Produce and present testing status reports and documentation for all testing efforts, results, activities, data, issue logging, and tracking.
Provide proactive communication to project stakeholders related to project testing results/findings, their risks and the steps being taken to mitigate these risks.
Partner with project manager and project team members to develop effective resolutions to testing issues and conflicts.

BUSINESS DELIVERY

Contribute to in-depth end-user reviews for project requirements and related dependencies.
Cultivate and disseminate knowledge of testing best practices.
Adhere to existing processes/standards including the system development life cycle (SDLC), business technology architecture, risk and production capacity guidelines and escalate issues as required.

PROFESSIONAL

Serve as a resource for change enablement by embracing change and championing new ideas/opportunities, demonstrating knowledge expertise and training and performance support needs.
Prioritize and manage own workload to deliver quality results and meet timelines.
Support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality, innovation, and teamwork and ensure timely communication of issues/ points of interest.
Participate in knowledge transfer within the team and business units.
Establish effective relationships across multiple business, technology partners, and project members.
Effectively communicate ideas and concepts both verbally and in writing. Select and use appropriate communication method and style; keep others adequately informed.
Successful in creating confidence in the department and division value to the organization with the lines of business within the bank, team members and business stake holders.
Create a positive atmosphere of inspiration for others that aligns with South State Bank’s community and corporate values.



OTHER DUTIES

Accepts other duties as assigned.



COMPETENCIES

Ability to facilitate relations between business partners and on project teams specifically related to test planning and performance.
Ability to lead conversations with business and technical partners around test planning and coordination. Can conform to shifting priorities, demands, and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
Ability to leverage interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills to ensure proper performance of test planning and performance by business, technology partners, and outside consultants.
Adept at leading testing status meetings with project members and creating, distributing, and presenting (where needed) associated reporting.
Solid leadership skills.
Acts as a resource and leader for the project team and the business.
Knowledge and understanding of businesses supported.
Experience at working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Knowledge of bank and project, business analysis, and testing methodologies.
Knowledge of tools (e.g., MS Office, Project, Visio) within own area.
Ability to read communication styles of team members, and contractors who come from a broad spectrum of disciplines.
Adept at conducting research into project-related issues and products.
Must be able to learn, understand, and apply new technologies.
Demonstrate a commitment to working with customers, both internal and external.
Possess excellent organizational skills and is detail oriented.
Exhibit good listening, comprehension, questioning and interpersonal skills.
Demonstrate consideration, understanding, courtesy, tact, empathy & concern in the appropriate time and format.
Support the operating model; understand how own responsibilities fit within the context of other areas and the organization; think and reach outside the silo to ensure testing success
Advanced knowledge of banking/financial services
Advanced knowledge of Project management methodologies, Business Analysis practices, and Test Management practices.
Advanced knowledge of tools (e.g., MS Office, MS Project, Visio) within own area
Advanced understanding of businesses supported
Works independently as the senior or lead role and coaches/ guides members within area of expertise
Capable of managing/leading multiple cross-functional teams.
Acts as a key resource for the project team and the business

Certifications: Preferred ITIL, PMP, CAP-M, but not required

Job Title: Analyst – Mobility, Parking, Operations, and Technology Planner
Job Description:
Analyst – Mobility, Parking, Operations, and Technology Planner
Work Location: Charlotte, NC
Employment Type: Full-time regular
Are you looking for a challenging and rewarding environment where you will work alongside the industry’s best and most talented, with the opportunity to have a front row seat in planning analyses and decisions for the public and private sector? If so, you have found the perfect opportunity! Walker Consultants is seeking a seasoned individual to assist our planning, operations, and technology practice as we serve our clients throughout our southeast US market share. Our services apply decades of best practices that enhance the users’ experiences and advance the owners’ goals.
Our primary objectives always focus on achieving the following:
Make it easier for people to reach their destinations
Support and encourage transportation mode of choice
Optimize parking and transportation customer service and bottom lines
Improve quality of lives through economic growth and built environments that work for people
Perform due diligence services helping gauge market risk and upside potential
Responsibilities
At this continuing developmental level, this role performs:
Conduct extensive research and analyze data in specific or general parking, mobility, and transit areas using a variety of methods.
Define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
Write and present formal and technical reports, working papers, and correspondence.
Identify common problems, issues, and opportunities based on observation, research, and data analysis.
Develop strategies, actions, and projects to address identified issues consistent with community goals, best practices/standards, and applicable regulations.
Develop recommendations and implementation strategies.
Prepare information (i.e. project fact sheets, display boards, slides, online platforms, etc.) to explain projects to and gather input from stakeholders and the public.
Work with and communicate effectively with a broad range of team members, clients, review agencies, and others as appropriate for a range of project types.
Participate in a range of challenging parking, mobility, and transit projects including strategic urban plans, corridor and curb management studies, feasibility studies, and alternative analyses.
Support development of planning, operations, and technology documents with a primary focus on research, data collection, field assessment, data analysis, mapping, writing, and editing reports.
Prepare information to explain projects clearly and succinctly to stakeholders and public, as well as gather feedback and input from community members and stakeholders.
Assist with coordinating projects among team members, clients, and external consultants.
Communicate and interact with team members, clients, and review agencies.
10% travel required - overnight and air travel to client sites.
Qualifications
Two years demonstrated proficiency as an entry-level analyst or planner, or
Master’s degree in business, marketing, planning, architecture, engineering, or other degree appropriate to the area of concentration (mobility and parking planning, parking operations, parking technology, etc.), or
Five years transferable experience in parking, mobility and transportation industry, and
Appropriate verbal, writing, analytical and/or software skills for the specialty area.

Benefits of Joining Walker
As a skilled member of the Walker family, you will be given the opportunity to grow and develop your skills surrounded by committed, talented and enthusiastic co-workers. In addition to competitive compensation, as a full-time employee, Walker offers vacation retreats, tuition and professional certification reimbursement, professional organization membership reimbursement, 401(k) match and HSA employer contribution, commuter benefit accounts, medical, dental, vision insurance, flexible work schedules, and more!
Who We Are
Walker is a 100% employee-owned company of many capabilities offering professional services to clients in the private and public market sectors. Walker maintains a strong foundation as an industry leader in all aspects of parking planning, design, engineering, restoration, and consulting that encompass operations, technology, and mobility solutions engaging a wide spectrum of specialists and renowned experts who have been advancing standards in the industry for several decades.
Walker works collaboratively as a national team to provide sustainable planning and transportation solutions. From small towns to large urban metros and transit agencies, we help our clients build communities that are places people want to live, work, and have fun. For every project, we develop creative strategies that both put people first and are rooted in data and in line with overall goals for transportation, economic development, climate, and land use. We are focused on the future, and our plans and policies are shaped by technology, data, and infrastructure that optimize current and future investments.
You’ll join a dedicated team working with a variety of clients (cities, transit agencies, metropolitan planning organizations, hospitals, airports, universities, developers, and others) on cutting edge projects to plan for the future of transit, manage curb space, and provide more sustainable mobility options for people. This includes planning transit around a system of solar microgrids to power electric bus fleets and local resiliency/mobility hubs.
You’ll have an opportunity to directly test ideas, shape policy, and see your plans implemented. At Walker we go beyond planning, we guide implementation.
Walker Consultants is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). We invite all qualified applicants to apply and do not discriminate against individuals because of their race, color, religion, national origin, gender, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or age.

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills

Experience tracking and reporting project or program delivery progress and budget execution
Experience developing project briefs and reports for non-technical audiences
Knowledge of the federal acquisition lifecycle
Familiarity with Business Intelligence and Data Analytics
Project Management, Agile, and/or Cyber Certifications (PMP / ACP / CSM / SAFe / CISM)

Our Commitment:
Contact Government Services (CGS) strives to simplify and enhance government bureaucracy through the optimization of human, technical, and financial resources. We combine cutting-edge technology with world-class personnel to deliver customized solutions that fit our client’s specific needs. We are committed to solving the most challenging and dynamic problems.

For the past seven years, we’ve been growing our government contracting portfolio, and along the way, we’ve created valuable partnerships by demonstrating a commitment to honesty, professionalism, and quality work.

Here at CGS we value honesty through hard work and self-awareness, professionalism in all we do, and to deliver the best quality to our consumers mending those relations for years to come.

At KPMG, you can become an integral part of a dynamic team at one of the world's top tax firms. Enjoy a collaborative, future-forward culture that empowers your success. Work with KPMG's extensive network of specialists & enjoy access to our Ignition Centers, where deep industry knowledge merges with cutting-edge technologies to create innovative tax solutions. Join a diverse team helping high-profile clients understand, analyze, and respond to complex business opportunities and challenges. Develop your career through a range of multifaceted engagements, formal training, and informal mentoring. At KPMG, we believe nothing is more important than investing in our culture because it's an investment in our people, our future, and what we stand for as a firm

KPMG is currently seeking a Senior Associate to join our Business Tax Services practice.

Responsibilities:

Prioritize work to meet milestones and complete deliverables in a timely manner while adhering to the business requirements throughout the project lifecycle
Prepare documentation, presentations, charts, tables, and diagrams and conduct reviews for scope, business justification and business requirements including use cases, design documents, prototypes, and business rules

Document and track the status of client inquiries, enhancement requests, change requests and defects
Prepare detailed specifications for developers and apply technical experience in evaluating software modifications that will enhance operating and development activities
May oversee work product, manage deadlines, expectations and often contributing to staffing decisions and supervising the work performed by more junior staff

Skilled in organizing information based on reviewing meeting notes, specifications, interviewing clients, architects, and developers

About this role:

Carrier is a world leading technology company in the field of heating, air-conditioning and refrigeration solutions. We are hiring a talented Digital Technology Product Owner to join the Commercial HVAC division of Carrier’s North America DT team. The successful candidate will be responsible for partnering with the business and extended DT team in defining and executing solutions across the North America’s back-office and operations digital ecosystem.

Leads large team of experienced Digital Product Management professionals or team leaders. Defines a cost allocation, cost recovery and pricing plan within the overall context of the digital chargeback or pricing model

Key Responsibilities:

Review, evaluate, propose DT solutions to simplify and standardize back-office ERP operation processes, enhance customer & employee experiences, drive revenue growth, margin expansion, digital innovation and mitigate compliance and cybersecurity risks
Assist in design and oversee business end to end processes (Inquiry to Order, Order to Cash, Procure to Pay, Plan to Produce) across several applications encompassing engineering specific systems, SFDC, Service systems, ERPs, and analytics platforms
Work closely with DT professionals and Center of Excellence teams within the company to ensure alignment on solution, standards, resources, budget for project execution as well as achieving operational excellence.
Assess data quality improvement opportunities; organize, prioritize, and lead initiatives to mistake proof and remediate ERP data issues
Partner with COE teams for ERP project executions, provide input on regional solution/process gaps
Manage suppliers in terms of service level fulfillment, development, deployment and operation support; consolidate support metrics into a single view for tracking and monitoring supplier performance.
Direct the identification and recommendation of appropriate solutions, upgrades, replacements, or decommissioning options incorporating business and technology productivity, usability, and total cost of ownership
Manage activities that take place during solution ideation, solution design, solution implementation and maintain the full life cycle of the EPR applications (digital products)
Support the business by resolving escalated technology related operational issues associated with ERP and surrounding systems

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree
8+ years of experience with IT Management which involved project planning, resource allocation, change management, and operations
5+ years of experience with SAP-ERP implementation or solution management

Preferred Qualifications:

Master’s degree or higher
Proven track record in successfully implementing ERP, FSM systems in the manufacturing industry offering complex configurable products. Demonstrated experience and knowledge in major ERP (SAP) and its core modules, FICO, CS, PP, MM, WMS, PS, QM. Proven experience in management of outsourced vendors during project implementation, system integration and support
Excellent interpersonal, analytical as well as problem-solving skills
Excellent organizational and leadership skills. Outstanding oral and written communication skills, strong presentation skills, and the ability to effectively interact with people at all levels
Ability to lead and motivate cross-functional, interdisciplinary teams to achieve strategic goals. Advanced understanding of business analysis techniques and processes
Proactive, self-motivated and a team player
Strong understanding of project management principles and project management skills such as agile methodology
Ability to handle several projects at a given time

Job Title: Sr. Business Accountability Specialist- Analytics, Reporting & Presentation
Job Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Senior Business Accountability Specialist to join the HR Business Risk Management Team. The position will be responsible for standards and controls in the business, ensuring effective design, assessment, monitoring, and execution through establishment of protocols, assessment, risk mitigation, oversight, reporting, and self-assurance activities.

In this role, you will:
Be a key member of a growing and evolving team supporting Human Resources Risk Management.
Manage projects and drive initiatives through implementation.
Develop and organize standard documentation.
Coordinate and organize cross-team initiatives
Analyze reporting and data, including trending and themes
Develop executive presentations to tell the story of the data, forming clear calls-to-action
Lead or participate in moderately complex initiatives and deliverables within business and contribute to large-scale, cross-functional planning related to mitigation of current and emerging business risk issues and concerns
Assess, analyze, and design moderately complex controls, protocols, and approaches with respect to risk mitigation and the control environment, including ensuring effective planning for sustainability, ongoing control adherence, reporting, measurement, technology impacts, and monitoring
Independently make decisions and resolve moderately complex issues while leveraging solid understanding of the business's functional area or products, operations, and regulatory environment; facilitate decision-making and issue resolution, and support implementation of developed solutions and plans; lead peers and key business partners to meet deliverables and drive new initiatives
Collaborate and consult with peers, colleagues, and mid-level managers to address current and emerging risks associated with business activities and operations, and provide guidance or support in interpreting, developing, and implementing risk-mitigating strategies
Partner with peers and the business in interactions with external parties to support appropriateness and timeliness of response, and effectiveness of communications and materials
May serve as a mentor for lower-level staff
Required Qualifications:
4+ years of risk management, business controls, quality assurance, business operations, compliance, or process experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education
Desired Qualifications:
Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy
Project management experience
Experience identifying risk exposure and propose solutions as well as key issues, involve affected parties, design solutions, obtain buy-in and communicate effectively through resolution
Experience presenting information in a manner that persuades, educates, and enhances understanding at all levels
Ability to create and manage capacity planning and gearing ratio tools
Experience with Power Bi and Tableau creating dashboards
Enhanced Microsoft Excel skills, including pivot tables, macros, charts, and VLOOKUPs.
Advanced PowerPoint design skills, including development of Executive decks, with the ability to tell complex stories succinctly and visually.
Job Expectations:
This position will require onsite presence at one of the locations listed below in a hybrid work schedule
Ability to travel up to 10%
Relocation assistance is not available for this position
This position is not eligible for Visa sponsorship

401 S Tryon Street, 24th floor, Charlotte NC
7001 Westown Parkway West Des Moines, Iowa
4101 Wiseman Blvd. San Antonio, Texas
1301 Solana Blvd, Westlake. Texas

Job description

As a manufacturer of quality interconnection products marketed primarily to customers in a test or measurement environment. The majority of products are both designed and manufactured at the primary facility in High Point, North Carolina. For well over 50 years we have provided connectivity solutions to customers worldwide in both military and commercial applications. With the support of numerous global offices around 40% of products are exported. The company has experienced significant growth over the last two years and is seeking to expand further.

Position Overview:

As we become more successful in offering services and full solutions, in addition to our core product line, we have an increasing requirement to provide support to our sales and applications team. This role will provide support in 2 primary areas:

Assisting in preparation of quotations for services offered.
Data collection and preliminary analysis for major projects to ensure that we are meeting customer objectives.

Responsibilities include:

Assisting in preparation of service-based quotations.
Transfer customer and internal data into our quote preparation system.
Determine costs and lead times for vendor items.
Calculate labor estimates to assist in the quotation process.
Importing data from external sources into internal tools to assist in preparation of technical proposals.
Collection and preparation of data for sales and marketing team analysis.

Education and Work Experience Requirements:

A.S. in business administration or engineering. A combination of education and work experience is an advantage.
Outstanding skills in Microsoft Excel including the use of pivot tables, formulae, and lookup functions.
Strong attention to detail.
Ability to multi-task and prioritize.
Good communication skills with the ability to accurately present data in a variety of formats.
Good team player.
A knowledge of wiring diagrams and schematics would be beneficial, although training will be provided, if required.

Position Description
Position Description

This section is required and must be completed.

General Purpose of Position
The Form Solutions Specialist plays a crucial role in our organization by leveraging their expertise in form development, business analysis, and project management to create efficient and user-friendly forms using our suite of form tools. This multifaceted role requires a combination of technical skills, analytical thinking, and excellent communication abilities to collaborate with various stakeholders and ensure the successful implementation of form solutions.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities




Form Development & Support (35%): Design, develop, and customize forms using our suite of form tools, ensuring they meet the specific requirements of each project. This includes creating form fields, designing layouts, and implementing advanced functionality where needed. This includes a solid understanding of JavaScript and SQL to enhance form functionality and integration capabilities. Apply these skills to customize form behavior, validate data, automate processes, and facilitate data retrieval and storage.



Business Analysis (25%): Collaborate with clients, stakeholders, and end-users to understand their form-related needs and gather detailed requirements. Translate these requirements into practical solutions and recommend improvements to optimize form processes and user experiences.


Project Management (20%): Lead form development projects from initiation to completion, ensuring they are delivered on time and within scope. Coordinate with cross-functional teams, prioritize tasks, set realistic deadlines, and proactively address any project-related issues or risks.


User Training and Support (15%): Conduct training sessions and provide ongoing support to end-users, ensuring they can effectively utilize the form tools and understand best practices. Troubleshoot technical issues, offer guidance, and address inquiries related to form development and usage.


Quality Assurance (5%): Perform rigorous testing and quality checks on developed forms to ensure accuracy, functionality, and compliance with relevant standards and regulations. Identify and resolve any issues or bugs that may arise during the form development process.


Other duties as assigned.




Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering or similar course of study; Master’s degree preferred
Two years professional development experience; experience in higher education preferred
Strong technical proficiency, including a basic understanding of JavaScript, HTML and SQL to develop new and modify existing code without the use of a tool.
Proven experience in form development, preferably using a variety of form tools. Elon’s tool suite includes Softdocs Etrieve, Microsoft Forms, Qualtrics, Adobe Sign, WordPress forms, and PowerApps
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to gather requirements, analyze complex workflows, and propose effective solutions.
Exceptional project management skills, with a track record of successfully leading projects from initiation to completion.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively interact with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
Demonstrated understanding of user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) design principles, with the ability to create forms that are not only functional and efficient, but also user-friendly and aesthetically pleasing.
Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.


Does this position require driving for the university?
No

This means that much of our work necessarily takes place in person.

Job Title: Business Planning Operations Specialist – Field Operations Rotational Program
Job Description:
Are you a soon to be college graduate (Fall 2023/Spring 2024)? Are you looking for an opportunity to put your skills to use? The Field Operations Rotational Program offers participants valuable hands-on experience to jumpstart their careers in Field Operations. This immersive program provides real-world projects and problem-solving opportunities that support professional development for recent graduates within Business Planning/Finance & Accounting degree programs.

Candidates will participate in a 1-year rotational program to learn the fundamentals of our business and make an impact on the future of Field Operations. Here, you will have the chance to work with Spectrum business leaders to help you navigate our organization and grow into a successful career.

JOB SUMMARY:
Responsible for the implementation of consistent standardized operating practices to ensure stable service delivery aligned with the Company’s and Field Ops initiatives and expectations. Partner with Field Operations management to plan and evaluate needs for development and/or improvement.

Responsible for assisting in management, planning, monitoring and reporting on key projects. Coordinate project details, data collection, reporting and communication to successfully drive project efforts.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Join and support the collaborative culture of Spectrum and build /leverage a network of peers and mentors across business areas within and outside Field Operations.
Participate in or lead small projects assigned to you and fulfill all objectives laid out at goal setting.
Surpass the learning plan to engage with each function during immersive learning experiences and understand interdependencies between functions that impact business results. Scope process improvement opportunities for the team; driving consistency across systems, processes, data and analytics, and reporting.
Recommend and present persuasive rationale for process improvements and enhancements in projects and assignments to add significant value to the business.
Own assigned positions of responsibility through assignments / rotations and deliver results in challenging situations.
Use analytical tools to assess business challenges that you encounter during your program and identify root causes.
Go beyond analysis to find creative problem-solving techniques to address business needs appropriately.
Develop a deeper knowledge base across our business units and products.
Communicate with impact, ask effective questions in various situations to gather information, uncover needs, and create solutions to foster a truly collaborative and consultative relationships.
Define key industry terms and concepts important to our business and use advanced business knowledge to identify and implement solutions.
Periodically engage with senior executives to present and discuss your progress.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Skills/Abilities and Knowledge



Ability to learn from all experiences and opportunities.
Must demonstrate proven ability to work independently, be open and flexible to change with some mentorship, in a fast-paced team environment.
Proven analytical skills with ability to recommend and develop tactics and measurable implementation.
Must possess strong work ethic.
The ability to understand and analyze complex business issues.
Must be self-motivated. Is proactive and takes advantage of opportunities without being asked. Seeks opportunities for self-improvement.
Excellent presentation and communication skills with the ability to communicate to senior leadership.
Proficient in Microsoft Office.


Education
Fall 2023/Spring 2024 Bachelor’s Degree in Business Planning/Finance or Accounting.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Prior Internship experience with Fortune 500 Company.
Leading Projects in a cross functional matrixed organization
Business Analyst/Data Analyst Experience

WORKING CONDITIONS
Office environment
Some travel may be required

Job Title: Senior Associate, Senior Security Operations Analyst
Job Description:
Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today’s most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It’s also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it’s no wonder we’re consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Working Mother Magazine, Diversity Inc. and others. If you’re as passionate about your future as we are, join our team.

KPMG is currently seeking a Senior Associate, Senior Security Operations Analyst to join our Global Information Technology Group which is part of KPMG International.

Responsibilities:

Be accountable for managing daily security operations which focus on key business platforms ensuring integrity of changes which impact information security and control management
Collaborate with various Information Technology Services (ITS) Global teams on different security operations related tasks, analyze cloud compliance/vulnerability reports, technical review of exception request; help and guide junior team members to manage the service request queue (ServiceNow)
Work together with Automation, Cloud Security Posture Management and ITS Global Operations teams on the implementation, automation, and maintenance of new Cloud security monitoring policies within our cloud environment
Build a deep understanding of current environments, researching, and advising on IT infrastructure
Assist the Security Operations Group (SOG) Manager with daily management of core security operations process
Coordinate with platform Information System Security Officer with the daily management of information security related queries and requests

Qualifications:

Minimum five years of recent security and IT experience is required
Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in computer science, computer networking, computer security or a related field, or equivalent work experience
Experience with Microsoft Azure is preferable: Microsoft Defender for Cloud, Azure Policies, Azure Application Gateways, Web Application Firewalls, Network Security Groups, among others
Network infrastructure knowledge on TCP/IP and Internet protocols
Experience with Palo Alto Prisma is preferable
CISSP, CISM, CCSP (Certified Cloud Security Professional) or CCSK (Certificate of Cloud Security Knowledge) certifications or equivalent experience is preferred

JOB DESCRIPTION


CB Commercial Card Onboarding: Product Implementation Specialist – VP – 603

Role Summary:

The Card Product Implementation Manager will be responsible for the overall client experience and project management of commercial card product implementations. This role will contribute expertise to defining new J.P. Morgan Chase Commercial Banking solutions in conjunction with Sales, Consulting and Product teams. Manage client solutions from inception to completion within specified timeframes.

Job Responsibilities:

Partner with clients to understand their business objectives in order to offer the best suitable technical solutions and data integration options
Translate requirements from business client to JP Morgan technical teams
Evaluate a technical solution impact to client's business processes
Successfully manage multiple projects simultaneously
Use of MS Tools to document solutions and ongoing progress
Use of workflow tools to engage various partners across the business to deliver both technical and operational pieces of the solution.
Use of workflow tool for status updates and document repository

Ultimately, you’ll be expected to own our Client’s Onboarding experience. This includes:

Representing us as the client facing, technical contact responsible for a successful end-to-end client experience during complex treasury product implementations with Commercial Banking clients around the world. Managing client and internal partner expectations with consultative advice regarding technical aspects of treasury solutions including – RFP responses, client presentations and client visits. Scope client requests and translate business requirements into detailed technical specifications for treasury services. Use Microsoft Office tools to document scope, meeting agendas and minutes and project plans. Use workflow tool for status updates and document repository. Manage client and internal partner expectations by establishing timeliness and dependencies with the goal to exceed expectations. Demonstrate creative problem solving and judgement. Be empowered to escalate when support is needed to remove obstacles to success.

Required Qualifications, capabilities and skills:

An appreciation for being a ‘keeper of our brand’ with 6+ years of applicable experience and a passion for delivering a consistent, stellar client and partner experience
Technical project management experience or experience with complex treasury implementations and comfort in a fast paced, dynamic client-facing environment
Ability to clearly communicate, partner and influence - leading others to a common goal

About the Role

You will be supporting the Segment General Managers to develop and execute key tactical Go-To-Market opportunities. You will manage projects, execute product launches, and Go-To-Market program opportunities that will continue to accelerate the growth trajectory. Furthermore, you will also own Go-To-Market planning and execution of those plans in each of our geographical markets.

Responsibilities

Supporting Go-To-Market strategy in multiple markets and segments by planning and executing product launches and growth initiatives.

Have Go-To-Market experience in Project Management, Business Analysis, Sales, Marketing, or Product Operations.
Demonstrate a successful background in collaborating, motivating, influencing, and coordinating other stakeholders to deliver results. In particular within complex matrix environments.
Have the ability to generate Go-To-Market planning, implementation, and product launch plans a priority for deliverables.
Be able to master the art of impactful presentations by effectively communicating complex ideas and recommendations.
Be implementation-oriented with recommendations grounded in reality, willing to roll up sleeves and ‘get hands dirty’ as required.
Possess expertise in utilizing CRM (Salesforce) and marketing automation tools. Agile/Six Sigma experience is recommended.

JOB
This position performs intermediate skilled technical and operational support work assisting the Director with planning, directing, coordinating, and supervising the elections process and related work as apparent or assigned.Grade 22

EXAMPLE OF DUTIES
Assists in Implementing changing election laws, coordinating elections, and supervising activities of the office. Oversees set up of One-Stop voting sites and network. Sets up all E-poll books according to polling place. Assists in machine logic and accuracy. Administers Campaign Reporting schedule Provides requested information such as registration analysis, voting analysis, lists of precinct officials, precinct locations, precinct political committees, and campaign reports to the various candidates, campaign committees, party chairs, news media, and the general public. Provides requested information regarding the North Carolina Campaign Reporting Act to prospective candidates, candidates, elected officials, media, and the general public, provides and notices of required reports to Candidates. Assists with audits submitted campaign reports, reviews, and verifies records to ensure that required information is provided and correct. Assists with polling sites database Prepares campaign reports for public viewing. Assists with planning for and coordinating all early voting site, including the set up and close out of all sites. Assists in training of one-stop workers. Assists in canvassing the returns of all elections. Explains policies, laws, rules, regulations, and procedures to the public and other inquiring parties. Assists with voter registration verification procedures. Assists in ADA compliance and Campaign zones at polling places. Assists in processing and verifying petitions. Assists in preparing and conducting elections. Assists with state reporting requirements Interacts with elected officials, candidates, the North Carolina Campaign Reporting Office, the general public, and the media. Performs other related job duties as assigned

SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION
Knowledge of County and departmental policies and procedures.Knowledge of computers and job-related software programs.Knowledge of Chapter 163 of the General Statutes of North Carolina, with specialized knowledge of Articles 20, 21, and 22 f . Knowledge of requirements related to registration processes, voting procedures, and of the maintenance and protection of voting registration lists and records. Knowledge of NVRA, HAVA, and UOCAVA policies and procedures. Knowledge of Federal, State, and County laws and procedures pertaining to elections and the maintenance of Jackson County election records. Knowledge of office management techniques, including the ability to organize workflow and coordinate activities. Knowledge of effective supervisory practices. Skill in prioritizing and organizing work.Skill in oral and written communication.Skill in the operation of a computer and correlated software.Ability to plan and supervise the work of others. Ability to work well in a team environment. Ability to analyze, interpret, recommend and implement policy and procedural guidelines. Ability to learn and apply new skills Ability to undertake self-development activities Ability to seek increased responsibilitiesAbility to communicate effectively in person and by telephone. Ability to understand and follow oral and written instructions. Ability to answer inquiries independently and coordinate a variety of resources in acquiring information. Ability to be impartial, fair, and professional when working with candidates and voters.Ability to effectively communicate and interact with management, employees, members of the general public and other groups involved in the activities of the County as they relate to the department.

Company Description:

Aspida Holdings Ltd., through its subsidiaries (collectively “Aspida”), is focused on providing retirement and reinsurance solutions, having operations in the U.S. and Bermuda with total assets of $11 billion as of June 30, 2023. Aspida, through its U.S. platform – Aspida Life Insurance Company – is focused on leveraging technology and agility to help clients achieve – and protect – their dreams. Its Bermuda-based reinsurance platform, Aspida Life Re, is focused on providing efficient and secure life and annuity reinsurance solutions. Aspida seeks to be a trusted partner in its clients’ financial security while driving its growth by doing good for the communities it serves. Aspida is backed by Ares Management Corporation, which, through the Ares Insurance Solutions team, provides dedicated investment management, capital solutions and corporate development support. For more information, please visit aspida.com or follow them on LinkedIn, Facebook.

Who We Are:

Sometimes, a group of people come together and create something amazing. They don’t let egos get in the way. They don’t settle for the status quo, and they don’t complain when things get tough. Instead, they see a common vision for the future and each person makes an unspoken commitment to building that future together. That’s the culture, the moxie, and the story of Aspida.

Our business focuses on annuities and life insurance. At first, it might not sound flashy, but that’s why we’re doing things differently than everyone else in our industry. We’re dedicated to developing data-driven tech solutions, providing amazing customer experiences, and applying an entrepreneurial spirit to everything we do. Our work ethic is built on three main tenets: Get $#!+ Done, Do It with Moxie, and Have Fun. If this sounds like the place for you, read on, and then apply at aspida.com/careers.

What We Are Looking For:

Under the general direction of the Director of Application Services, the Senior Product Owner will develop system requirements and track completion of development across all phases of the software development lifecycle (SDLC). The Application Services team provides support for Policy Admin platforms and configurable systems such as workflow, customer relationship management, data transport, and printing services. A successful candidate will be an excellent communicator, take ownership of tasks and drive them to completion, and has experience as a Product Owner or Business Analyst within an IT function and/or demonstrable experience within the Insurance. Experience with development of Insurance products is highly desired. They will work cross-functionally with stakeholders across Aspida departments as well as with offshore development and QA. This role is located in our Durham, NC office and 3 days per week onsite are required.

What You Will Do:

Become an expert on assigned systems and own communication with end users.
Lead discussions with cross-functional teams to develop system requirements.
Refine and document requirements, tracking them across development, testing, and deployment.
Assist development of the policy administration system including new product builds
Prioritize multiple competing projects and manage the issue backlog.
Drive project execution and proactively report on project progress, risks, and blockers.
Perform analysis for defects and system enhancements.
Create process flows for business procedures and assess potential enhancements.
Maintain high quality documentation.
Liaison with third party vendors.

What We Require:

5+ years of experience working within IT in applications support, software or database development, or requirement gathering.
5+ years of experience in insurance domain; annuity/life preferred
Product Owner or Business Analyst experience in an Agile setting.
Experience with Insurance Product development and calculation validation preferred.
Bachelor’s degree with coursework in computer information systems and technologies or demonstrated competency through related work experience.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to establish professional relationships and collaborate across multiple teams.
Ability to prioritize work between multiple, concurrent projects in a fast-paced environment.
Track tasks and follow up with stakeholder to drive project to completion.
Collect and document requirements through discussions with business stakeholders and technical leaders.
Manage SDLC through enterprise tools such as JIRA.

What We Provide:

Salaried, DOE
Full-Time
Full Benefits Package Available

What We Believe:

At Aspida Financial Services, LLC, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As such, Aspida does not and will not discriminate in employment and personnel practices on the basis of race, sex, age, handicap, religion, national origin or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. Hiring, transferring and promotion practices are performed without regard to the above listed items.

Please review the following job description:

Manages Truist’s Corporate cybersecurity legal, regulatory and industry compliance. Leads and develops strategies for closing cybersecurity management compliance gaps, partners in the analysis of legal, regulatory and compliance initiatives. Manages cybersecurity risk and compliance functions which include: establishing cyber polices and standards designed to safeguard the firm’s systems and data, performing assessments to identify, manage and mitigate cyber risks, assess and guide remediation of compliance gaps, maintain library of cyber risks and controls, and evaluate and track the cyber program maturity, security advisor to business segments and functions.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.

1. Support development of the cybersecurity senior leadership reporting governance model across committees and forums for reporting to Truist technology, business executive leadership, and the Truist Board

2. Support cybersecurity department submissions for senior leadership reporting (Risk Domain Working Group, Information Security Oversight Committee, Technology Management Committee, Technology Risk Committee, Operational Performance Reviews, Board Reporting, SOX Disclosures, ESG reporting, special projects, etc.)

3. Develop special topic and capability overviews for senior leadership reporting with assistance of cyber subject matter experts

4. Review existing cybersecurity committees and forum meeting content for consistency and improvements

5. Maintain reporting calendar and communications to cybersecurity leadership and department team members

6. Attend all senior leadership reporting oversight checkpoint meetings

7. Create and maintain reporting templates (i.e., capability, focus area slides, etc.) and guidance (font size/color, best practices, and verbiage examples)

8. Interface and partner with the cybersecurity leadership and department team members, in addition to oversight teams to provide reporting requests on a timely basis.

9. Maintain an understanding of technology related federal regulations and industry frameworks/standards related to cyber reporting regulatory requirements (i.e., FFIEC, CRI Profile, NIST CSF, NIST 800-53, COBIT, ISO, GLBA, PCI, SOX, etc.)

10. Support the cybersecurity senior leadership team's direction and communicates individual and team priorities and deliverables for the team against expected results.

11. Support highly complex and visible projects with notable risk and complexity

QUALIFICATIONS

Required Qualifications:

The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

1. Bachelor’s degree preferably in regulatory affairs, business, organizational or compliance law, or financial services

2. Ten years related experience at a large financial institution performing legal, compliance, or other duties such as risk management and/or project management

3. Ability to lead projects of moderate complexity and notable risk exposure.

4. Strong knowledge on cybersecurity risks, frameworks, best practices and industry/regulatory requirements. Knowledge and experience in use of cyber security governance programs.

Preferred Qualifications:

1. CISSP, CISA, CRISC, or CISM Certification

2. Master’s degree or MBA and 6 years of experience in business analysis or an equivalent combination of education and work experience

3. Significant proficiency in designing reporting within Microsoft PowerPoint

4. Experience with designing and aggregating reporting for executive leadership and Board audiences

5. Banking or financial services experience Prior management or leadership experience

6. Experience in supporting large-scale complex projects from beginning to end

OTHER JOB REQUIREMENTS / WORKING CONDITIONS

Sitting

Constantly (More than 50% of the time)

Visual / Audio / Speaking

Able to access and interpret client information received from the computer and able to hear and speak with individuals in person and on the phone.

Manual Dexterity / Keyboarding

Able to work standard office equipment, including PC keyboard and mouse, copy/fax machines, and printers.

Availability

Able to work all hours scheduled, including overtime as directed by manager/supervisor and required by business need.

Travel

Minimal and up to 10%

XPO is a top ten global provider of transportation services, with a highly integrated network of people, technology and physical assets. At XPO, we look for employees who like a challenge and can communicate effectively in all situations. We want to leverage your skills and years of experience to drive positive results while ensuring a bright future for yourself and XPO. If you’re looking for a growth opportunity, join us at XPO.


As the Lead Analyst, Sales Operations, you will be responsible for leading channel segmentation and associated data analytics for the Less-than-Truckload (LTL) business unit. You will partner with senior sales leadership to analyze customer and market data, develop and manage customer profiling processes, and identify optimum leads for our business. You will drive efficiencies in our data management processes through automation. You will use data and algorithms to help the team develop territory structures and goaling for the sales force. We’ll count on your skills and years of experience to enhance our sales force effectiveness, drive loyal customers, and lead a team to deliver exceptional results.


Pay, benefits and more.

We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), life insurance, disability and more.


What you’ll do on a typical day:

Lead annual channel and account segmentation processes including account profiling and prioritization
Maintain customer market data including vertical and industry classifications, transportation spend and XPO potential, and key criteria for external reporting
Provide governance for account classification/segmentation changes throughout the year
Develop data audit processes and dashboards to ensure data accuracy and integrity
Collaborate with extended Sales Operations team and Sales Leadership to guide territory design and goaling processes to ensure equality
Coordinate with extended Sales Operations and Sales Leadership to analyze business trends at segment level (e.g. vertical, geographic, freight profile, etc.)
Drive education and cleanliness of SalesForce.com data to improve overall pipeline management
Lead reviews of existing processes to identify and implement improvements through technology or process enhancements (automating daily/weekly reports through Alteryx, creating Salesforce and Looker Dashboards for scalability)

What you need to succeed at XPO:

At a minimum, you’ll need:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent related work or military experience
4 years of Sales Operations experience in a business-to-business environment

It’d be great if you also have:

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Supply Chain Management, or Marketing
Strong executive presence and proven ability to work cross-functionally leading through data
Salesforce Administrator Certification
Alteryx Designer Certification
Availability to travel 10-15% of the time

Job Description:
Req Id: 4930
Job location: Charlotte, NC, US, 28277

Where you'll work:
Our flexible, hybrid work model offers the option to work remotely or in the office.

How you'll contribute:
As a Business Management Senior Analyst, you'll be responsible for business operations across the Variable Annuities (VA) Asset Liability Management (ALM) team and key stakeholders across departments. This includes owning and managing risk & control policies and procedures, as well as various project work.

In this role, you'll get to:

Lead work across business partners to analyze, design, and implement solutions that drive standardization, efficiency and quality of processes, including workflows and controls.
Lead process walkthroughs with team leaders across impacted business areas, along with risk and audit.
Develop and maintain documentation of policies and procedures for VA ALM, including model risk, controls, and business continuity.

We're looking for people who have:

Experienced business manager or analyst with at least 5-7 years of experience.
Advanced knowledge of risk and control frameworks along with internal and external audit requests.
Insurance industry hedging, valuation, capital, and regulatory knowledge a plus.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite.
Organized with a never-ending drive for constant improvement.

Position Description





Service Market Logistics (SML), part of Volvo Group Trucks Operations, serves all brands and business areas by managing and optimizing service parts availability and distribution to secure customer uptime. Through our operations, we provide world class service focusing on delivery precision, quality, continuous improvement, cost efficiency and synergies delivering value all the way to our customers. We embrace innovation and new technologies and work with environmental care and sustainability at heart. Our footprint consists of 40 distribution centers and 3,800 employees worldwide, and we strive for an innovative and diverse workplace, exercising the Volvo Group values with high focus on Customer Success. We are Proud to Deliver. Making a Difference. For People. Every Day.

SML North America (NA) is a part of SML and has about 1,000 employees across the United States, Canada, and Mexico. We operate the Central Distribution Center in Byhalia, MS as well as Regional Distribution Centers across the NA region.

Mission & Purpose:
The Cost and Inventory Manager is part of the SML NA Business Control team and will report directly to the Director of Business Control.

The Business control team is responsible to secure the financial reporting is done in an accurate and timely manner. Even more important, the thorough analysis of the performance is critical to support the SML NA team to take the proper decisions to achieve the Volvo Group’s strategic objectives.

One of the most interesting reasons to join the Business Control team is that we work cross-functionally with all SML departments, with all the different Business Areas and supporting four different Brands - Volvo Trucks, Mack Trucks, Volvo Construction Equipment and Volvo Penta. What we do every day in SML has a direct impact on the satisfaction of Volvo Group customers.

With us, you can continuously develop yourself, improve your own professional skills and drive change together with committed people!

Scope and Influence:

The manager’s ability to lead and develop direct reports is critical to the success of this role. Analytical skills to understand past data and future trends, with a holistic view, is just the basics. Your role is to use this information and proactively identify actions to improve performance, communicate those effectively and drive the changes cross-functionally when applicable.

In addition to a continuous improvement mindset, the manager may understand the End-to-End impact of different actions and decisions to secure satisfaction of our customers.

Essential Functions:
Continuously improve the way you work, develop yourself and develop your peers.
Effectively manage and develop direct reports.
Responsible for SML Standard Cost of Sales calculation and process.
Secure overall quality of inventory financial results. Responsible to challenge inventory levels and identify opportunities to be worked on by a cross functional team.
Responsible to reinforce that all financial processes are being followed, challenged and adjusted to secure continuous improvements.
Champion efforts to identify and eliminate non-value-added activities.
Work closely to all other members of business control team to identify opportunities and prioritize resources as needed to increase performance.
Lead financial review meetings with different stakeholders as needed.
Secure compliance with Volvo Financial Policies and Authorization framework.
Other duties as assigned by management.
Minimum Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business Administration, Economics, or related field.
MBA or advanced education is a plus.
Minimum of 8 years of business analysis experience.
Experience in logistics, parts distribution or service sales preferred.
Experience leading people is required, minimum of 3 years preferred.
Necessary Skills:
Proficiency in the English language is required.
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills.
Capable to communicate effectively considering different audiences.
Teamwork and cooperation - critical factors to the success of the team and motivation of the individuals.
Strong analytical skills.
Advanced Excel skills required, Power BI highly desirable.
Experience in SAP and Business Objects required. ESSBASE, VGCS preferred.
Creative thinking and innovative problem solving.
Unafraid of failure, willingness to learn and continually improve.
Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced team environment striving towards operational excellence.
Ability to be coachable and comfortable with direct and transparent communication.
Demonstrated ability to achieve goals with minimum supervision and ability to drive initiatives to completion.
Market Logistics offers the opportunity to learn about, and impact, all our North American brands. In addition, we offer:
Health, vision, and dental insurance
Competitive compensation
Generous ETO (earned time off)
401k with matching



About us

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.


Who we are and what we believe in
Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.


Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join Volvo Group. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.


Group Trucks Operations encompasses all production of the Group’s manufacturing of Volvo, Renault and Mack trucks, as well as engines and transmissions. We also orchestrate the spare parts distribution for Volvo Group’s customers globally and design, operate and optimize logistics and supply chains for all brands. We count 30,000 employees at 30 plants and 50 distribution centers across the globe. Our global footprint offers an opportunity for an international career in a state-of-the-art industrial environment, where continuous improvement is the foundation. As our planet is facing great challenges, we - one of the largest industrial organizations in the world - stand at the forefront of innovation. We are ready to rise to the challenge. Would you like to join us?

Job Title: Logistics Analyst Advisor - Foreign Military Sales(FMS)
Job Description:
Clearance Level Secret Category Logistics Location Cherry Point, North Carolina Onsite Workplace

Public Trust: None
Requisition Type: Regular
Your Impact

Own your opportunity to work with the largest government agency in the nation. Make an impact by advancing the Department of Defense’s mission to keep our country safe and secure.

Job Description

Supports PMA-261 customer logistics requirements for the FMS CH-53K program through the analysis; organization; planning and administration of various phases of day-to-day Depot Maintenace level requirements, provisioning; spares; maintenance and/or repair activities.

Analyzes standard contractual documents, technical data, customer usage data, customer maintenance practices, customer operation characteristics, and related reports for assigned contracts to determine spares provisioning or maintenance/repair requirements.
